column4: Forgetting how much it all hurts
column5: Lately I have not been doing my best. I have fallen down fast and hard and I am trying my best to keep my head up, but I just can't seem to stop using behaviors. It stinks because not only do I have to go through the actual act of doing it but what follows and guilt it just makes the whole experience worse but I just can't fight the urge/need to do it. I also forgot how tired it makes you. How honestly an eating disorder in general just makes you so tired. From changing clothes 16 times before leaving, from not being able to understand or control you perception of reality. Like do I actually not look good in this shirt because of my body shape or the color or is it my eating disorder making me see things that rant there. just so exhausting, having the eating disorder take away your ability to be able to tell how you actually look and feel as a human being. It makes days long because every second is a constant question of should I eat this or not. sometimes it tricks you and you think your happy and healthy and you remember something you ate or a bad moment and next thing you know you are right back at square zero doing all the bad behaviors you have exhausted yourself trying to prevent from doing again. And the guilt that has to be the most tiresome and just knowing what you are doing down to its core is wrong but not being able to stop is what hurts the most. wanting to stop so bad but not having control spending so much mental energy and time fighting with the voice to not eat something or to not keep it down only to lose in the end. It is all just so much. It truly is a disease not only does it take away from your joy of food but it takes away From your right to relax, when your too busy keeping youself over occupied throughout the day so you don't have time to eat or purge or think too much when you have no choice but to tire yourself out more because being tired is better than fighting the voices. Honestly, sometimes I'm scared to my bones that I'm going to have to live the rest of my life not being able to help the fact that I care more about my figure and I think more about calories in a day than I do about my actual self. I am scared that I will die believing calories were more important than me.

column5: Dinner time, off the rails, once starting to eat fine planned dinner, then grazing on and on till the point of feeling ill. Can't burden people close to me that love me, want to help but don't "get it" or see it as it's not very obvious. Like a "thief in the night" but this is still late aft or evening. Hubby very cooperative but I'm having to limit more and more what food I can allow in our home. My addiction always and only takes over in my home. Understand through yrs. of therapy and hospitals why and it's some sort of cycle that doesn't reflect any change in anxiety level or life situations. Today is a new day. Sleep o.k. Breakfast o.k. Things to do along with get treasured bike ride in and 1/2 hour walk later. It's almost like I can see my hands shake, like my food devil is just waiting to pounce. Never caring about the terrible consequences of what and where this destructive behavior leads me. Must interrupt this subconscious propaganda from the part of my brain that never forgets.

column5: Hi all, Wondering if anyone has a similar experience or words of advice. I had been in recovery from bulimia for about one month before finding out I was pregnant. My recovery was going well, I did put on some weight (at least I think so, I threw my scale out) and was starting to eat much more intuitively. I stopped overexercising, had my boyfriend take my step tracking/running watch and was just going for walks/short runs when I felt like it which was wayyyy less than I was. I then found out I was pregnant and am currently 7 weeks. I’m extremely bloated and my breasts are much bigger. Things are definitely feeling tighter. I have not engaged in any behaviors but my thoughts are so preoccupied on my growing and changing body. It’s been really difficult. I’ve been comparing myself a lot and know I have gained weight. I’m scared of gaining way too much weight during pregnancy. I’m not sure how to get out of this mind space.

column5: on September 18th I looked in the mirror after getting ready for a party and cried. I cried because I thought I was fat and I couldn't go out in those jeans that use to fit me. I cried because I didn't like how the outfit looked. I cried because I couldn't get the thought of what people would think out of my mind. I still went to the party but I hid myself in all black and a baggy sweatshirt allowing myself to sink away and hide. From that day on I've been failing. Failing my family and myself again failing my treatment process. I just can't get myself to eat enough, to not work out to much, I am back to that bulimic cycle. I was bad today I failed today I ate to be good but couldn't keep it inside me. I hated that I did it so I wanted to be healthy so I went to the gym but the gym shouldn't be my place of grace after what I did. I know I am only allowing myself it as an excuse to go so I can make my demons happy in my head. I am so tired, tired of failing, and of always having to keep myself so busy all the time so I'm not hungry or tempted to purge, tired of counting, and lying, tired of doing all this and still failing, still just not being thin enough not be pretty enough just not being happy enough. What is the point of It all I've had it both way thin and recovered, recover din big, I've had it in-between, I've had it on total opposites of the spectrum and I just can't find my happiness. I dont know what to do any more because apparently life just doesn't want me to win.

column5: Hi all <3I have been struggling with an eating disorder for almost 6 years now and have spent the last year or so really working toward full recovery and really digging into the emotions and underlying factors.I'm really struggling right now with the black & white thinking and behavior, for example restricting and overeating. As a result I feel sick, uncomfortable, brain fog and exhaustion.Is anyone also experiencing anything like this / have you in the past?It's becoming a vicious, continuing cycle that I can't break and it's making recovery so so difficult. I am so full of shame all the time, always feeling bloated and discomfort.Any tips and help would be so appreciated.
column9: Hi, jsokol! Welcome to the forums - we’re really glad you’re here. Your post had to be edited a bit because you included specifics about disordered eating behavior that can be triggering to others. You can take a look at our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We also want to make sure you know about the NEDA Helpline! In addition to these forums, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237, open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! And please continue posting.Since you also mentioned some concerning symptoms we are posting this list. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• experience pain in the lower legs • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit• experience dizziness, nausea, fever• wounds/cuts heal slowly• feel tingling in the hands or feet• blurred visionOr for any other medical concerns. If you experience anything on the above list, we highly recommend seeking help from a medical professional as soon as possible. Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation

column5: One of my big three. Eat slowly and today's biggy ending each meal (not some innocent addition that my addiction says: "that's all you'll eat and will be enough". The big lie, because it always leads me to grazing from this to that. So breakfast fine. Lunch fine. Dinner fine. Sounds so simple. I do make sure my meals are healthy, satisfying and delicious, too. Nice 1/2 hr. bike ride this AM, and 1/2 walk before dinner. Usual house chores. Nice phone call from my son and his dear wife. Sounds like a commercial for a TV sitcom. CC

column5:
Hello, it has been a while since I have posted a new thread.
I have been out of treatment for about 7 weeks now. At first I struggled, but eventually I thought I was getting better. However, I realize now, that is not the case.
Emotionally I am in a really rough spot. I hate my new body and long for my sick body back. I am very depressed and all I want to do is isolate myself, when I am not in class. My organization is really bad, but I cannot bring myself to care. I usually stress out about my homework. However this semester I have almost missed deadlines of when work was due multiple times. Every time I go out in public, I always compare myself to everyone walking past me. I find myself looking at pictures of myself at my lowest weight and cant help but miss it. My mind has been in a really dark place and i have found myself thaving really bad thoughts quite frequently. I just feel very hopeless right now. All I want is to have my old body back, yet I know that is not going to happen.
Has anyone else felt like this after treatment? What did you do?
column9: Hi meerkat123, We’re sorry you are feeling hopeless right now. The NEDA Helpline is here for support and can be reached at 800.931.2237 or chat with them online (http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/helplinechat) M-TH 9-9 EST and F 9-5 EST. Since you mentioned some bad thoughts and concerning feelings we wanted to post some resources in case you need support through these thoughts.  Please take care.

column4: Is it wrong that I don't care about my health, I just want the anxiety to go away?
column5:
(warning, a sea of extremely unhealthy thinking ahead)
Hey, so,
I recently relapsed into anorexiaI hate the feeling of not being thin enough, obviously, and I have only once ever reached a level where I felt content with my weight once, and it was extremely unhealthy.Thing is, I really honestly don't care about being unhealthy.
I drink, I do drugs, restricting is just another layer on top of it.
And I feel as if not being incredibly skinny is just plain stupid FOR ME, in that, I'm a female metal vocalist, and, well, to put it bluntly people listen with their eyes. Being incredibly skinny, even past the point that is generally considered attractive, just lends to my gothic alternative look. But, all that being said, I do what to recover, but not for health, I just want the anxiety of eating to go away.
What I mean by that, is, if I have only a few meals a week, I consciously know I'll still reach that look I want.
If a friend invites me out to dinner, if that's the only meal I've had in a certain amount of time, I know in my head it won't do any harm to what I'm doing.
But I feel this horrific anxiety even attempting to just have a certain amount of meals. Yesterday I managed to eat an entire meal, with a friend texting me encouragement about how I will be just fine doing so.I should be able to slim down just fine, and so it shouldn't bother me to eat with friends or something, but it does, it mortifies me, when I look at the food I start to panic.Somebody told me that any help is good help, and getting myself to eat is the best first step. But someone else told me that targeting the problem of that anxiety would only make it worse because I would be ignoring the "real problem".
She drew parallels with Bulimia, getting rid of the anxiety of eating by literally getting it out, something I used to do, but don't anymore out of fear for hurting my voice.I really just want to be able to eat.
I want that anxious feeling of trying to eat to go away.But the deeply repressed voice of reason trying to stop me from slowly killing myself, is telling me to ask, is it a good idea to specifically try to stop that anxiety... And nothing else? I am not proana, so please don't call me that, I would never want another person to do what I do, but I simply cannot get mentally behind fearing the health detriment of something that benefits me so much when I already do many unhealthy things. I'm anxious about posting this, but I really don't think I can start trying to stop that anxiety without at least asking about this. Sorry you had to read this, thank you.
column8: Dear pub03, we would like to

column5: I went to residential treatment for an eating disorder about two years ago, but I recently relapse pretty hard and am now engaging in behaviors every day. I have a therapist, dietician, doctor, and psychiatrist and I've been honest with all of them about what's going on, but I just can't seem to stop. My therapist is recommending treatment again, but I just can't right now. I would lose my job because I don't have FMLA yet (I just started 6 months ago), so I would also lose my apartment and have to move back in with my parents (I'm 32) several states away from where I am now, which also means I would lose my health insurance, so I don't know how I would pay for treatment anyway. And I'm getting a service dog in the next few weeks, so I need time to bond with him and cement his training. Plus, I'm in my final year of grad school and I am already graduating late because of a mental health crisis last quarter. Basically, residential or PHP or even IOP is not an option right now. There is no program or even support group where I live either. The nearest one is about two hours away. My therapist is great, but she doesn't specialize in eating disorders and there aren't many that do in this town. Does anybody have any ideas about how I can get some extra support? I found out that my old treatment program holds a virtual support group for alumni, so I emailed about that. In the past, I went to a couple of support groups, but there are none here. My old treatment center has a virtual IOP, but I think you have to live in that state to participate and I moved to a different state. I'm still going to call them about it though. Basically I'm asking if anybody knows of ways I could get more support in what is basically an eating disorder dead zone without going to treatment.

column5: I have had binge eating disorder since I was 12- I’m 23 now. I am so desperate to finally be able to eat out with friends and eat my moms home cooked meals again without being scared of bingeing. I’m ready to not have food dominate my life. I am currently seeing a therapist, and I want this so bad, but I’m also so scared to failing. Every single time I try to stop bingeing, I find myself in the same position again. I was so ready to not binge today, but here I am, just binged, and I feel sick. I feel so lost and hopeless.
column9:
Hello! For precaution, just because you mentioned feeling hopeless we just wanted to post some resources in case you need some support:  
Please take care!

column5: I'm just starting recovering today at home with my parent, we cannot afford professional help. I'm very afraid of getting re-feeding syndrome or not getting enough intake. We're figuring out how to set up meal plans and researching what I need but it's still very confusing and hard. I'm determined to get better but all these fears make me want to go back to my bad habits. Has anyone here managed to recover without professionals? Any advice?
column9: Hello! Just because you mentioned that you're concerned about re-feeding syndrome, for precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationPlease take care!

column5: i'm having body image issues right now and hope i can talk about it with either the psychiatrist or dietician today or tomorrow. i've been trying to squelch the feelings and say it doesn't matter; that who i am is way more important than how i look or what i eat, and i know logically it's true. but.... but i feel like i've gained weight, and i haven't even got off the maintenance meal plan, except to add some snacks, and i still want more food, like some sweets here and there. but i don't want to gain weight and inches, and i know for a certainty that i've gained inches. i'm trying to tell myself it's "food baby," as many call it in the refeeding process, since i starved myself for a while, but it's not working today. i feel fat, and yes, i know fat is not a feeling, but today, it stands for feel awful today. i know in the long run, it doesn't matter. i know that Jehovah God loves me, no matter what size i am. i know no one else is looking at me and judging me based on the inches i've gained. i know that i'm still the same person inside. and i still Feel Awful Today - FAT. it just is overwhelming me, and i need a reality check from someone who is more knowledgeable and has all the facts. it's starting to bug me, especially since i thought i'd convinced myself that i was done with all of this. and i am, to an extent, but i guess there's always going to be a remnant of "Maleficent" (my name for my e.d.) hanging on to me.
column9: Hi, alwaysthinking. We're sorry that you are experiencing these symptoms while in the hopsital. We hope that you're getting the help and support you deserve. We just wanted to post the signs and symptoms of a medical emergency just in case anyone on the forum reads this and sees that they experience similar symptoms. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation Please continue posting!

column5: It's kinda ironic in a way. I left my sister when I went inpatient for ED treatment and now my sister is in inpatient now. I get to be the kid alone and at home, and honestly kinda neglected. I have to pull myself together, and try not to stress out the family anymore than they already are. I need to  take care of myself, so my family can worry about my sister. It's really scary. I'm terrified to be alone. I was alone by myself for 4 hours. That is a record. I think the longest I've ever been alone. Some urges to move around, are hard to fight when no one is there to remind me to be still. I just feel guilty for sitting for hours studying. Even though I know I need to sit down to study. I can tell that those thoughts are ED's. Which should make it easier to dismiss them but it's not. I feel awful for my sister but kinda relieved she is finally getting the care she needs. She has a lot of SH behaviors and it was terrifying to see. I'm really feeling the pressure to recover and get my stuff together. I hope I can put my healthy copping skills to use and not resort to negative ones. It's comforting to know that I'm in a better place than last year so I can cope with this development better. Honestly worried about my mom. She is taking this really hard. Both kids having to go inpatient. Me, last year, my sister this year. Just wanted to share. I just feel like I'm floating. Everything is happening so fast, the house is so quiet. I think I can handle the challenge though. Alexo
column9: Hi Alexo_Eats! We're sorry to hear that you feel guilty and scared right now. Have you considered reaching out to the NEDA Helpline to guide you with navigating these challenges? The NEDA Helpline may be able to help you with using healthy coping skills. Give them a call at 800.931.2237 or chat with them online (http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/helplinechat) M-TH 9-9 EST and F 9-5 EST. I hope you find the support you are looking for!  Also wanted to post some resources you can pass along since you mentioned she has SH behaviors.

column5: I’ve told a few people about my ED. A coworker who needed to know, my mother, and three friends. The response has been absolutely terrible. My coworker (who is also a close friend) said he was sorry which was oddly the most helpful and sweet thing anyone has said, though I didn’t realize it at the time.My mother said I didn’t have one which is fair because I eat normally around family.One of the friends went on a tangent about how she never had the self control or willingness to throw up to have an ED and how she felt guilty for that.The next friend just changed the subject back to her relationship. And the last friend said straight up I didn’t have an eating disorder.I just give up at this point. I feel isolated and hopeless
column9: Hi immortalturtle! We’re sorry you are feeling isolated and hopeless right now. Since you mentioned some concerning feelings we wanted to post some resources in case you need support through these thoughts. Please take care.

column5: for that's how this is. Nibbling on this and that late last night before bed. Grateful for sleeping through the night (woke at 6 but went back to sleep till 7). Like I was going on some marathon. Couldn't get to my breakfast fast enough. Decided on one that would be easiest on my stomach.The veracity with which I eat is so scary. Like I'm someone else and I'm not. I am so sorry for everyone here that suffers but I wish there was another soul with BED. I use to be able to get away for a break. Not an option anymore. And the terribly sad thing is, I know there are people who cannot talk about this. My best friend whom I met at a facility said to me recently. I'm the only one she can talk to about this but right now she's shut off, 'cause she's trying some new system. My ED feels different from bulimia because I feel like I have to live with the pain of and results of my behavior. I don't hate myself. I've struggled my whole life just managing something I have to keep doing to live. How to explain I operate on two levels. The CC that takes good care of herself and the subconscious part that pushes me and demands gratification and the sensation of turning to food. Waiting, longing for the oasis of blessed remission that I get every so often. Whoever reads this, thank you. I can't walk around and complain about this. There is no program of any sort here. And, I spent 15 yrs. in a well known support group system (not helpful). Hope to go for a bike ride later. Debating whether or not to post this. Well here goes. Hope I haven't upset anyone. CC
column9: Hi, CC - your post had to be edited because you included details about disordered eating and weight stigmatizing language. Please take a moment to take a look at our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you in advance for helping to keep the NEDA forums safe and supportive!

column4: Binge eating/Anorexia cycle feels never ending
column5: I've been struggling with the binge eat, gain weight, then restrict cycle for years and years. I restrict and become too thin and people worry, and then suddenly I spend one night binging and its all I do for a period of time. I don't understand how no one has noticed this cycle of me being thin and then a little chubby over and over. My eating habits have been severely disordered since I was 14, I am almost 21 now. When I was 13 I was put into a residential treatment center for issues centered around depression and self harm. I feel my eating disorder really developed here. I dont think the staff were fully equipped to deal with my growing illness and responded by just making me eat 100% of every meal, many of them being pretty large. I heavily abused laxatives from 14-15, was always a little underweight as a teen, and the past 2 years or so have just been an endless cycle of binge and restrict. I feel so lost in this. I don't know how to reach out and let people know this is bigger than it may appear. I'm suffering so much and I know my body is too, constantly going from one extreme to the other. I also deal with irritable bowel syndrome so when I take in mass amounts of foods my body doesn't like I become very sick, but that doesn't stop me. I've also had two serious boyfriends who also dealt with eating disorders(bulimia) and I can't imagine that has helped me. I never feel happy with my body either way, but especially when I gain weight binging it destroys my confidence, I don't even want to go outside. I finally told my mom a few months ago how bad this was after I had lost a large amount of weight after a very painful breakup. I am currently on a waitlist for outpatient therapy at a treatment facility but I don't know how much longer I can wait. I've since gained the weight back and probably plus some. I'm currently in the binge cycle but I know soon I will break down and the restricting will return. I feel hopeless in this. Anyone been able to successfully recover from this? any support or advice is appreciated.
column9:
Hi, roseec. Thank you for posting. We're sorry to hear that you have been struggling for so long. You're not alone in this and we hope the forums provide you with the support you deserve. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. For precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationSince you mentioned self harm in the past we wanted to provide you with these resources in case you need to reach out for support in the future.  
If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column5: I hate myself and this problem. I wish I never started to binge eat. I wish I never got upset when my dad almost passed away and I did this to myself. Sometimes it's too much for me and if I can give up forever!! I would! I don't want this problem anymore. I don't want this life. I want my old life, I don't want to have this problem. I feel hopeless.
column9:
Hi London1621! We’re sorry that you are feeling so hopeless right now, and we’re glad that you reached out to the forums. We want you to know there are many resources available to you. Some of the language in your post concerned us. Please contact the following resources if you're feeling suicidal:
Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.org
National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.nationalsuicidepreventionlife.org
IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.org
Dial Help Inc.: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org
The NEDA Helpline is also available to support you - give them a call at 800.931.2237 or chat with them online (http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/helplinechat) M-TH 9-9 EST and F 9-5 EST. You are not alone, and recovery is possible.

column5: Hi guys, it has been a decent amount of time since I have posted here. Honestly I feel I have fooled myself that I was better because over the summer I was distracted and keeping myself busy and having fun. However, I have been back at college for a week and a Half now and after going about 3 months without purging today I purged. Along with this I find myself getting anxiety again when I have to eat or even when I think about food, I am restricting and I am already starting to feel my brain over working exercise. I signed up for boxing because treatment told me organized exercise is really good after recovery and I told myself I would go certain days but I find myself going X times a week instead. I can already see my self cracking after thinking I was doing so much better. I do not know why this is happening either I don't have a lot of stress right now and I am happy honestly. I just am confused as to were these thoughts are coming from, not to say that I am 100% happy with the way I look. Looking in a mirror still hurts my soul but not like it used to. I am nervous because school just started and it is only going to get more intense from here. I don't really know what to do to reel it i. I want to be healthy but I also feel that I need to lose weight so I feel better about myself. I think a big problem I am having is trying to find middle ground. I have a very big all or nothing mentality. Along with this I think that I still crave the control and I may be pre-planning for school to get rough. By giving myself control over this now maybe I can prepare for the bad stuff in the future. I don't know if that really made sense I'm kinda typing and thinking at the same time trying to just get my thoughts out.
column9: Hi, Charliebarr - welcome back to the forums! Your post had to be edited because it included some weight stigmatizing language. Please take a moment to take a look at our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you in advance for helping to keep the NEDA forums safe and supportive, and please continue posting. :)

column4: My therapist thinks I have an eating disorder
column5: My therapist told me that if I didn’t change and quickly, she’d call my psychiatrist and recommend he place me in an anorexia program. Sorry, I don’t know the terminology because this is very new to me.I’m 59 years old, a male, and have lost a lot of weight this year. I don’t eat very much but drink lots of water. Food and the process of eating disgusts me, but mainly I just want to disappear. I don’t deserve food. Although I’m not underweight yet, my therapist says I’m definitely malnourished. I was in the psychiatric hospital in June (I have bipolar), and after that my problem with food really accelerated.Does anyone have a comment? Am I in trouble? I am most appreciative for your thoughts.Andy
column9: Hi Andy! We are so happy you’re here. Your post had to be edited because you included specifics about calories and weight. Please leave numbers out of it when posting on the forum. You can take a look at our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We also want to make sure you know about the NEDA Helpline! In addition to these forums, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237, open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! And please continue posting. :)

column5: I sit here after what I hope was my turning point. I have a long history of disordered eating...that has led me to full blown bulimia. I have struggled with weight, binged, restricted, over exercised...I want to heal...I want to be happy again...I want to stop the madness. I have been unable tp share this with anyone in my life...I have been so ashamed and am hoping to connect with someone who understands and can possibly give me some resources and accountability.
column9: Hi, onedayatatime22! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Please continue posting!

column5:
Hi all! I'm newly entering the world of seeking treatment for years of eating disorders. It's strange to open up to myself about the realities of my experience with the disorder, much less to open up to my therapist, friends, and others. I'm wondering if anyone has specific advice or experiences they could share about coming to terms with recovery, as well as building a broad, honest, and authentic support network. My family is not supportive, and my friends are either unaware or uncomfortable with discussing eating disorders and mental health in general, so I find myself feeling lonely and isolated more often than not. I'd really appreciate any advice you all have to offer, or even just to hear about your own experiences.
Lots of love and healing!
xxMeagan
column9: Hi! Thank you for posting. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Please continue posting!

column5: I'm kind of worried and a little scared and very anxious right now. I've been doing well for most of the day except for when I was doing my own choice of exposures. Yes I'm doing my own PHP again since I can't get into a hospital at the moment. I was doing an imaginal and that alone was giving me a lot of anxiety because I have a doctor's appointment on Friday where I know I will be getting weighed again, and one part of me is afraid that because I've started eating again I'm going to freak out when I see my weight. I know logically it really doesn't matter and what it really means is that hopefully I get to go on vacation later on this year and it means I got to do my ministry soon. But, as our inner voice loves to lie to us and mess with our heads of course there's a part of me that is freaking out about something that hasn't even happened yet. But for the most part I've been able to talk myself out of it using logic and get through the day. Then came supper, which made my anxiety increase exponentially, and I've been in freakout mode ever since and now I'm beginning to think I do need the hospital after all. So I really wish the one Hospital would make a decision and let me know what it is so that if they don't accept me I can start calling other ones. Because I also really want to be out of the hospital before it's time for my vacation start. I really thought I could do this on my own oh, which really isn't on my own because Jehovah God is always helping me and is always with me. And maybe by tomorrow or even later on tonight I'll feel that way again. Right now though I'm freaking out and it feels like a major setback and it feels like I just cannot do this on my own or at least without professional help I guess I should qualify by saying that. I hope I have other options. I'm just scared. Even though I know logically I still am not eating very much , it seems like it's been too much too fast. I need to get myself some space from all of this anxiety.
column9: Hi, all! Each of your posts had to be edited due to the inclusion of detailed ED behavior, which can be triggering to others. Please double-check our Community Guidelines: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We want you to continue honest and open dialogues like this one, and we need your help to keep this a space safe. Also, remember that in addition to our forums, the NEDA Helpline (800-931-2237) is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! :) Please continue posting - and alwaysthinking, try not to be upset with yourself. Recovery is a process, and not an easy one. But recovery is possible, and you’re already on your way.

column5: So i’m going to post only weekly now because I think i’m recovering but I don’t know. My life has been pretty confusing and i’m realizing a lot of things. I’m not adding weight like I should be, even though I am eating how I am supposed to. I am at my lowest weight somehow. I haven’t told my boyfriend whatsoever, and i’ve been so depressed when I should be happy that my parents are being nice, my boyfriend is making me happy, and my best friend unblocked me (but is still mad and won’t tell me what I did wrong), and my other friend finally has data in France. But I am still so sad, and want to crawl in a hole and d ( i have no clue if we can say the word but hopefully you get what I mean). I have had many thoughts, and my anorexia monster yelling at me to burn off everything and work out ‘till I pass out. Also, my trigger isn’t numbers or anything like that, but its a person. He manipulated me to think he actually cared about me and telling me so many lies. And I have to see this person next week, and I have no choice but to see him. I really hate myself. Recovery is so hard and I want to give up. TimeToShine
column9: You mentioned some concerning symptoms so we are posting up this list to look out for. A person does not have to be underweight to have an eating disorder or to require emergency medical care for one. Seek medical help immediately if you:• accidentally or deliberately cause yourself a physical injury• become suicidal• experience confused thinking or are not making any sense• experience delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• feel disoriented; don’t know what day it is, where you are or who you are• vomit several times a day or have uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experience dizziness or fainting spells• feel too weak to walk or collapse• experience painful muscle spasms• complain of chest pain or have trouble breathing• observe blood in your bowel movements, urine or vomit• have a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• have an irregular heart beat or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• have cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or have a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr for any other serious medical concerns.Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time• struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationPlease get in touch with medical attention as soon as possible.  Also providing you with some resources:

column5: So, today I had another meal and a small version of a snack. I'm starting in gradually so my body doesn't go into shock and also so I can prepare my brain for regular eating. I've been really doing well and very little anxiety at all about the eating today. For which I'm very grateful. I know that this is because Jehovah God has given me the confidence I need, knowing that he is giving me the strength that I need as well. I have found that the thing that was worrying me the most and also the thing that was preventing me from being able to eat prior to this was having people's Voices From the Past in my head constantly telling me not to eat. And also they would tell me that if I did eat to compensate for it. So instead of just telling them to shut up and saying I wasn't going to listen to them I realized I had to listen to someone else. That someone of course is God. As well as my own mind. I'm reclaiming my power. It sounds kind of weird to say that because I've never had any power of my own to begin with so I'm just claiming my power for the first time ever. And it feels great. I was really worried that my trauma issues were going to screw up all of this and they haven't been an issue. It's as if because I'm not doing what their voices told me to do, they're not going to hurt me anymore with other trauma related things. And I really hope all of this is allowed to be said, moderators. I know this is a tricky issue and I don't want to trigger anybody but it really goes to the entire reason for my eating disorder and for my success today and the past two days. So I hope all of this is okay to be said, and I am just so grateful for yet another success. And I thank everybody for the support I've been getting.
column9: Hi, alwaysthinking! Your post was edited a tiny bit to remove meal specifics some might find triggering. Thank you for your mindfulness and for checking in with us in your initial post - please keep posting!

column4: Addicted about Food without feeling Fat or Sick.
column5: Hi. I am a newby ! I am french, married, 33 years old. So sorry in advance for my English .... :) I've started a diet almost 3 years ago because I wanted to feel good in my body. I've always felt bad with my body image (a little bit overweight and hairy.... :(...) For 2 years, i am bulimic :( :( :( But I really want to recover so I force myself to stop purging but I still have urges to binge so I gain weight ... I haven't stood on my scales for 10 days and I am so happy for that but I know I still am fragile and I can lose control more than I do now :( I've always felt an empty space in me... Like i can't do things alone.. I always need others and being reassured ! I'm still on track to recover but I need to find girls/women like me to share expériences and : - improving my English (It's like having a new passion .... I wanna improve my language skills to think about another thing than food) - Winning self esteem to do things alone and stop being perfectionist. - Stop being addicted with food (I've always thought about food for a long long time even when i wasn't sick. for you too ? I don't know why and that is why i am scared because I know i was addicted before being bulimic (and then restricting myself). indeed, before when i was with family or with friends, i didn't understand why i ate more than us i was really an addict ... even if i ate before... why ? just because bad habits I've created in my childhood ? Actually it's weird but i am more scared to be like before (aka thinking about food again and again even if i nourish myseff well, eating a large amount of food compared to others people) than gaining weight. i've never been fat but i've always ate more than others and i don't know why. my husband for example can forget to eat but not me .... why ? am i not normal ??? I would love to find some people to talk to trought Instagram, Messenger or Skype. if anyone is interested... it would be a pleasure ! :)
column9: Hi! Thank you for posting! We’re sorry to hear about your concerns so we hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums! We slightly edited your post as some details might be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. As per our guidelines, members of the forum aren't allowed to post personal information.  If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column5: Hi,I am hoping anyone here has any guidance on this topic. Growing up I was always a chubby kid, doctors always told me that I needed to lose weight. 2 years ago, I went on a certain diet and lost a good amount of weight over a certain amount of time. I lost at a very steady weight. After I went to college I became obsessed with losing weight and became anorexic. I would workout excessively and fast until dinner.I have been in recovery for about a year but have been struggling. I gained all the weight back and am now back at the weight I was when I was overweight in high school. I have been eating very regularly and still trying to nourish my body. Is this where my weight will most likely be because I’ve spent most of my life here? Will it ever go back down? Is there something I should try and do differently?Suggestions appreciated!
column9: Hi Buddy58,  We are glad to hear that you are finding support here on the NEDA forums. A portion of your post was edited and deleted due to the mention of specific numbers that may be triggering to other members of the forum. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines . In the event you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to call the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday 9:00am-5:00pm EST).

column4: I want to get better, but I have no hope
column5:
I don't remember when I noticed myself restricting. I grew up not having a lot to eat in the first place. Now that I'm older and have a job and can now purchase my own food, I thought I would be doing it all the time. Now I find excuses to avoid the grocery store as much as possible, and even when I'm there, the prospect of eating ANYTHING disgusts me. I've always been a picky eater, but I feel like it's leading to a terrible downfall.
I'm out here trying to reconnect with food. I'm trying to re-establish a relationship with it that I actually feel as if I benefit from. Here's what breaks my heart though.
I have a support system. The best one I could ask for, really. Yesterday really made me realize something. I always thought that if I could cook something for myself instead of whatever fast-food I could pick up, I'd start to love eating more. With that said, I went to the grocery store yesterday with some friends to buy ingredients. I cook the entire meal, they eat.... And I go home with my leftovers in tow. I look at the leftovers all day. I try to eat one. I take a bite and am immediately sick to my stomach. It's like my body doesn't want anything inside of it anymore. I feel hunger but I hate food. I'm not scared of gaining weight, in fact I've been TRYING to gain for almost a year now. The closest ED specialist works about 114 miles away from where I live, but I'm so desperate I might just be willing to make the trip. I hate that I'd be undertaking all of this while starting up school again, but god I'm tired of feeling sick and helpless all the time.
column9:
Hi! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. column5: So... My doctor's office called, in response to a call I'd made to them about tingling and numbness in my arms.  His response  and direction?  Go to the ER, since I'm presenting new symptoms and still not eating.  Thrill!! Not! Except today, I decided to take a mini trip and visit an art museum which is 2 1/2 hours away.  So instead of getting to enjoy this day, now I have to dread going to the ER when I get back.  I am not looking forward to it.  Still haven't heard from the eating treatment center.
column9:

Please take care!

column5: I'm upset and having the feeling to binge eat and I took the online screening test for eating disorders on this website and it always says the same thing. Please talk to someone. I hate myself right now and want to cry. Life sucks and it sucks that we all have this problem. I don't want it anymore. Please go away forever!!!!!

column5: So I've had bulimia for almost 10 months now and frequently worried about my teeth I've seen the dentist twice this year and every time I go in I explain to them that I am dealing with bulimia . They tell me my teeth are in condition except for some small cavities which didn't need to be filled for awhile but still I'm worrying constantly about them and was wondering how long before my bulimia truly ruins my teeth for good . I am currently recovering and puke a lot less then I used to but I really really just wish I never got this far and I'm kicking myself over it. I'm honestly jsut curious about other people with bulimia and how long you guys have been dealing with it and how your teeth are ?

column5:
Hello,
I'm wondering what to do. I have a mental illness and receive individual therapy for it but now that my symptoms from that have seemed to fade it's uncovered some severe anxiety and disordered eating. All my thoughts revolved around food, planning, exercise, and weight. I eat until I'm overly stuffed and almost throwing up. Luckily I have celiac disease and avoid processed food so I'm binging on certain food most of the time but I'm miserable. My brain tells me eat or die. I love my current therapist but she says she doesn't have experience treating eating disorders.I'm wondering if there are resources so she can continue to treat me or what treatment I should seek. I want a healthy relationship with food. I'm preparing for medical school and believe that food is medicine but the way I'm using it now is killing me. Any and all help is appreciated.
column9: Dear meggspaul, we would like to inform you that we edited your post to remove metions of specific food items that could be triggering to other members. You can review our community guidelines here. Based on your post, we would also like to pass on some crisis numbers. This number is really important to have: (800)273-TALK(8255). If you don't feel comfortable talking, please text "NEDA" to 741741 or visit one of these websites:http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ - online chathttp://www.dialhelp.org/?page_id=7759 -online chat or text 906-356-3337https://www.imalive.org/- online chatPlease be safe!

column5: Hi, I’m new to the community. I have been anorexic for 1.5 years now and lost weight ever since. I have attempted to recover several times but I’m too scared of gaining back all the weights and losing control. I have been eating X kcal/ day the last 2 weeks but gained none and I eventually decided to restrict this week. I ate today and used behaviors. I want to recover, I hate always having food thoughts, getting nervous, being annoyed and bad-tempered to my beloved ones. I know I need to gain weights but after the last 2 weeks, I gained none. I’m scared the gain will come this week or next week so I want to restrict again. I don’t know what is my ideal weight. I look thinner than those models I found online. I’m scared if I gain to the weight I want now, I will have to restrict later, and as I’m going on holiday 1 month later, I’m afraid I will gain even more. I’m such a mess. I want peace in mind. What should I do?
column9: Dear hvtk20, welcome to the NEDA forums! We would like to inform you that we edited your post to remove mentions of weight and calorie numbers, as well as specific disordered eating behaviors, which are not allowed on the forums. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding and please continue to post!

column5: Today has not been good. I've had zero motivation or desire to do anything and I've been super tired, primarily because of the zero sleep  I had the night before last. But the biggest problem today has been what keeps going round and round in my head. I'm having so much anxiety about worrying that the places that I called for treatment aren't going to accept me because they're going to think that I'm not sick enough. So even though I know my assessments over with and I can't amend it in any way, I have been doing stuff today that could be very detrimental to my health in the hopes that I will be sick enough. I feel like a total disaster. There's a part of me that just wants to give up completely and say forget it it's not worth it. And yet the fighter in me is saying no, I want to live. That's why I called those places. I know I need help. I can't do this on my own. But my experience with the ER has me so frazzled that I'm feeling like no one's going to ever think that I'm sick enough unless I'm at death's door. So today I'm doing stupid things that Might literally put me at death's door.  Not right away of course but quicker than I can get the help I need. I'm so frustrated with myself because it's like I'm wanting to be light-headed and dizzy today and I feel like I deserve to be and when I'm not getting light-headed like I have been for the past week, I feel like I'm not sick enough and I don't deserve the help that I know in my logical mind that I truly need. My feelings are really playing Havoc with my wise mind and logical mind. But then they always do. Big sigh. I just don't know what to do anymore. I've thrown this on God and I know he'll help me get through this , and I'm still hurting big time. I feel defective, like a total disaster, and like I'm always going to be on this Merry-Go-Round ride in and out of hospitals for the rest of my life. That nothing is ever going to get better in this system of things. I'm so sick of this. If those places don't accept me, I don't know what I'm supposed to do. Because I basically called the only places that accept my insurance. Hopefully, if they don't Neda can give me other resources that I couldn't find on my own. I'm just tired of doing this. I wish someone would do this work for me like my therapist or my psychiatrist. Kind of thought that's what they were supposed to do. I've been doing all the work my entire life and I'm tired. I just want someone to take care of me for once. And I know it's not going to happen but I still want it. We never stop hoping for a mommy. Someone to take care of us when we're sick. I never thought when you're sick that you're supposed to take care of yourself. And yet that's what I've done ever since I was four. I'm 43 now and I'm exhausted. Because basically, I've been sick since I was 12. Mentally sick that is. and the times that I was physically sick when I was growing up I still had to take care of myself. Is it any wonder I'm so messed up? Again, I feel like a disaster.
column9:

column4: Not "sick enough", and I want to give up
column5: I'm so discouraged and so frustrated and just so, so ... I received a call back from two out of the three eating treatment centers today. One of them recommends PHP for me which is not possible because there is none in my area that accepts my insurance. The other one says since it's all trauma-related I need to seek out a trauma Treatment Center. Well that would be lovely except that my doctor said that if I'm not eating properly then no trauma treatment Center is going to touch me with a ten-foot pole. I'm so frustrated because I feel like I'm constantly getting the runaround and that everybody is telling me go to somebody else. And the one trauma Treatment Center that I did try a few months back said that I've been in too many hospitals so they can't help me. Can't help me? So what does that mean that I can't be helped? What does that mean for me? Let me in there is no help for me? What am I supposed to do then? I'm so frustrated and scared and I feel so helpless and  beginning to feel hopeless as well. I have to wait till tomorrow to hear back from the third one. It's the one I've gone to twice before so I'm really hoping they'll accept me. I haven't eaten for a week so what am I supposed to do? How am I supposed to get any help? Is there any help for me anymore?
column8: Dear Blue44, we would like to

column4: I am struggling with my recovery
column5: The truth is I have never truly recovered from anorexia nervosa. My anorexia just has changed into binge eating disorder. I've gained weight only because on some days I was binging. But then on the others I ate even less then during the time I was anorexic. And on that days I thought that I should stop starving as I remembered my heart pounding in my chest before and I went to eat something. And than I binged. Sometimes it's not even that much - normal amount of food but I could feel I was binging. And it still is that way. I know I should try just eating enough, but I can't. It hurts me so much because it's not logical is not smart and I hate it. But I also hate my body - when I look at my stomach I wanna cry, I wear male shirts in a certain size (it's far from my actal size), I can't stop covering my body with blankets, especially when someone sees me, even if is so hot that I can't stand it... And I know why I eat like that. I am depressed. Nothing is intresting. And then food maybe is. I am on medication. I've told my psyciatrist about my ED and she's just dismissed it because my weight is appropriate for me. And I don't really want to draw attention to it again because I feel like I want to go back to being anorexic. It's so messed up and illogical that I hate this statement. I don't really know what I expect for an answer. I think I just want to talk about my ED because I am too tired with it and I know that I won't talk to anyone that knows who I am.

column4: Can't eat fruits or vegetables- ARFID?
column5: I'm 21 years old and I hardly ever consume fruits or vegetables. I'm extremely ashamed of this and have tried to change my eating habits, but can never follow through. It seems irrational to say this but I feel a lot of anxiety about trying to consume fruits and vegetables. I've experienced so much shame and self-loathing for this behavior, so when I heard about ARFID, I felt some hope that maybe this isn't my fault and that it's out of my control. I don't know if I meet all of the criteria for ARFID, though. I'm a healthy weight and lab tests indicate that I don't have any serious nutritional deficiencies. But I'm certain that my diet is affecting my health, and it may explain my weak immune system and low energy. I'm worried that more serious health problems will arise in the future. It also affects me socially, although I try to hide my shame behind self-deprecating humor. I experience a lot of anxiety about eating out or at dinner parties, because I'm worried I'll be served a salad and I don't want to make a scene. Could this be ARFID? I'm desperate to fix my diet, but maybe I should be treating it as an eating disorder rather than a matter of pickiness or stubbornness.
column9: Hello, thank you for posting! We wanted to let you know that here on the forums users aren't allowed to provide any type of diagnosis. The only way to determine whether you have an eating disorder or not is by speaking with a professional. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelinesYou also mentioned being concerned about your health so we just wanted to post up some signs and symptoms to look out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience anything on the above list, we highly recommend you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time • struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipationIf you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting and take care!

column5: Hey, I just joined this site and would love some advice! Some background: I’m 18 years old, and have been struggling with bulimia for about a year and a half now. During my junior year of high school, I was diagnosed with rumination disorder. It evolved into bulimia when I began to improve stress-wise, but couldn’t get used to keeping down food again. Now I’m in my last week of senior year, and my family thinks that the use of eating disorder behaviors is still because of the rumination disorder, so it’s been pretty easy to hide. On the surface, I’m at a good place in my life. I’m working two jobs that I love and trying to make it in the restaurant industry, hopefully as a cook someday (kind of in conflict, because I love cooking and food studies, but food is also obviously a huge stressor for me.) I know I won’t be able to succeed without recovering, but I have no idea how to open up to anyone without jeopardizing my jobs, friendships, and family relationships. I’m also starting college next year on a full scholarship, and I’m scared that being sick is going to screw it all up for me. I’ve been noticing some health problems in the last few months that could be linked to bulimia. I keep having a dull pain in my left shoulder that spreads down my arm, which made me drop two dishes at work last night. I’ve also had pretty consistent tightness in my chest and trouble breathing, a low temperature, and just general feelings of weakness and exhaustion (especially over the last week, when purging has been especially severe.) Has anyone else had similar problems, and if so, did you see a doctor? I don’t feel like I can tell anyone I’m bulimic, but I’ve heard stories about scary complications and I’m really not trying to die right now.Thank you for reading, any response helps!

column5:
I really wish I could post something in maintaining recovery, but I have to be honest.. I've relapsed hard. The only difference is the anorexia monster that almost killed me has been reborn as bulimia. Last night I was up until 4am, ordering delivery from multiple sources, and using behaviors. I'm really destroying myself.  i had to be at work by 6.But I went through recovery. I went to inpatient care. There was a time after that I really was taking care of myself. I don't think I have the willpower to do it all again. I need help snapping out of this really bad phase. I just needed to say it out loud, even if to the void. I don't think I could handle the stress and fear my support system would feel if they knew how badly I was doing.I read something in a book the other day and I couldn't help but cry. This monster has so much power over me. It's so scary to realize there are two beings maneuvering the same body, but the one who is out to self sabotage has so much more power."And I remember wondering why it was that eating something good could make me feel so terrible, while vomiting something terrible could make me feel so good."
- Amy Tan, The Joy Luck Club, Ch. 9
column8: Dear jwick, we would like to
column9: Dear jwick, we would like to inform you that we edited your post to remove specific disordered eating behaviors, which could be triggering to others. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding and please continue posting!

column5:
I have been in treatment for over a year and a half now, started in PHP and  have been struggling in outpatient for about a year. I am still trying to weight restore (which is strange to type out because "trying" seems like the wrong word since part of me still doesn't want to be doing this at all) and have a lot of ED thoughts constantly throughout the day.
But- I feel like finally in the last few months I have been doing so much better. My weight has slowly been moving in the right direction and I am open to so much more food wise and emotion wise. However, there is one big lie i've harped on and I know ED lives off of lies. A long time ago I thought my period had come back (it had been gone for a year or so) but I quickly realized that wasn't the case, but I knew it was a "good" thing so I didn't admit it wasn't true, and to make things worse I've kept up the rouse that I've had a regular cycle for a few months.
I feel so torn because I know this is in no way a good thing to be doing but at the same time, I feel like Im doing so well in other areas that my ED is convincing me to keep up this lie.  I know what I SHOULD do, which is be honest, but I don't know how to get myself to do it.

column5: Ok so i’m really scared. I have a doctors appointment today and this is the only chance i get to tell someone about my anorexia. I know i’m too scared to say anything and I know i’m throwing out a chance for help, but i’m not ready. My mom is going to be in there with me so even if I wanted to say something, she would be there to say i’m ok and shoot me down. On a more positive note, there is this guy at my swimming and not going to lie, he’s been making me feel so much better and I think I might have feelings. Sorry, I needed to get that out haha. Possibly a new support??? I’ve told him the things my mother said to me and he goes through the exact same thing. Just I doubt he is suicidal or anorexic. Anyways, I’ll give an update later on how i’m doing. Yesterday was really rough, so i’m hoping today is better and as you can tell, i’m feeling happy compared to yesterday. I hope everyone has a positive and good day!TimeToShine

column5: Hey y'all. I've struggled with eating and body image since I was a small kid. It's just snowballed as I've gotten older. I'm in my mid-30's now and at this point, I want to be healthy and I don't want to kill myself.

However, literally every inch of body fat has gone to my stomach, chest, and hips. It’s incredibly disheartening and I was wondering if anyone else experienced this during recovery. Will it redistribute as I continue to gain? Have I messed up my body forever? :(

column5: hi there, i'm new here! this is something that i literally never talk to anyone about (even though i very much need/want to) so i want to spew out my whole story to see how it feels. please reply if there's anything you would like to reply to :)my whole family is bigger (which is fine obviously). i spent my childhood eating unhealthy food and a LOT of it. i ate significantly more than my friends and weighed significantly more than them. i never really cared too much about it though. i'm not sure when the binge eating started but i'm assuming when i was in about fifth grade or so. i just loved food. i loved it so much and i didn't want it to go away--i always wanted there to be more. it instantly made me feel GOOD. i'm not sure if i was treating the food as a means of comfort so much as a means of pleasure, like a drug. i’m sure the two roles are intertwined somehow—I just know it felt so good.when the binging started to get really severe, that's when i began engaging with bulimia. i was 15 or 16. i remember working at a food chain for 8 hour shifts and eating our products that whole time, and then purging in the staff bathroom with the faucet running. after i got off, i would drive to a fast food place right before it closed, eat a huge meal plus dessert, purge, and then go to bed. this type of behavior continued into college. it's all a blur and kind of went on-and-off but i was purging close to every day for a couple years. it wasn't necessarily "working" in the way i wanted it to though--freshman year of college i was at my biggest. i know we're not supposed to post weight on here so i'll say i was definitely a big girl but not like, wildly overweight.in the middle of my sophomore year, my roommate started going to the gym (a place i never had been) and i tagged along once. idk what happened but i've been working out pretty much ever since. this was about a year and a half ago; i'm 20 years old now. i lost a bunch of weight. since then, i've been getting a lot of compliments and male attention. people are nicer to me but i could be imagining that. it's crazy how differently people treat me after the weight loss-- mostly strangers but also people i've known for a while as well. their eyes stay on me much longer. i must have been addicted to that, as i'm addicted to a lot of other things, because i've become quite obsessive about my eating in a more restrictive way.i've been pretty orthorexic in the past year or so. please forgive me with the terminology--i've never been diagnosed with anything as i've never really talked to anyone about this. it's terribly embarrassing and shameful to me for some reason, and i'm usually good about talking about tough subjects and knowing that not being neurotypical doesn't make you "crazy". it's all very contradictory to the whole way i present myself, which is extremely confident, carefree, and bold. it's all really such a bummer.back to the current state of my orthorexia/disordered eating. i binge from time to time of course, though what i consider a "binge" is less forgiving now and is sometimes what would be another healthy person's meal. i don't usually make myself throw up anymore because i'm terrified that the act of vomiting will eclipse the functionality of my birth control pill. however, if i've been drinking heavily, i will almost always make myself throw up as a "free pass." i do not miss the days of knowing where the single stall restrooms are located in every building; it made me feel crazy. but now i think i feel a new kind of crazy, still surrounded by some of the same stress, guilt, and compulsion.food is just extremely difficult for me right now; it's not easy. the way i shop for groceries is very restrictive: no desserts, very little carbs, no meat, no dairy, etc. i check the calorie counts on everything and want them to be very, very low. i even stopped buying one of my favorite foods and relatively healthy one, you would think. i kept binging on them, eating big bags of them in a day or whole jar over 2 or 3 days. i'm hoping my days play out so that I'll be able to skip a couple meals. i usually try to go as long as i can without eating before getting super hungry at night, and then i'll "give in". i'm also biking everywhere, trying to stay fit.what i hate is how extreme it is. food is simultaneously repulsive and arousing to me: i can think it is a deadly sin or god's greatest gift. there's just so much anxiety and thinking surrounding my food, in a way that isn't mindful--more disordered and obsessive. i also HATE the way my weight loss/history with ED's has made me look at other women's weights. from my friends and family to strangers, i'm always clocking people's weights, something i never used to do before the last year or so. i can't tell you how often i'll see a woman holding an unhealthy food item and think "that's why she looks like that", which is SO toxic and mean. if i see a woman who's thinner than me, i get jealous immediately, which i also hate. if i see a thin woman eating something unhealthy (or even worse, a thin woman repeatedly eating unhealthy food regularly without gaining weight), i get very jealous, maybe even mad.why i chose to write this post is because i feel crazy and i know i'm not. i'm a really smart and thoughtful young woman who unfortunately has a bit of mental illness when it comes to eating. it's just getting really disordered, and i had a bit of a rough week. it's friday now. last friday night, i went out with my friends (after not having eaten all day). when i woke up i was in the guy i've been seeing's bed, but i had no recollection of getting there. it was such a gross and scary feeling. i usually don't black out from alcohol like that. i had to go to work at 9 AM that saturday morning. once i got there, i felt okay at first and started drinking water. even after something like that happening, when i clearly needed food, i denied myself lunch. i felt like shit and had to take a "bathroom break" to physically lie down because i felt so week and sick. but i felt skinny. i ate at night and then my sister came into town the next morning. we walked a few miles (my idea of course) to this restaurant she really wanted to try. i fainted in the line at the counter once we got there. to be fair, it was very hot outside. but what if she wasn't there? actually, just what if someone who didn't love me undeniably wasn't thereafter our day together we went on a 4-day nature trip up in michigan. i binge ate the entire time. i don't know exactly why...probably a mix of triggers, boredom, my sister's eating habits and their influence, comfort, anxiety, the prolonged period of restriction beforehand, etc. but i feel crazy after my rough week, my rough few years.
