column5: I am having a hard time accepting I have an issue, but logically I know I do. I have lost a significant amount of weight this year and am now on the border of being underweight. I calorie count absolutely everything I eat. I avoid social situations because I get anxious about eating and not knowing the calories in the food, I also get very anxious eating in front of other people. I know I am borderline underweight, but I still feel that I need to lose more weight. I just don't feel thin. I work out several days a week. I also started training for a half marathon, but truly I hate running but I know it burns a lot of calories and I keep telling myself it's good for my health. Many coworkers/friends/family members have voiced their concerns about my weight loss, but I just deflect and say I am at a healthy weight and explain that I work out a lot. My boss has voiced concern numerous times because the weight loss is really noticeable and she sees that I don't eat very much while I'm at work (I work 24 hour shifts). I am getting very frustrated and upset because I am getting comments daily on my weight. I know these comments are out of concern, but it's frustrating because I don't see myself as thin like everyone else is saying. I don't feel that I am "wasting away." The comments are really getting to me. I opened up to my OB about my preoccupation with my weight, and she highly recommended I talk with a therapist. I resisted and she said if I lose any more weight I really have to go talk with someone. That was almost X lbs ago. I have made an appointment with a counselor several times. The first time I convinced myself I was fine so I subsequently cancelled the appointment. The past two times I requested an appointment they were scheduled on days that I work (and leaving work for an appointment isn't possible). I have sent another request for an appointment, I'm sure the next available appointment is several months out though. I don't feel "sick" so I feel that I can manage this on my own. I keep telling myself I will start maintaining my weight instead of losing, but I just can't bring myself to do it. I am not underweight so I feel that my eating isn't a huge issue. My boss wants me to make an appointment with an eating disorder clinic near me, but when I called they said the initial appointment is 3 hours and that just seems overkill. And honestly, I'm not willing to do inpatient or extensive outpatient. I may be willing to do counseling once a week, but I'm not doing anything more than that. Plus, I don't want an official diagnosis on my chart. Sometimes I feel like I have an issue, but other tines I just feel that I am just a health conscious person.
column9: Hello! Thank you for posting. Just wanted to inform you that we edited out parts of your post as some language and numbers might be triggering for others on the forums. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. column5: In the past few weeks, I was told that my eating habits aren't normal by a dietician. I have been relatively quick about accepting that there is room for improvement and that I might have an eating disorder. However, I have noticed that ever since my eating habits were pointed out and I've been made aware of them, the stress has really just worsened the issue a thousand times over. I've noticed that even though I can rationally accept that yes there is an issue here, I am restricting food more than I ever did before. I feel like the mental fog of not having enough nutrients has only gotten worse. I can accept that things need to change but for some reason acting on it is just not working for me.Did anyone else have this post-acceptance slump? Is it normal to slide worse into unhealthy eating practices after first talking about this?
column9: Hello! Thank you for posting. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Since you mentioned having a mental fog we just wanted to post up some signs and symptoms to look out for: The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  Seek medical help soon on an outpatient basis if you:• have significant heartburn and/or a burning sensation after eating• have other gastrointestinal concerns• have high blood pressure• struggle with significant joint or muscle pain• have difficulty sleeping (falling and/or remaining asleep)• struggle with fatigue, sudden weight gain, and/or hair loss• have frequent urination or unquenchable thirst• have gained and lost significant weight repeatedly• have gained significant weight in a short period of time • struggle with chronic diarrhea or constipation If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please take care and continue posting!

column5: This morning was really rough.  I realized I had kept forgetting to take 2 of my psych meds.  So I kept disassociating and feeling suicidal at treatment today, so my mood was up and down.  I talked to my therapist about it.   I'm glad today is ending. Hopefully I'll start feeling better tomorrow.
column9:
Hi, savedbygrace. We're sorry to about this and we just want to provide you with some resources to help you with these feelings.
Please take care!

column4: insomnia but kept on my food plan
column5: So tired, no energy. Weight stable. Guess I'm doing something right. Hard when I count on a consistent schedule to help me "stay on track". Stopped taking one new med. Hope that helps. Called my GP and left a message. Whatever I go through, keeping a sane, sensible and healthy eating plan makes any other physical complication much more manageable. Almost forgot. This is DAY 3.

column5: Hi everyone, I am really working on my recovery and trying to find support. I don't really have a group of friends to talk to about it because I've kept it well-hidden out of embarrassment and fear of people not understanding. But I learned about these forums which seemed like a good place to start to try talking about things....But I'm just scared to use these forums bc I'm not a Christian and it seems like that a lot of the posts? I don't know if it's a clique of responders or something but I just don't want to be judged or anything bc that's not where I try to get my support for recovery from, even though its wonderful that others do...

column4: Finally accepting it...and scared of it
column5: Hey everyone, After months of counting calories and feeling anxiety from going over a certain amount of calories a day, I have finally filed a request to talk to a dietician about how I feel. I have not been clinically diagnosed with an eating disorder, however, I know the signs and symptoms and am unsure who to talk about this for the time being....Today was the breaking point. I woke up this morning and immediately went to the gym. Healthy, yes? That's what I believed. I felt so good about myself. I fueled my body with breakfast I weighed in order to do the hour-long workout class I had signed up for. Once the class was over, I was exhausted. My legs felt weak and I began to feel hungy. But why was I hungry? I thought to myself, "I just ate over  2 hours ago. I can't eat yet". So I forced myself to walk on the treadmill at an incline for an hour until I burned off the equivalent amount of calories I knew my pre-determined lunch would be. Once I got home, I ate my lunch. After an hour, I was still hungry...but I wouldn't let myself eat. It was 3pm and I would not let myself start thinking about making dinner until at least 5pm (since I figured that would take an hour and 6pm would be the perfect time to eat). I knew what I was craving though, and the high protein content of that food makes me feel less guilty about the consuming that many carbs in a meal. So I cooked what I was craving...and I just stared at it. The calories. I couldn't get myself to do it. I wanted it so bad but I felt like I didn't deserve it. Why should I ruin all of the work I did at the gym. I stared and thought of reasons as to why I shouldn't let myself make that for dinner for over an hour while I drank water to suppress my appetite. Coming up with excuses for not making it Once it hit 6pm, I finally went to the store and picked up items that looked good, or at least equavalent to the dinner I had wanted. I looked at the label of each item of food I wanted. I did this so many times that I eventually left the store with nothing in hand, so frustrated at myself for feeling like I didn't deserve to eat. When I knew I needed to eat. I was offically denying my natural hunger because I was scared to eat. It was at this point that I began to tear up and cry at the feeling of weakness I felt and the voice in my head that I was so easily giving into. After a while, I walked to the whole foods up the road and wondered around the hot bar of beautiful food. I knew I was tortuing myself as I looked at the food, wanting it, but knowing the whole time I wouldn't let myself take it home. I love their food and that's why I forced myself to look at it. Looking and admiring the foodAfter 45 minutes of looking at the isles of food, I finally settled on accepting a frozen meal for dinner. This, somehow, I felt like I deserved. But I wasn't happy. I wasn't proud of myself. I still felt weak and I even teared up as I ate it, knowing I was letting some uncontrollable voice guide my life.This is a daily thing. It is only when I allow myself to drink that I will binge on every and all food I see and then feel guilty about eating the next day. Because of this, I am not underweight. I know there is something wrong. I have seen and talked with people with ED's before but never did I expect how easily and quietly it could happen to me. I finally called my mom and told her the feelings I was having and she just said "why can't you eat calories??" "just eat the calories. you're body needs them!" "You should be having at least a certain amount a day-that's not that hard". And of course, I couldn't explain to her why I could not allow myself to eat above a certain amount and why I felt a sense of power by remaining at as little calories as possible at the same time. Why that made me feel accomplished. I know I need to see a doctor, I want to. But I am scared to accept that there is something wrong with my behavior and that I will lose the control I feel over my body. If someone has any words of advice of how to get over this fear of finally accepting that something needs to change, please let me know. They would be greatly appreciated.

column5: Hey everyone, I'm new on here. After my therapy session today I felt like I needed some extra support so I'm hoping this will be helpful. My ED behaviors and restricting got significantly worse the past week. I had a few triggering events previous as well.  My dietitian, at our last session, reacted in a way that made it harder for me. She tried turning me ed behaviors into a silly joke and said things like "Well why not continue restricting until Aug, until Sept? Why stop there?" She also said if I don't work harder then the treatment team will get tired, which I interpreted to mean they will give up on me. Today my therapist created a plan to follow and wants me to start right away at eating 100% of my meal plan when I haven't been following it more than 60% or less in the last several months. I am feeling overwhelmed, lost, and alone.  My therapist told me to be fierce against Ed. But it took me 2 hours to even drink one boost. I don't know if I can do what she's asking me to do. Ed tells me that I am strong when I restrict, that I'm in control. That my body is mine.  That nobody can take that away from me, and that's comforting in a way because of my abusive background. I guess I'm just reaching out to you for any who can validate or relate or has gone through some of these feelings of being afraid to let go of the eating disorder?
column9: Hi, ape130! Thank you for posting. When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums and please continue posting!

column5: Hello...I think I have binge eating disorder although I have not been formally diagnosed. I find myself eating way too much when I am not physically hungry, and it's like a frenzy - I can't seem to stop even though I logically know what I'm doing isn't normal. Most of the time I do this binge eating at night but as I have been out of work for two weeks now, it's become a daytime hobby. I will stuff myself to the point of over-fullness and still reach for more. The hard part is figuring out what is triggering this behavior because I feel like if I knew the reason "why" I'm doing it, I might be able to control it better. Yes, I have stress (don't we all?), yes money is tight (nothing new there) and yes, I could point to a few things in my past that I'm probably not "over" but compared to some, I've had it pretty easy and have no reason to complain. My new job starts next week, my first grandchild is due within the month, life is really not so bad. I cannot afford therapy right now as I will be losing my insurance in a month so I was hoping that by coming on here, I might gain some insight and practical tips for stopping the binge before it starts or maybe learn how to figure out why I am doing this. Thanks for reading, I welcome any and all comments/advice.

You can read through our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums and please continue posting!

column5:
i never thought i would come here, but it's the one way i can be anonymous, so why not?
i've been struggling with my eating disorder for years now. i don't know if i can name a disorder because i don't feel like i fit the guidelines, which makes recovery harder. my eating disorder started when my life was hectic and i was looking for something i could control. i became obsessed with calories, how much i weighed, how much weight i could lose, and how few calories i could eat and still survive.and i feel like because i was never a "typical" eating disorder case, i wouldn't be taken seriously by my family or any healthcare providers.  i was always slim, i never felt fat in my life, and have never dealt with any fatphobia like many others have with eating disorders. because of this, my many attempts of recovery alone have failed and i still don't know if i feel comfortable talking to family about my struggles, so why not join this forum? this whole post is a mess, but if anyone has any advice towards feeling invalid for not being the textbook eating disorder case, i would love to hear it xx

column4: Isn't it time for this to be over?
column5: Hi,  I am new here.  This is a brief synopsis of my eating disorder history..I was a chubby kid and was teased a lot about my weight. I went to a diet program and lost weight.  I was hospitalized for anorexia and released at X lbs.  This is when I was 17.  I gained weight again.  In the span of about 10 years I got down to X lbs.  Then over the last 13 years I've gained to X.  This started when I was 16 and here I am at 54 years old and still struggling.  I feel so fat and ugly.  I work out a lot but my weight keeps creeping up and I don't know why.  I basically eat the same exact thing every day.Now I am ashamed and embarrassed and feel fat and ugly.  After 36 years of this I just want to not worry. I've been through so much therapy.  I am still in therapy.I weigh myself every day.  It's better than it used to be. I used to weigh myself more.Can anyone help???  I am losing my mind with this weight gain and continued struggle.Thank you.

column5: I’m in my 30’s and I’m too old for these issues. I have a child and want another, but here I am obsessing about my weight. I’ve had disordered eating my entire life. I was in treatment for anorexia as a teen and young adult and went to the opposite extreme and probably had BED for awhile. I’ve gained and lost weight twice now. I either binge/purge and restrict and maintain a normal weight, or I just straight binge until I’m so fat I hate myself even more. Right now I’m trying to stop purging for another pregnancy. I’m struggling. I’m so anxious and depressed. I’m thinking about going to see my GP. I saw her earlier this year but didn’t mention my issues. She only knows I have ptsd but I’m not in therapy or anything. I don’t even know how I will find time for therapy. My bloodwork came back normal other than iron deficiency do I don’t think I’ve done much damage. My disordered thoughts are telling me I should drop weight before going so I’m sick enough. I’m worried I’m going to out myself as a nutcase without getting help. The last time I tried his the doctor (not the same one) said “you don’t look like you have an eating disorder”. It was just fuel on the fire. Too old for this! I just want to be normal with food. I’m so exhausted.

column5:
Hello.
So I know everyone recommends you get professional help but I'm not ready for that so please don't try and push it on me.
But I do want to recover, on my own.
No one knows I have an eating disorder, some people suspect but I deny it. I'd just like someone to tell me what to do and how to stay on track.
I know it's probably impossible but I just need somewhere to start.I'm 5'2 and at a lower weight, I'm trying to eat more little by little and binge less.
I feel like I've gotten better but it doesn't seem to be enough.
If I force myself to eat to much it makes me spiral and get even worse.I just feel hopeless, embarrassed, and alone.If you can, please help me.

column5: Hi guys,For the past few years, I have been suffering from severe bulimia nervosa which, among other things, damaged my teeth. Over the past year though, I have managed to reduce its intensity by about 99%, but I think I will never be able to get rid of it entirely.I would like to fix my teeth with zirconia crowns, supposedly the toughest kind there is. Does anyone have experience or know would occasional vomiting chip or round the edges of these dental crowns?The reason I ask is because I had my teeth fixed before with composite resin fillings, but they got chipped/rounded at the edges. Composite resin fillings are supposed to be resistant to stomach acid, so my concern is that the fillings did not get chipped due to acid exposure, but due to the mechanical force/friction of the food coming out. Does anyone know if zirconia crowns could withstand this?
column9: Hi Laowai! As savedbygrace mentioned, users of this website cannot give specific medical advice, and can only share their personal experiences. If you would like assistance in finding more resources, feel free to contact the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237, M-TH (9am-9pm) or Friday (9am-5pm). We hope you find the support you're looking for!

column5: so this is my very first post. I’m a 17 year old girl and I struggle with an eating disorder that I’ve never heard of before until now. just for some quick backstory, I am VERY skinny. I've always weighed a lower amount. all the women in my family have told me that when they were young, they were incredibly skinny like me. they had super fast metabolisms and didn’t actually put on weight until their mid 20’s or after their first child. my mother said she was never as skinny as me though. I was bullied a lot in middle school for my weight or having no chest. entering high school it stopped and the only person that bullies me about it is myself now. the thing about my appearance is, I don’t look super unhealthy. yes I’m very skinny and obviously by just looking at my arms you can tell, but like for instance I have a small thigh gap but nothing too abnormally large. anyway. I have always been picky about food. some food I won’t touch or eat because of the smell or because I know there’s a certain ingredient I don’t like in it. but I still eat. I’m not cautious about gaining weight at all and I eat the fast food I love constantly. my metabolism burns through everything at such a high rate, I don’t gain a single ounce from the food I eat. over the past month or so, I fell hard into my depression again for personal reasons and started eating less -out of being lazy and wanting to sleep all day. this caused my stomach to shrink so much to the point that I could only eat half a meal and be absolutely stuffed. I want to keep my weight. I’m so tired of waiting for the moment and I know at this rate I will drop to under a specific weight. I can’t eat huge meals anymore and whenever I do I go hours before I’m hungry again. It kills me everyday when I realize it happening and I feel myself becoming skinnier every single day. If anyone has any really good advice or a similar story that I can relate to please let me know. I hate not being able to control this and I would love some feedback. ( also fyi, I do drink protein shakes occasionally and that helps but it took my appetite from me )
column9: Hi Lanacarey, welcome to the NEDA forums. We just wanted to let you know that we had to edit your post to remove the mention of weight-specific numbers, which violates our community guidelines. We hope you continue to use these forums for support!

column5: Hi all. I met with a psychologist yesterday and she confirmed I have BED. I’m being referred to a ED program but that won’t begin for a bit. It’s sinking in. It’s weird to have your own suspicions confirmed. I’m having a hard time accepting that my history of out of control eating isn’t within my own control. I feel a bit lost. I feel ashamed and embarassed. Im impatient and now that I know what the problem is I just want to fix it.
column9: Hi, chansuzette! Thank you for posting. When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums. Please continue posting!

column5: I binge because it makes me feel good. I have gained Xlb over the past two years and am very obese. I hate being fat and go on kicks where I go on strict diets. I don’t want to stop either, because of how it makes me feel and I fear not having that feeling without them. I don't know what to do.
column9: Hi, soccermama. Thank you for posting. We edited out parts of your post as numbers and some language might be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. You can take the screening tool, as it is not diagnostic but might help you figure out what's going on: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/screening-tool.Please continue posting!

column4: I'm headed down a bad path and need to get off of it.
column5: Hi everyone. I'm a little scared to be here. I don't know if I'm even in the right place. I'm very overwhelmed. I have OCD and my therapist is on medical leave for the month. My OCD was triggered by learning about obesity and diabetes. So now I'm afraid to eat unhealthy things. I have always occasionally skipped meals, but for the last 3 weeks I've been consistently skipping meals and don't even want my favorite dessert.  Last weekend I stepped on my parents scale when I visited them. I liked how low the number was. I liked it too much. I'm scared of developing an ED. I still have room before I'm underweight. Every time I sit down to eat I get nauseated. I'm also hungry though. I feel like I'm doing this on purpose to myself. How do i stop?
column9: Hi, smallsteps123! Thank you for posting! We’re sorry to hear about what's been going on but we hope that you find the support you deserve here on the forums. When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you would like, you can take our screening tool. It is not diagnositic, but may help you figure out what's going on: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/screening-tool. For precaution, we just want to post up these symptoms to look out for since you mentioned something concerning. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience anything on here, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column5: Hi I'm new to this sort of thing.  Honestly I got here by typing "how to get free therapy for an eating disorder" into google.  As I'm sure it can be seen I guess I'm getting a little desperate.  It isn't like I am in crisis or anything I just am a little frustrated with how my life is going.  I am not sure I even have a problem and one of the things that is stopping me from seeking any sort of real treatment is the fact that I feel guilty or like I don't have a severe enough issue.  All I know is that my thoughts are extremely food centric and I often find myself participating in activities that make up for me eating.  I guess I see food as a reward sometimes.  I feel guilty about the days I don't exercise and find myself over compensating via exercise for meals I have eaten.  I just want some freedom in my life again and I want to people to stop worrying about me. Has anyone else ever been here?  In this weird in-between of not being completely sick but definitely feeling like there may be a problem?  Where do I go from here?
column9: Hi, neems13! Thank you for posting. We're sorry to hear that you're feeling stuck in between these feelings! We hope that you can get the support you deserve here on the forums. When you have a chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines.You can also take a look at our screening tool -- it's not diagnostic but it can help you figure out what's going on: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/screening-tool. Also if you're interested in speaking with a volunteer about resources in your area you can call us at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open on Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. You can also chat with us during these hours (click on chat now at the top right hand corner). Please continue to post!

column5: I feel so unsure about what I want regarding whether or not to recover. The reasons I’d want to recover are so that I can feel better emotionally and also have better physical endurance and health. But then, I get so terrified of gaining weight — especially all of the weight I’ve recently lost. My disorders have been different throughout the years, where I started off with emotional eating and binging at a very young age, then when I was 11-13 I was very restrictive with my food intake and lost a lot of weight. Then from ages 14-18, I began to binge a lot and gained an immense amount of weight. In the summer of 2017, I was away at college for the first time and began to restrict heavily again and exercised a lot. I ended up going home in September and overate and binged the worst I had. I then entered treatment for BED, where I was then diagnosed with bulimia non-purge (due to other behaviors). I was at the residential treatment center for three months and I was able to regulate my eating again. In August of 2018, I heavily relapsed into disordered eating but this time it was restricting again. Since then, I’ve been very heavily restricting and have lost a good amount of weight. I have a therapist and two dietitians (one who meets with me at home and the other who I see at her office) and I’ve been trying to embrace the recovery mindset but I’m so incredibly scared to do so. I’m scared that if I begin eating the required amount of food, that it’ll lead me to bingeing again and that I’ll gain all that weight back and more. I feel so suffocated and trapped with this impasse.
column9: Hi, izzybkn13! Thank you for posting. We're sorry to hear about these conflicting feelings. You're not alone in feeling this way. We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you need any resources, please do not hesitate to reach out to the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. You can also chat during these hours by clicking on the chat now option at the top right hand corner. Please continue posting!

column4: How do you take control of your ED?
column5: I have had body image issues since I was 7. I think I first started binge eating in high school, but it might have been earlier. It wasn't until a few months ago where I started binge eating a lot and then i started purging. I have binged then purged a lot this week, which is the most I've ever done. I stopped today after seeing some blood in my spit, I am hoping from maybe scratching myself. I know that if I was able to stop bingeing then I would not purge but I don't know how or where to start.
column9: Hi, beachlover. We're sorry to hear about what's been going on. You mentioned a concerning symptom so we would like for you to take a look at this list. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking help from a medical professional as soon as possible. Another option is 911. Please take care!

column4: Gave into the feeling to binge eat.
column5: I kept getting upset and the feeling to binge eat and I gave into it. I feel upset now and that nothing matters anymore. This problem is never going to go away, so why keep trying to make it go away. I don't care anymore.
column9: Hi, London1621. We're sorry to hear that you're struggling right now. You mentioned some concerning feelings so we just wanted to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum might want to reach out to them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgNational Suicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlife: Call (800) 784-2433 or ww.imalive.org Please take care!

column4: Rapid weight gain - is it normal? I don't know how to deal.
column5: Hi, this is my first time posting in a forum, but right now I'm very glad to have this opportunity. Last week I started inpatient treatment for a restrictive eating disorder. I have lost quite a considerable amount of weight since December, was admitted to a hospital at the end of June to slowly start the refeeding process and am now working towards recovery in this specialised unit. I don't really have a problem with the eating, however something I'm currently struggling a lot with is the rate of my weight gain. Since I arrived 5 days ago, I have been gaining X each day. I really feel like my body is "broken". We are supposed to be gaining X per week - not per day and I seem to be the only one who gains this rapidly (even though I'm on the smallest intake amount while most of the other patients are eating more and still gaining more gradually) Is this normal or even possible? Is this real weight or could it also be water? I do have slightly swollen ankles and swollen cheeks in the morning. However it is not too extreme. Will the weight maybe go down again after a while or will it continue going up so quickly? I also have a lot of mental hunger (physically I'm stuffed) but am too afraid to ask for an increase because that would mean gaining even more. I already feel huge compared to the other patients who have been here for a few weeks or even months and are still thinner than me. Can anyone help me or give me some advice on how to handle my thoughts, fears and the feeling of not being sick enough/ inferior to the other girls that are really "sick"? Thanks in advance, a very appreciative bee
column9: Hi, fightingbee. Thank you for posting! We're sorry to hear about what's going on as treatment and the road to recovery can be hard work! We edited a portion of your post as specific numbers can be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you need resources, please do not hesitate to reach out to the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. You can also chat during those hours by clicking on the chat now option at the top right hand corner. We hope you get the support you deserve here on the forum. Please continue posting!

column5: Last night X snack turned into X! Not even what I sometimes call "freeze frame", that second of choice consciousness still operating. But you see when I move away from a big struggle time, sort of take a break, it can happen. As if I'm out of a food nibbling danger. What's the song? "Here I Go Again"?
column9: Hi, CASACERA. A portion of your post was edit due to numbers that might be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for understanding and please continue posting.

column5: I’m sitting in my room right now looking back in my trip to Canada last August and I am seeing myself in these photos but it isn’t me? The way I see myself now is just not who I actually feel I am. I know this doesn’t make sense but when I look at the old photos I was smaller, and happier, and I just feel joy when I look at them and when I look at myself now or photos now I want to hide and delete them. I don’t feel like I actually am reflecting who I want to be as a person.I just don’t know how to find happiness. How do I loose weight but not too much weight. How do I find my true self without losing my whole self in the process.
column9: Hi, iwanttolive. Since you mentioned some concerning thoughts in the past, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you or anyone else on the forum needs them. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.orgSuicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org IMAlive: Call (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help Inc: Call (906) 482-4357 or Text (906) 356-3337 or www.dialhelp.org Please take care!

column4: Scared of going into recovery and vacation
column5: I got referred to a recovery clinic a month ago and I’m going to the information session next week. I’ve been so scared and it sent my ed into overdrive because I felt like I needed to restrict as much as possible before entering recovery but now a few days after the informatoon session I’ll be travelling to go visit my partner. We have so many fun ideas to do together and they want to take me to a fancy dessert place and an amusement park to try a dessert option since I’ve never had one before so I keep restricting in anticipation and don’t know how to stop. I’m scared of getting refeeding syndrome while I’m there and scared of not having control over cooking everything myself. I don’t know what to do. I know I’ll have them there to support me and they said that if there’s anything they can do to help that they will which is wonderful but its still terrifying. Has anyone gone through anything similar? Does anyone have any advice to get out of this and feel safe and ok? I have ocd too and it feels like I’m going to be punished.
column9: Hi, rhysbun! Thank you for posting! We’re sorry to hear about your concerns so we hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums! We slightly edited your post as some details might be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. For precaution we are posting up some signs and symptoms to keep an eye out for. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you happen to experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.  If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column4: Restricting/ bingeing and body image pressure
column5: I struggle pretty seriously with eating and over exercising to compensate. I'm afraid to eat over X calories a day, yet I workout X times a week. In the last 2 months I've noticed that by the end of the day I'm so hungry that I binge. I'll eat around X during a binge like it's nothing. I feel like absolute shit after and tell myself I won't do it again, but the cycle continues. I don't know how to stop it or exactly why I'm even doing it in the first place, but having body dysmorphia doesn't help. I'm constantly looking at my body in the mirror to make sure I don't look chubby. Everyone always tells me that I'm skinny, but I have no idea what they see. I don't know how I got this way and I'm afraid to admit to anyone that I'm struggling. Everyone thinks I'm just really into fitness and eating healthy because I played sports my whole life and I'm a vegetarian, but they have no idea what's really going on in my head. I'm afraid to admit to someone that I need help, even though I want it, but at the same time I'm afraid if I do seek help I'll end up gaining weight and hating myself even more than I do now. I don't know what to do and I feel so alone right now
column9: Hi, Cassidy2332! Thank you for posting. We're sorry to hear that you're struggling right now and we hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums. We edited parts of your post because you had mentioned specific numbers and descriptions that could be triggering for other members. Please read our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you need any resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. You can also chat with the helpline during these hours by clicking on chat now at the top right hand corner! Please continue to post!

column5: I can't truly feel/accept i need help because I'm not the weight I was before... And I feel like i eat too much especially because I haven't been as successful with fasting, I tell myself I'm just eating too much to actually need help. Idk it makes me hella anxious to consider changing my ways though too I can't stand the idea of gaining any more weight
column9: Hi, Periodicmemes! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you’re able to get the support you deserve here on the forums! When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner! Please continue posting!

column4: My Parents Control the Grocery List
column5: Hello.  I've been seriously thinking about getting help from a therapist, since recovering on my own hasn't really worked very well.  The only thing is, I haven't really told anyone what I'm going through.  My mom knows I used to struggle mildly with disordered eating (haha it was a lot more than that mom) but that's only because she accidentally saw a notification from one of the facebook ED groups; everyone else has no clue, and actually believes the opposite.The thing is, my dad and step-mom are incredibly triggering to be around when it comes to food.  I don't think I can remember a time when one or both of them weren't dieting, and they constantly make comments about themselves and about "temptation foods".  They even have there allowed calorie intake posting on the door of the fridge.  Now that I'm older, some of those comments have turned to me.  My dad recently gave me a lecture on how "if you eat the way you do now when you're 20, you'll balloon upwards", and, whenever I write the grocery list, they very pointedly ask if I would like to add anything, and why I haven't written any healthy food or stuff I can meal prep.The thing is, it's not like I eat mcdonalds every day or something.  Primarily, I eat specific foods which, according to them, is way too much carbs.  And the worst part is, I'm stuck at my dads house for the rest of the summer.It's honestly getting to be too much; I've already relapsed twice just in the month that I've been here.  How can I stop them from making comments and stuff like that without telling them I have an eating disorder?
column9: Hi Adrian! Welcome to the NEDA forums. We had to slightly edit your post to remove specific mentions of food, which goes against our community guidelines. We hope you continue to post!

column5: Hello, I have had an eating disorder for about over two months now. I just started recovery and am feeling sick almost every time I eat. I also have acid reflux. Has anyone else been through this before? I feel like I'm going to be sick but I'm trying to stay calm and get through it.
column9: Hi, jpaysawy! Thank you for posting. We’re sorry to hear about what’s going on! We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forums. When you get the chance, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Since you’re mentioning some concerning symptoms that you’re experiencing we are providing you with this list. Another option is 911.  If you’re looking for resources, please feel free to contact the Helpline at (800) 931-2237. The Helpline is open Mondays-Thursdays 9AM-9PM EST and Fridays 9AM-5PM EST. column5: I am gaining weight after being extremely underweight for a long time and had finally gotten my period back. I had lost it during the time of my extreme weight loss and was excited to get it back. After initially getting my period i thought that everything would go back to normal but quickly realized that I would continue spotting through the month. I would have my period and then it would stop then a week or so later I would be spotting again and this has been happening for the past couple months. I was wondering if this was normal when trying to return to a healthy weight or if I should see a professional because of my frequent and irregular bleeding
column9: Hi, jvwolfe! Thank you for posting. We're sorry to hear what you're been experiencing. We hope you get the support you deserve here on the forums. When you get the chance, please read through our community guidelines: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Per our guidelines we do not provide specific medical advice. Just for precaution we're going to post these symptoms. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. During these hours you can chat with us also by clicking the chat now option at the top right hand corner!  Please continue posting!

column5:
Hi I’m new to this. I haven’t been diagnosed with an eating disorder partly because I never talk about it  to anyone.
I’ve been struggling a lot lately. I’ve been substituting drugs, cigarettes and caffeine for food. I haven’t eaten or slept in four days  and I’m starting to get really depressed. I’ve been struggling with self-harm a lot recently; yesterday I enacted in some specific self-harm behaviors. I think I’m crazy are about to be!
 I’m stuck in this vicious cycle That revolves around my body image food and drugs stemming from my low self-esteem and I’m sure when I was younger training for the Olympics in  gymnastics  getting weighed in every day and then being called fat by your coaches and teammates didn’t help either. My obsession with food or no food as steadily increased as well as my drug use and self harm behaviors. I’m at the end of my rope and I don’t know what to do. Can anyone relate?
column9: Hello, and welcome to the forums! We had to slighty edit your post due to specific self-harm details that may be triggering to other users.We hope you are able to use this forum for support, but are cocerned for your safetly. If you are in a crisis and need help immediately, text "NEDA" to 741741 to be connected with a trained volunteer at Crisis Text Line or call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). If you are currently engaging in self-harming behaviors please contact the self-injury crisis line at 1-800-366- 8288. Hope you are doing alright, and continue to seek support.

column5:
Hello everyone! I really love how supportive this forum is! However, I would love if some triggering things such as
-how much you ate
-details on restricting
-mentioning losing weight
-mentioning not eating all daycould be lessened or maybe conveyed less directly? I struggle to find the motivation to recover and these can be damaging to read. Yes, yes I know you could argue I just should't click on them. Yet, I feel that all of us can benefit from less exposure to this. ED is a jealous disorder and loves to compare.Now for a solution:Saying, I beening struggling to meet my meal plan, My health has been declining, etc.I hope no one hates me for mentioning this. It's just an issue I have had.Alexo
column9: Hi, alexo_eats and CASACERA. Thank you for the feedback you both provided. NEDA strives to maintain a safe and welcoming space for everyone on the forums to post and feel supported. We will take what you both have mentioned into consideration as we update our community guidelines! Please take care and continue posting!

column5: Right now after delicious and healthy lunch I knew I had a extremely brief moment of choice before the message of "eat something else, have it with an innocent cup of tea, no problem" Are you kidding me? I now had a place to go and get away from the table and say "reach out", like throwing cold water on my face. Wake up. Left to my own devices (even with hubby in the house, so hard not to go down that familiar, slippery road. Eating is  like being in a party I don't want to leave. I just did. Thank you all for being here.
column9: Dear CASACERA, we would like to let you know that we edited your post to remove some language that could be triggering. You can review our community guidelines here. Thanks for your understanding!

column5: Hello, I am new to these forums and I was wondering if I could get some advice or at least a reply to my problems. I have always felt insecure about my body and the way I look and it sounds very stereotypical for a typical teenager but it doesn’t matter. It started a year ago when I would start restricting the amount of food I ate and would skip meals. My memory about the past is hazy but I think I started to eat normally for a bit after. A few months ago I started restricting again, like skipping breakfast. My mum found out I was skipping breakfast and started making me eat it again so that’s that. I’ve started eating more but i’m still very restrictive about what I eat and if it’s healthy or not. My friends always comment about how I eat really healthy but they don’t know about my problems. When I started restricting, i started binge eating due to bad dieting i think. I always felt horrible after binges and I sometimes even do it in front of my friends. I’ve thought about purging but I’ve never brought myself to do it. I want to tell my mum but she has her own problems and she’s stressed. I don’t want to put more pressure on her since she has depression and she is a single mum. I’ve told one friend but he didn’t really take it seriously so I don’t know where else to turn to. Since I’ve started eating more normally, I’m not sure about the reason why I binge. Even though I constantly count calories and I’m conscious about what I eat, my diet is very healthy and I get to happily eat a few unhealthy foods, I still binge eat. It just feels very uncontrollable when I start to binge. I always control my weight and I feel depressed if I go over a certain weight. I have a few other details but I will leave it as that. I really hope somebody replies and I just want your opinion, you don’t have to give advice. Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope to hear from someone.
column9: Hi, chloetxng! We're sorry that you're struggling with body image and some eating concerns! We hope that you get the support you deserve here on the forum. We edited something out of your post as it was a bit detailed -- you can read our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you're looking for resources (treatment options or other support options), you can reach out to the helpline! The NEDA Helpline is open Monday-Thursday 9AM-9PM EST and Friday 9AM-5PM EST. You can call or chat with us (top right hand corner). Please continue to post!

column4: binge eating, body image, self control
column5: i've been struggling with eating disorders almost my whole life. when i was a kid i was too thin so i made myself eat too much in order to gain weight, at my 12yo i dislike my body image even though now i realise i was okay, two years later i stopped eating and over exercise and since 2016 ive been binging. i cant with this anymore. i reached help. i go to therapy once a week but im still not okay. this year has been the worst. im having problems in my personal life and im not happy so i eat, eat, eat and keep eating. i need an advice, something. i wish this was easier. im not motivated. i guess i wouldnt mind gaining weight if it wasnt for the fat not being proportionally distributed.

column4: How do I dealwith guilt after eating
column5:
I ate close to nothing yesterday and I really thought I was going to pass out, it's also very hot here so today I decided to have breakfast, I didn't want to but I was so afraid I would faint if I didn't. I can't stop feeling guilty, I feel fat, I feel full and I hate feeling full
I feel like I am going crazy
column9:

Please stay safe and continue to post!
column13: Apologies to the viewers of this post. There was a spam comment made which we tried to delete earlier, but it appears it was not deleted until today.

column5: So, since someone asked how I was doing I thought I would update people on my situation. Yesterday was just awful as far as my emotional status. I felt very invalidated in group at PHP. I finally got my opportunity to talk about triggers and asking about coping with them and no one said a word except for the therapist. I do not appreciate that the group has not supported me in any way. I intend to bring it up today because I do not feel comfortable sharing in a group that is not supporting me or validating my feelings. The reason why I posted this titled one day is because I still got through the day without any eating disorder behaviors. So I took it one day at a time and I am proud of myself for doing that. So right now I'm staring at a paper that I put on my table that has a goal of no self-harm for 3 days. And when I say self-harm that includes eating disorder behaviors because I tend to use eating disorder behaviors as a substitute for other forms of self-harm because I'm constantly feeling like I have to punish myself. And then I have that if I succeed with this goal oh, I have a reward planned. So I got through yesterday without any self-harm and it helped me get in a better mood by the end of the day. Also my determination to address the situation in group has put me in a better mood. I mentioned to the group leader that I need to address this situation and she said she would read what I had written when she did her notes for the day. If she does not allow me to discuss it with in the first group at PHP, then as soon as our second group starts I am simply going to butt in as tactfully as possible and just start talking. Because this cannot happen again. Yesterday I was prepared to go to the psychiatrist and say hey you'd better put me in inpatient because I cannot be safe. That is Not therapeutic if I'm feeling that way. So I think my decision to talk to the group and hopefully get some feedback has helped me be in a better mood. Also my telling myself that despite my awful mood yesterday that I was going to eat anyway helped. I recognize that I cannot be on my A-game if I am not nourishing myself properly. So, I start the day in a good mood and hope it continues. The other thing I did for myself yesterday since I was in such a stinky Mood by the end of the day and extremely tearful was say to myself I need to do something to self soothe and I'm afraid if I go home I will not eat supper. So I took care of some paperwork that I needed to do. I went and got a massage at my gym at the HydroMassage bed, and then I went to a restaurant and ate supper there that was exactly according to my meal plan. And prior to going into the restaurant, I watched some cartoons on my phone. Which made me laugh and got me in a much better mood. So I'm starting the day in a good mood and actually looking forward to it. One day at a time that's all any of us can do
column9: Hi, alwaysthinking, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you wanted to speak with someone who is trained to help with those struggling with self harm. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741741 or www.crisistextline.orgS.A.F.E: Call (800) 366-8288 or www.selfinjury.comPlease take care!

column5: Me lazy... I use to go to the gym X times a day and then make sure I did enough cardio. He called me lazy Today because I didn’t want to go to the gym. Lazy.... advice on how to inform your family that I am in recovery and it is all about give and take and i am trying not to go over board !
column9: Hi, charliebarr, we edited parts of your post since you mentioned a specific number that might be triggering for other members of the forum. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for understanding and please continue to post!

column5: So I have really slipped into entirely too many eating disorder behaviors ever since starting PHP. I know it's because I'm dealing with a lot of difficult issues. I also know it's because I'm using the eating disorder as a way to control my feelings. I also know it's really not me controlling anything but it's the eating disorder controlling me. I just wish I knew how to stop it. I intend to have a very serious conversation with either the therapist or the psychiatrist at the very next opportunity to let them know how serious this is getting. I feel like I am screaming help at the top of my lungs in the middle of a group and no one's listening. Or if they are listening they either do not care or do not want to help.  I feel like I keep getting told that I'm too sick for anyone to be able to help me. I'm back to feeling completely defective. I want to have control over my life instead of everything around me having control over me and making me feel completely out of control. I just wish I knew how to do it. I need help desperately. On a positive note I do have an appointment with a new therapist next week. Because I do not feel that my therapist but I have currently has been goal-oriented enough. I need someone that is solution and problem-solving oriented instead of just expecting me to talk about my problems all the time. I can do that with my friends. I don't need to do that with the therapist also. That's not solving anything. Don't know what I want to accomplish with this post other than just to vent. Just feeling very lost, insignificant, insecure, and inadequate. And completely out of control
column9: Hi, alwaysthinking, we're sorry to hear that you're struggling with these feelings. We want you to know that your feelings are valid and you do deserve to be heard and supported. We just wanted to post up some resources since you mentioned some concerning feelings. Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741741 or www.crisistextline.org National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: Call (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org Please take care!

column5:
Hello,As you can tell, I'm new to this site and this is my first post. I am desperate for help and I don't know who to reach out to.
First, its important to clarify that I come from a country where eating disorders are not very common, there are absolutely no inpatient treatment programs and no specialists in the treatment of eating disorders, Just general psychiatrists who are not very knowledgeable about eating disorders. I struggle from not being taken seriously whether by my parents or my physicians.When I first started restricting, I reached X kilograms And maintained for eight months having fainted several times and struggled from liver problems. I have since gained about X kilograms after I wanted to recover alone and started binging. Two days ago, I started restricting again. Here i am. I couldn't go back to sleep. I have the worst case of nausea and the top of my head is throbbing. I keep going in and out of the kitchen to grab some breakfast. Im so so hungry. I resist the temptation of taking a bite. I stare at my little brother while he eats his breakfast. Im so hungry that I'm literally sick to my stomach. I can't stop pacing back and forth. My vision goes black every time I stand.I hate myself so much. I hate myself for being fat. I don't want to binge. Im too weak and such a fake. Im starting to think that I made my eating disorder up when every second, something screams inside me that im so fat and unworthy and inadequate.Like.. how can I be so hungry? I want this cycle to stop, but I don't know where to start. I want to stop obsessing about food and stop being sick.

You can review our community guidelines here. You also mentioned some symptoms that are concerning. column5: I am still not sure if I have an eating disorder, or if my symptoms are severe enough to be classified as one. But I am scared to admit to a doctor any of my behaviors such as purging or restriction because I feel as if this would be put on some type of record, or I would be forced into treatment. Do doctors force patients into intreatment? Can you be labeled as "at-risk" if you admit to eating disorder symptoms? I am just concerned about this because I am already in therapy/psychiatric treatment for other things and I don't want them to start restricting me in my freedoms such as infrequent appointments, and I feel like it would break the trust my doctor has if I admit it now after a year of treatment.

column5: Hi fellow friends- I have not been active on the forum in a very long time, and I miss the support and empowering feedback I read in every post. I have been doing fine with my ED, still in recovery and still restoring some unwanted weight loss, due to a medical issue that seems to have healed on it's own. But I've been very depressed and struggling with issues related to my boyfriend, who is serving time in prison on a stolen car charge. I am feeling sad that we are in different head spaces with respect to our future together, and I sense he is pulling away steadily, which I cannot control or change. So I simply haven't felt like interacting with people, online and in my daily life. I've been isolating a lot and I am forcing myself out of hiding by writing here. It's never a good place for me to be when I cut myself off from people and recovery related activities, which is where I find myself now. I worry most about relapse on my drug of choice, the cravings have been increasing as I fall deeper into depression. So I am back tonight, just saying hello, and I will check out other threads to get in touch with how other's are feeling out there. Thanks for listening:)
column9: Hi, s.boewer. We're sorry about what's going on and we're glad that you felt comfortable sharing your worries with everyone on here! We just wanted to provide you with some resources in case you need to reach out to someone: Crisis Textline: Text "NEDA" to 741-741Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273 - 8255 Hope you're able to get some support! Please take care!

column5: I recently have been cleared to go back to the gym however I am in so much. I have always been an active person, also either working out or playing sports, but after one week back in the gym I can barley move I am in so much pain that I was almost in tears this morning. Did any one experience something like this after recovery?
column9: Hello to both of you! We just want to make sure you're both safe so we're just posting up some signs and symptoms of a medical emergency.The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heart beat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature ofless than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitIf either of you experience anything on this list, we highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911. Please continue posting and take care!

column4: it's not so much about the look, it's about the control
column5: Hi there, I'm pretty new to this and this is the first time I've ever been a part of anything like this. I have a problem though, and it's hard to reach out to anyone in my life without being too concerning. I've struggled with anorexia and bulimia a lot more when I was in high school, and before it was simple: I just wanted to be skinny. I come from an asian background, and asian moms are wildly known for always commenting on weight. also, my dad has diabetes so my weight was also in question of my health, and his fear that I would also get diabetes. I was pretty messed up in high school, safe to say I was a stereotypical burn out kid. But I managed to get my act together and I stopped obsessively working out and stopped not eating and I became healthy. a lot of people thought I became fat, but I saw it as healthy. for years since then, I've been fairly ok when it came to eating. really, my binging was the worst in college but then I became too poor to not savor every meal so I was eating fairly normally. I love to cook, especially for my friends, and I work in the restaurant/bar industry so food and going out are really a huge part of my life. but at this point, I don't know why I'm struggling again. it happened a few months ago, I didn't even notice but I would just eat one small meal a day. I was getting drunk quicker, I was getting more and more tired. once I realized what was going on I assumed the problem would correct itself but it just wouldn't. I would revel in the hunger pains, I would honestly enjoy the feeling of my stomach begging for food but me not allowing it. I'm a bigger person, not huge but I'm chubby and honestly I like it. I mean, I struggle with image issues like anyone else and I try to be happy with my body. but my issues with eating is less about my image and more about my control. the control I feel over my food and my eating habits just makes me feel strong, like I'm overcoming the pain and living through it. I had a break down a few weeks ago where a friend mine talked me through everything and I don't know what happened but something flipped and I was able to let go and eat again. but this week, I had to go to the ER because I thought I had appendicitis. I've been having these intense cramps which I thought were just abnormal period cramps. but I was really sussed out since my period came 2 weeks early (which I'm always super late) and I never get cramps. but I lived with these cramps for a week before going to the hospital. they told me it wasn't appendicitis, but it was colon issues. they still didn't know exactly what so I have to go see a doctor. which I can't even see a doctor until I see a primary care doctor to get a referral for a GI. they said it might just be an infection, or it could be IBS. I started panicking yesterday when I started looking up all the dietary restrictions with IBS. everything I can and cannot eat these lists were contradicting themselves and it became all so overwhelming. it's been over 48 hours and I have been restricting. I'm too afraid to eat for both the fear triggering my stomach, but also the control I now feel again over my body. I just feel like every time I look online to seek help, everything is always pointed towards the look of being skinny and body dysmorphia which I do have, but for once this isn't the reason for my food issues. I just want to feel a control somewhere in my life and I feel so alone in this. I feel like such a burden on my friends for my manic episodes and food issues and I just want to eat but I just can't let myself.

column4: how to stay away from laxatives? + should i see a doctor for this?
column5: basically i’ve been abusing laxatives for 3 years now. badly abusing them. not gonna get into numbers but i took way way too many, significantly more than the dose. and i’ve dealt with all the symptoms that follow. i stayed lax free for 46 days which is the longest i’ve ever gone. then took more. and now... now i have this visible vein over my right rib cage, that hurts, and i’m scared i messed up my liver with laxative abuse but IDK  it’s related i’m posting here wondering if anyone has ever had that happen as a result of lax abuse? i’m probably gonna see a doctor anyway but it’s the weirdest symptom i’ve ever had and idk if it’s “normal” for people suffering with ed’s. i am in recovery from bulimia by the way x that was a slip-up i don’t plan to repeat, i’m just scared now hha

column5: I just need some motivation to keep fighting. I’ve been getting really bad episodes of just wanting to give up and not resist using behaviors. I still haven’t gotten the courage to talk to anyone about my ED. I feel like I don’t deserve help.
