column5:
(skip first part 4 actual chest pain talk)
v__v i have only recently just started the recovery process, i just met a dietician a week ago from this being posted. i have a meal plan set, but i haven’t really been told of any recovering side effects? i tried looking up whether or not certain symptoms were a sign of recovery or a sign of danger, but i couldn’t find anything for it. vv
i’ve *just* started trying to eat regularly again, but i’ve been experiencing sporadic chest/stomach pains. i don’t know if this is normal? i should also mention i am a trans person and wear a chest binder occasionally (less since starting to recover) and i don’t know if this is also contributing to the chest pain since i wear it a healthy amount when i do wear it. the chest pain feels similar to heart burn and the stomach pain feels like something heavy is resting directly onto my abdomen. is this a normal experience while getting better or should i be concerned? thanku in advance to any1 who replies/has advice!
column9: Hi tryingmybest, Thanks for your post. Because your post mentions health concerns, the following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit or any other serious medical concerns.If you experience anything above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. column5: Hello Everyone. As a way of introducing myself, let me start with what happened today.He did not want to continue the relationship. He could not invest himself fully, because my attitude towards my eating-disordered mind would trigger negative patterns of his own. He knew all the signs. Even I had forgotten my own ticks, that I hadn't noticed him noticing. These were possibly projected from a previous relationship, a crucial one. They had met at a clinic. It lasted two years, ending in her relapse.In his own words, he told me, "I do not want to repeat that.' I tried to tell him that this was not that. That i was not dependant. That I could not be triggered, that I was managing. He said it was about his own cycles of paranoia and resentment, that he did not want this as part of his life. The Dealbreaker. I expressed that I feel like an idiot. That i haven't been given a chance to respond. That it was unfair to doom one relationship on the basis of another. That is was unfair to read my 'weirdsies' of using certain behaviors as warning signs, when to me, these are coping mechanisms that limit panic. He said what bothered him was my casual, offhand manner of talking about my relationship with food and disorder. I think he meant my tolerance and normalisation of it. I said, What am i supposed to do? Lay down and cry? It is how i convey something without conveying its full gravity. It's something I have to deal with daily, so i make fun of it, to an extent.He was serious and investigative. Precisely what I love, and precisely the quality that leads to the observation of the minutia of my destructive habits. I am realising that these coping mechanisms are not enough. I never stopped purging. There were phases, but that after ten years of practice, this became a normal part of my existence, a part that I have to hide, a part that -I know without knowing- is alienating. I wrote a letter to him. Saying that he has had a profound effect on my direction. I never considered active recovery before. What I am saying, is that i am embarking on a version of myself that would not have begun to manifest if all this hadn't been discussed.I loved that man. So this is it. This is the part where I start to honestly chronicle my weaknesses, to actively assess and change my mental disposition, my habits, my fossils, my denial. Such honesty is new to me. I need your help. The alternative is lethal to love.

column5: I was recently diagnosed with an eating disorder, after nearly 10 years of disordered eating. I can’t afford a mental health professional to help me. My doctor prescribed me medication because she said I was “overly anxious”, but was unable to help me with my eating disorder. I’ve been feeling so depressed about this recently and its led me to binge frequently. I think about my binge all day. I can’t stop thinking about it and when I finally get to my “Binge time” it feels so good. Then I just feel guilt afterwards. I’ve tried doing other things instead of binging, but nothing works. I have covered all my mirrors because I can’t stand to look at myself. I’m just feeling so down and hopeless. I need help, but I’m not sure what to do without an income or insurance that will pay for mental health visits. :(

column5: so I've been on and off with an ED for 6ish years, and I've always wondered what this was during the time of my lowest weight. I would be in the middle of showering and would suddenly get nauseous, and it would quickly get so intense that I would have to step out of the shower no matter if my hair was still soapy etc and had sit down. (I found that it would happen when the temp. of the water was quite hot) Along with the intense nausea, I would get dizzy, my vision would get blurry, my ears would ring, and I've been told that my face would be completely pale. It would last around 10 minutes. I never knew what the exact cause of this would be... I remember going to may doctor and asking about the symptoms, and they'd told me it looked like my blood pressure was low? but never gave a definitive answer. Has anyone else experienced this?
column9: Hi taliak,We're sorry to hear about what's going on with you. You described some concerning symptoms that you're currently struggling with. We wanted to provide you with an additional list of signs and symptoms of a medical emergency to keep an eye on. A person does not have to be underweight to have an eating disorder or to require emergency medical care for one.  Seek medical help immediately if you experience: • accidentally or deliberately causes themselves a physical injury• becomes suicidal• experiences confused thinking and is not making any sense• experiences delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• feels disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are • vomits several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiences dizziness or fainting spells• feels too weak to walk or collapses• experiences painful muscle spasms• complains of chest pain or having trouble breathing• observes blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• has a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16 • has an irregular heartbeat or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• has cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit Or for any other serious medical concerns. We highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.

column5: I've been struggling recently, it all started 4 years ago and it's an on and off thing. i thought i was finally getting past this, i was eating great actually. but turns out i was wrong. it's like i know all the downsides to giving into the thoughts, but i want to anyway. yesterday night i told myself that i wouldn't give in. that i was stronger than that. i have a younger sister, and what would she think if her older sister was starving herself. so i told myself no. but it's still bothering me. i'm so tired of dealing with these thoughts and i want to get treatment. i told one my friends yesterday, and she was so understanding im so grateful. i'm afraid to tell my parents though. they're indian, so something like mental health isn't really that important to them. i'm afraid they'll laugh it off, and that'll cause me to spiral back into the thoughts. also, i doubt there are any recovery/treatment things here in india. i also have these really important exams starting in 7 days, and i can't be obsessing over what i eat on those days. so that's that, hopefully i can get help someday, but until then, what can i do?

column5:
Hello...I have had an eating disorder my whole life. I am 49 and off all places have a jaw disability. I know the reasons behind my eating disorder...I just don't know how to eat. Sure grab a plate, put food on said plate and eat it, simple right?.
    Why I am here is because another trama to my system has happened. No MD/specialist can help and I have an autistic adult child who needs me.
     My recent disaster: due to my jaw surgeries; disection and reconstruction of half my mandible w my fibula, I have a deilitating nerve disorder and thus since the medical community say they can't help, I did/do my own research.
      I purchased liver supplements. Well, in taking the supplement, it didn't touch my nerve condition. But it helped me drink water. (Didn't do this most of my life. Growing up w the generation that mom felt juice was more substancial). So I lost a dramatic amount of weight again. ...but I ended up w other complications.
    Now I am back to obsessing over food intake. I count hours til breakfast. I wonder when I should eat lunch since I eat breakfast late. Then I put food out of my mind and I am starving by dinner that I just eat more than I should.
    There are a lot of sweets hanging around...I don't eat them but can't eat my seeds due to vitamin b overload. So, I just go hungery.
     Done the small meals a day, doesn't work.
     Kinda worried how much my poor body can take of the weight gain/loss and disabilitating nerve condition.
      Thanks for listening.

column5:
Hi all,
I’m new here. I’ve been in therapy and active recovery for about a year and a half, still find it really hard to cope with my body. I was anorexic and bulimic for 6-7 years, and then it morphed into a binge eating disorder which I’ve had for 3-4 years. Because of the anorexia and bulimia, I lost a certain amount of weight with the binge eating disorder I gained a certain amount of weight. I got away with my disorder because no one suspected it...I was a large person losing weight. Now I’m back to being a large person (not going to mention my weight here-I honestly don’t know it at the moment thank god). Anyways, I have a really hard time trying to do recovery while also wanting to lose weight. I know they aren’t compatible things. My husband and I were having a conversation tonight and he said “you’re not fat, your overweight” and now I don’t know what to do. He feels horrible because he knows that will ring in my head for a long time and make my recovery much harder. I feel horrible because I know what he thinks about how I look and it validates my own feelings. So I don’t really know how to proceed from here. What do I say to him? How can I process this? And how do we operate from here on out with me knowing his thoughts and him knowing he made my ed worse?

column5: Hello,  I'm looking for support and information on recovering from an eating disorder.  I'm male, 39 and just got off a prescribed medication I was physically dependent on for over a decade.  That withdrawal process was incredibly difficult for me but now that I'm off, 6 months later, a perhaps underlying eating disorder is coming into focus.I have had difficulties with overeating since I was in my early 20s while being on medication.  I am currently a certain amount of weight and 6'1'' and not on any medication.  This time last year I weighed a certain amount of weight.  My weight has fluctuated widely over the past 18 years.  I am trying to determine if it's the medication I've taken or if I truly have an eating disorder.  It very well might be both but I believe I need help and support just the same either way.  Right now, on binge days I eat a certain amount of calories.  This can last over a certain amount of time typically and occur on an almost weekly basis.  I use exercise to help control my weight and often over engage in that activity in response to overeating.  I have had depression and anxiety but currently do not experience them to a limiting degree.I'm looking for online and community support where I can talk with others about some of the difficult emotions and thoughts I'm experiencing while learning about tools and resources and the ways others have addressed their eating disorders.  I'm familiar with the 12 step approach through AA but I haven't found it especially helpful.  I'm not sure if it would be any different for an eating disorder but I'm open to hearing more information about it.I'm sorry if I'm sharing too much information in an overly straightforward way but I think it's important to give the complete, most accurate picture.  Sincerest thanks for any help and thoughts you're able to offer.

column5: Recently I've had to increase my meal plan. My Mom is really pushing me, which has really been stressing me out. I had been doing okay mentally on my last meal plan. But with the new meal plan, my depression and self harm behaviors have gone up. I just feel so anxious and sick when I think about having to eat or more/eating more food. Does anyone have any coping skills or experience with handling these situations?Alexo
column9: We're sorry to hear that you're going through a difficult time right now. Since you mentioned self harm, we just wanted to post up some resources in case you need to speak with someone:  Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or crisistextline.orgSAFE: (800) 366-8288 or selfinjury.com

column5:
My eating disorder story began in middle school. I was in 7th grade when I first stopped eating meals, which led to loss of weight. I was, and am still, too lazy to pack lunches for the following days. Yes, it is an excuse, but I am that lazy. My middleschool didnt provide lunch so we'd have to pack to eat but they sometimes had snacks for kids who forgot. I would hurridly grab a plastic bag and throw certain kinds of food  and eat that for lunch. Because i am a loner i sat mostly alone but sometimes i was able to sit with the grade below, and they noticed how small my packed lunch was and would ask why but id always reply 'I didnt have time' or 'I forgot' and usually 'Im not hungry', even though my stomach would be growling, unheard by the noise of the lunchroom.
I was able to rid myself of the habit of not eating a certain meal until the end of seventh grade but it came back worse in eigth grade. I would rarely bring anything to school at that point to eat. Before, in 7th grade, I only skipped a certain meal for about a certain amount of time during the middle of the school year.
Eigth grade came and left, with me losing weight in short random amounts, and I had begun to get dizzy sometimes when i engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms, which didnt happen daily at that point at least.
That summer leading to ninth grade I would usually engage in certain unhealthy coping mechanisms. But because I wasnt up and moving a lot during the summer I hadnt noticed how i had begun to get dizzier and dizzier when I would get up.
Ninth grade year, my first year of highschool, I blacked out for the first time in math 2. It was the middle of the year and we were taking a test in math, and one moment I was sitting down looking over the test, the next moment the bell rang and sounds and colors flowed back into me. I glanced back down at my test to see it had mysteriously been filled out by someone, surely not me as I hadnt remembered even filling out the first question. During ninth grade year i had stopped eating certain meals during the day. Everyday I would skip them, even on weekends when my family would make meals so that i didnt have to go through the trouble of making stuff. At that point, it was hard for me to make it up the school stairs to the math and science rooms without having to slow down and rest against a wall for a good 15 seconds. I would make it look like I had suddenly remembered something and began searching my bag or that i was tying my shoe and would rest my head on my knee until the fuzziness and pounding and pulsing in my head and the rest of my body would disappear. Because I was engaging in unhealthy coping mechanisms, the crowded lunchroom too scary for my anxiety filled self to overcome, I would sit along a wall near the lunch room and work on homework instead. When I would stand to go to my next class, Concert Band, I would always stand up too fast and my vision would go black with my hearing fading out.
Now, a 10th grader, it has reached peak point. I do not eat certain  meals throughout the day. I write it off as not having time or being too busy but that didnt pass the attention of my girlfriend. We had met right before the 10th grade school year had started and got together maybe a month after that, and we're now approaching our 5 month anniversary. My beautiful kind girlfriend, she noticed my eating issues. She noticed that i engaged in unhealthy coping mechanisms. She noticed when my weight dropped further and further. She notices, and she is helping. I am trying to get better for her and me, because I am tired of doing this to myself and her, but I believe I need professional help. And I cant get in person therapy, because my parents wouldnt pay for that. Thats a whole other uncovered secret of my life. My parents- they arent the best. Not even close. But basically if I were to tell them I wanted therapy for my Eating Disorder, father would laugh and point and then refuse to pay and mother wouldnt let me because no one is supposed to know Im not her perfect daughter. My girlfriend helps me through all of my issues with parents and eating disorders everyday. She still loves and supports me even though I am now teetering at the edge of underweight. And for that, I am grateful. I am happy she and I were able to meet.
I have other issues but those deal with anxiety and the likes, which do definently have major effects on my eating, but Im not sure if I would be going against community guidelines explaining or describing. All I've wanted for a while was a therapist to just talk to about such issues but I cant have one. And its hurting me but I have to wait until 18 for one.
Other details: Prior to my issue with not eating, I would engaged in other unhealthy coping mechanisms, which made me gain a lot of weight in short periods. This made me feel bad about myself and is that is why i began engaging in other unhealthy coping mechanisms. Now I can only eat small portions or it is too much.
This is my story. Sorry if it seems randomly ordered but I tried my best. School also is a main influencer of my eating, as it stresses me a great amount.
Sorry this is so longg!

We wanted to provide you with an additional list of signs and symptoms of a medical emergency to keep an eye on: A person does not have to be underweight to have an eating disorder or to require emergency medical care for one. Seek medical help immediately if you experience: • accidentally or deliberately causes themselves a physical injury• becomes suicidal• experiences confused thinking and is not making any sense• experiences delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• feels disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomits several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiences dizziness or fainting spells• feels too weak to walk or collapses• experiences painful muscle spasms• complains of chest pain or having trouble breathing• observes blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• has a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• has an irregular heartbeat or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• has cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit Or for any other serious medical concerns.We highly recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.

column5:
Hi everyone. Quick introduction. I have been binge eating for about eight years, but I didn’t realise that I had a problem until maybe a year or two ago, I always thought I just had low to no self control and loved the taste of food. But I started to realise that loving food wasn’t really my motive and when I got into a binge there was something else that came over me. Anyway. Now to today’s question.
I had a shoulder injury at the end of last year and was prescribed a pain killer. While on it, I had literally zero urges to binge eat. Has anyone else had this or a similar experience? I have Googled it and can’t find any related studies. Being on it, especially for a few days, makes me a bit nauseous, which isn’t fun. And I obviously don’t want to become addicted to it or anything. But I can’t help wondering why it helped my get my urges under control? Any help or explanations would be greatly appreciated as I am feeling very lost on this matter.

column5: I have a binge eating disorder and have for a months, or longer. Recently I've gotten worse, bingeing X times for the last few weeks except for the past few days. I binged today, and I hadn't for two days. I really want to take steps to recover and lose the weight I've gained, but I don't know what to do. What should I eat, what should I do mentally? Are there any tricks to make this easier? I'll appreciate any help or advice, or just comments from people here who are on the same road.

column4: BED and body image issues, venting and asking for help
column5: Hey all, sorry in advance for giant rant ahead, I just need to get this out... 28F here. I've had issues with my body and food for essentially my entire life. I was a bit of a chubbier kid, always aware of it, always very excited to eat food. In high school I became more aware that I was overweight and wasn't really desirable as such. I remember having unrequited feelings for guys, and then seeing their thinner, more beautiful girlfriends and thinking they clearly didn't like me as much because of how i looked. I have this vivid memory of one dude saying the words "ew, gross" at the suggestion he should date me. Looking back, obviously high school is a terrible, dumb place, but these experiences were powerful for me. So powerful that in college I restricted, dieted, and ran throughout my freshman and sophomore years until I was the smallest I've ever been as an adult, about X lbs on a 5'3" frame. Eventually I injured myself and couldn't run for a while, and I think that's when my issues with eating sort of kicked into gear. I remember days where I'd only eat certain foods for the entire day because that's what I wanted to eat, but I'd only have a certain amount so I could fit within a calorie goal for the day. Since then (the past 8 years or so), I've essentially lived in this weird space where I'm either counting calories or binging, trying to diet/restrict or doing the opposite. Here and there I've had moments where I have eaten intuitively and it's been okay, but for the most part I feel.. distressed. I got into powerlifting several years ago and that's certainly done wonders for my general health and self confidence, but I've been having a hard time recently. Just this past week, I tried eating X kcal a day for a couple of days, then the past two days I've ended up binging on random food around my apartment until I feel bloated and sick, awful, like I know I always will after I binge. I've been to therapists about this several times in the past, read probably every book under the sun about binge eating/intuitive eating/etc. It's clear my problems with food come from not liking my body. For years I've felt my body just isn't good enough, thin enough, to be attractive to the people I'm attracted to. It's like there's this fear in my head that if I can't be smaller, I'll never be truly lovable by someone I'm actually interested in. It's so... sad... to write it out here, knowing I'm so obsessed with my size and what I eat because of this fear. But I know that fear causes me to restrict, which causes me to binge. In reality, I'm a little overweight, but I know I'm not a particularly big or small size, just average-sized, strong, and relatively healthy. I'm once again exasperated. I don't know how to proceed with eating tomorrow. Do I count calories? Do I eat whatever I want without eating mindfully? Do I try to eat mindfully then kick myself for eating something when I'm not hungry? Do I eat nothing? It feels like I've lived every variation of a day of eating, and I don't know how to find normalcy. I wish I knew how to cope with prolonged hunger so I could lose weight. I wish I knew how to actually let go of caring about the size of my body, tying it to how lovable I am. Sometimes I think I obsess about weight loss because maybe I'm not desirable because of my personality.. so perhaps looking better would make the whole package more appealing to... someone. I currently am a medical student without much money to spare and (ironically?) have terrible insurance. My current inconvenient clinic hours (9-7 M-F) aside, I'm not sure I can even find an ED therapist in my area that I could afford. I'm just.. so tired. Every day is a new day, and every new day I get it wrong. It's weird, generally having my shit together in just about every area of my life except this one. I just want to let go. I want to eat healthy things, normal things, without treating myself every meal nor shying away from treating myself once in a while. It's like there's this normal version of myself I want to exist, but I haven't been able to figure out how to be her. If anyone out there has found success and made peace with their bodies, learned to eat normally, had any similar issues, etc.. I would love to hear from you. Frankly I'd love to hear from you even if you haven't had these issues. I don't want to live like this for my entire life. Sorry for this giant rant.. I'm not sure I've ever actually written out how I truly feel about food and my body because I'm so ashamed. Hope to hear from some of you lovely people soon. Thanks. -A

column4: don't know if I should get help
column5: I'm a freshman in college and pretty far from home and far from my brother and Dad so I've been doing a lot worse lately due to lack of accountability. No one knows I'm struggling, so my behaviors are overlooked. Prior to college, I hadn't purged in a long time, and now I'm doing so X times a week. I'm not sure if that's something that warrants help—in the past, I used behaviors with a much higher frequency and went to treatment, and now I feel like I'm not sick enough to need help but stuck in some kind of quasi-recovery where I'm oscillating between nourishing myself and trying to love myself but also hating my body and wanting to change it. I know getting support can't hurt me recovery-wise, but I'm not sure if I'm justified in getting it because therapy is just so expensive, and my student insurance doesn't cover much. Also I know most of you are probably not medical professionals, but does anyone know if it's an issue if I'm purging and there's a little blood? It's very little so I don't know if I need to be concerned or not. Thanks!

column4: Trying to learning to love myself so hard,need venting
column5: In the past couple of days, it was pretty rough because I had a temptation to go to the bathroom after I eat too much. I had mixed feelings after that. Worse, Today, I felt so sick for like three minutes after I worked out, I pushed myself too hard like I'm ready to pass out. But now, I'm alright. Food always in my mind as what can I eat or not. I'm drastic with food around people(my family). It is really completely exhausted, I'm starting to feel not great, I'm worrying too much. I'm trying to learn how to love myself and not feel like under the pressure from many things. I'm really trying so hard. Just frustrating about the triggering to led to became my coping mechanism daily plus I really want to lose weight too. Maybe should I write down on the sticky notes to a reminder of self-love? confidence? don't worry about food? or something? I don't know.

column4: Walking outside in the cold gave my chest area severe cramps.
column5: Was subbing yesterday and did a lap walking w/ my students. After a lap I met them for stretching exercises. At that time my chest began to tighten and seemed to have a severe cramp-pressured feeling until it went back inside after class. Today I walked after work, again very cold outside. I ran to inform a car driver that his side back passenger door seemed to be unlocked and was opening up an inch or so. I wanted to warn him so ran and signed to him about his car door. Then I walked home and all the way home my heart was beating hard. When I got home I became dizzy and weak. I was alone and my heart was beating very quickly. I even took a warm shower b4 eating dinner and after stirring the dessert was preparing for my class I became dizzy again. I opened the front door for more air. Then my brother came home and I seemed to be ok after some OJ and dessert which I was preparing. This was 1st incident feeling this way after running quickly on a very chilly night.

column5: My last true binge was 2/1 so about 9 days. I was so proud of myself I made it a week. I faced some triggers head on and was able to cope. Last night I got the urge to binge. When my husband would leave the room I would sneak handfuls of what I could from the pantry. This happened a few times. I kept telling myself I would let him go up to bed first and had grand plans in my head for my binge but then came to and decided to go up to bed. I was proud of my decision that I was able to change my habits without falling all the way down the rabbit hole. Yea, I wasn’t great, but this was not a binge for me. It didn’t make me feel sick at least and I regained control of myself. The issue is now I can’t sleep and all I can thinking is how I robbed myself of what I really wanted and how can I make up for it tomorrow. I’m finding myself now wanting to plan a binge and am giddy. I know that’s not the right mentality but am having a hard time now changing my mindset. What are some tools you use to stop yourself? It’s my birthday this week and although I’m married and have friends / family close by I still feel very alone. Then when all together I feel judged on how I eat if I go for multiples of desser and I just want one day to myself where I can celebrate my birthday how I want without hearing a word from anyone. Then I sit here wondering why I’d rather dodge plans with friends or family to binge in private. Is it the shame?  I just don’t know how to break this cycle. I know I need to be more concerned with my health - I actually do have a serious health problem unrelated to this - and should take better care of myself but it is just so hard. And no one understands. When I try to talk to my husband and share what’s going on on a smaller scale he just doesn’t get it and just says you won’t change if you don’t make changes. Well, no sh*t but it’s not that easy and people don’t understand that it’s a much deep rooted issue. I just need someone out there to tell me it’s ok to have one slip up and move on. I don’t need to start my week on a bad note by letting it turn into a binge. My birthday is in 5 days and I should go into happy and wanted to enjoy instead of shameful for my secret binges leading up to it. I just wish I had someone I knew in person to call or lean on. I’m starting to feel distant from all my friends and family because I’m living this secret life no one knows about. I lie to my husband and make up stories about errands to go and binge and sit in a parking lot where no would know and bounce from place to place until I’m so sick then because he doesn’t know I have to put on a happy face and still make dinner and eat like everything is ok. Well, it’s not Ok I don’t know how to do fix it. I’ve never felt so lost and alone in the world.

column5:
I’m new to these forums and this is my first time ever writing something like this. And I’m just looking for some people who can understand what I’m feeling.
So I've never been happy with my body. In October I started eating less where it would only be a certain amount a day. Sometimes I would lose control, but I would never be able to make myself engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms.
However, it got to the point where at night I couldn’t control the cravings and I lost control more often. It got to the point where I eventually started to engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms to make me feel less guilt about what I ate.
It would get rid of the stress and bad feelings and leave me feeling calm for a couple minutes after.
I never thought bad about it, but I told my boyfriend and he was speechless. He cried, told me I shouldn’t be doing this to myself, and begged me to stop hurting myself.
I stopped so I wouldn’t cause problems for us. After, I got a bit better where the thoughts didn’t control me anymore. But sometimes I would slip up and engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms.
That was my mind for a couple of months.
Until the new year, I made a commitment to lose weight. In the beginning, I went crazy and counted every calorie making sure I stayed under. And if I went over, I would engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms. It drove me crazy and was all I could think about. But I was losing weight so why would I stop?
When school started again, I lost focus and slacked. It made me gain back the weight.
But the stress of school, getting perfect grades, and band made me go back to my habits. It got really bad and I started seeing things changing. It started affecting my relationships.
I had crazy mood swings with my boyfriend and my family. And I physically noticed differences. I started looking paler. I physically became so tired much easier. My skin became dry when it was usually oily. My hair feels thinner, and I saw cavities ( and I never get cavities). My upper throat would feel swollen and I saw burns on the inside of my mouth. Not to mention how it affected me mentally.
But even with everything I saw, I couldn’t stop myself from coming home and engaging in unhealthy coping mechanisms. If I lost control, I would engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms when the cravings were irresistible.
A friend I told and my boyfriend don't understand and tell me to "just stop because it's so stupid. Why would you do that to yourself?". I also can't tell my mom because she doesn't believe in mental disorders.
Also, the mood swings were too hard for my boyfriend.  Where he told me he needed a break. The thing that made it worse was he said my “eating disorder” was a bit of the problem.
That was just four days ago, but this breakup is affecting me so so hard where I haven't stopped crying and feeling guilty for making my behavior need for him to take a break. And I feel like the breakup is fueling my problem.
I am wondering if I should get help? But I know I wouldn't know how or want to if I'm seeing results. The weight I’ve lost and the things I do are my coping mechanisms to this breakup.
I’m all alone and I can’t stop myself. I don’t know what to do, and I hope someone who might understand what I'm going through to give me some advice.

column5: So I went on a long period of time where I was binging (I only binge when I’m using other unhealthy coping mechanisms) anyway this happens every now and then and I often gain a lot of water weight (this time a certain amount of weight) and I always lose the water weight within a certain amount of time (so it’s NOT real wieight) it’s basically just really bad edema. I’m wondering if anyone else experienced this from binging- I received skepticism from my therapist essentially just saying she flat out didn’t believe me and disbelief from my GP. This for me is INFURIATING that clinicians and doctors have an insane lack of understanding when it comes to an eating disorder. Anyone feel me?

column5: Hey everyone was hoping that posting here might get me some feedback and some help. I've been recovering from Ed since early October last year so it's been probably 4 months. My eating disorder consisted of me cutting my calories and would exercise every day in multiple sessions Sunday through Thursday. When Friday started I would fast all day long and when it got to be about 7 at night I would eat something and start chugging alcohol to drop my guard. I then would proceed to binge eat the whole entire house Friday night and then go through the same process Saturday. When I would wake up Sunday all it took was 1 look in the mirror and I'd be back on the treadmill trying to make up for my weekend. Well when I first started recovery the binging was non stop whether I drank or not. I knew that it was a normal sign in recovery and after a month or so I actually started to feel full for the first time in years. I took that to mean I was finally back at a natural weight plus I my testosterone rebounded I was so excited. A few more weeks passed still not restricting diet but not binging on junk every day either. Well for the last 2 months I've been trying to eat clean and work out again and was having great success I'm stronger and bigger now than I've ever been. I even quit drinking alcohol at the start of the new year. My problem? I still cant stop binging.. all it takes is 3 days of clean eating even though I'm eating plenty of calories and I'll find myself waking up in the middle of the night running to the kitchen for my junk food. I'm really not certain what to do is this normal will it ever go away? The binge sessions and the way I look and feel after are the only things that ever make me feel like I would go back to my miserable ways of cutting weight. Any help or reply is greatly appreciated. Other than my mom dad and sister I'm fighting this alone and sometimes it's just nice to get some reassurance.

column4: quit purging, crazy weight gain, so scared
column5: hi, I've had anorexia for over 14 years, been purging for 9.  1 1/2 months ago I passed out, I started feeling super weak.  2 weeks ago, I felt I was going to die, so I told my mom to take me to the ER.  My potassium was very low.  They gave me IV fluids, and potassium pills.  I cried a lot, but decided I didn't want to die from purging.  I started eating... my weight went up. I have edema, my stomach is always distended.  I'm up to minimum caloric needs.  I don't have a treatment team because I dont have a job or insurance!  I'm so freaked out. Is all this weight going to stay?  Like I gained it in 3 days.  I don't know if I'm eating enough protein or what.  what do I do?
column9: Hi bygodsgrace, we are glad to hear you are finding support here on the NEDA online community forums. A portion of your post was edited due to the specific mention of behaviors and numbers that maybe triggering to other members of the forums. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines.  In the event you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to call the NEDA Helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday, 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm, EST). Additionally, we wanted to post the signs and symptoms of a medical emergency: The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience anything above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.

column5:
Hi everyone!
I'm literally shaking as I'm writing this. Also, I'd like to apologize for my grammar in advance, as English is not my native language. So I found this forum like 15 minutes ago and decided to just get this weight off my mind.
My story began about a year ago, so not so in the past as one may say. I was this typical teenage girl who wanted to lose some weight as the summer was coming. I signed up to the gym and decided to go on a diet.  I lost weight maintained my weight until one of my relative's communion. There was a lot of food, let me just say this. And I ate a lot. I even cried out because I felt bad for myself when I wanted to eat more.
The time passed and slowly, first twice a month, then once a day (every day) I had my binging episode. I ate until my chest hurt from the amount of food I put into my mouth and it was hard for me to breathe. It continued for a quite some time. I told my parents about it after 5 months or so. I decided to go to a dietitian. But let me tell you this, no diet will help you if you can't commit. I was diagnosed with insulin resistance which is not so severe but could lead to diabetes, which is common in my family. So yeah, I wasn't able to stick to a diet for longer than 3 days. I eventually resigned.
What are you doing now, one may ask. Well, I try, but fruitlessly. Every morning is like a fresh start for me until I see something I'm craving, then I can't stop.  Eventually, I gained weight. Just imagine how bad I feel right now, as this number is increasing.
I decided to write this post because I feel It could help me a little bit. Getting it off my chest. And maybe tomorrow will be THE day, who knows. Also, I'd like to say that I'm glad I am not the only one struggling and I was thrilled when I saw this place. Cuz there are people that are willing to help me; these blessed beings want to hear and listen to me. The fact that I am able to write my feelings down is great and I feel relieved.
So yeah, I guess that's it. I hope this will be the only time I speak on this forum as a sufferer and maybe next time I'll be able to actually help someone. Okay, pray for me guys~! Because I'm tired and disgusted by myself. I know that it's important to love yourself, I've heard all his positive body image bs but it's not what I want to think about right now. I want to stop eating those amounts. That's all.
Blessings!

column5: I've always had a lot of struggle with food and eating. Something pretty bad happened over the summer and I started to srsly binge and eat alot to cope. I've gained so much weight over the past 6 months and it's really taken a toll on my self confidence and self image. Like I hate the way I look and I avoid looking in mirrors. It got a little better for like three weeks, but now because of midterms and everything, its gotten a lot worse. I've been eating so much, stress eating and just binge eating cus it's almost a habit at this point. It makes me feel so shitty about myself and distracts me from studying well. My grades have started to drop too and its rlly bad.I just recently got a boyfriend, and he's super supportive and everything, but whenever I see him talking to another girl I get so paranoid almost, because everyone is so much skinnier and better looking than I am, and it makes me feel so shitty and self conscious, and then when I get home, I end up binging again. Idk whats wrong with me and why do I do it if I know its so bad for me. I feel so terrible all the time about it.Does anyone have any advice?

column4: Do I have an eating disorder
column5: Hello I'm Jesse, I was told by a doctor's examination that I look anorexic. So I took a BMI test, I know this just calculates your weight and has nothing to do with mental illness. I think my BMI is decreasing from my last test. I find most food nauseating. I almost never eat not because I'm avoiding food but because I find allot of it sickening. Idk if I'm just full of shit when it comes to food.

column5: I was diagnosed with non purging bulimia with occasion purging bulimia about 4 months ago. I have an extreme pre-occupation with food. I am doing a lot better since the start of my recovery I have gone from extremely unhealthy coping mechanisms to being able to at least eat and exercise in a more moderate way. However, I have just arrived back at college and with added stress of school and being away from home and not having a structured schedule I seem to have more episodes of binge eating that leads me to fasting or doing obsessive amounts of cardio. I have severe guilt when I consume food that I feel is “unhelathy” but I’m slowly working towards expanding my diet and improving my relationship with food. I hope that if I can find a buddy who is also dealing with an eating disorder we could help each other out. We would have a similar idea of what we are going through and we would be able to build each other up and be the support we really need! I hope to find someone.

column4: I don't feel like I have anorexia
column5:
I was diagnosed in March 2018 that I had anorexia, but for so many reasons I don't believe I do!
I've done months of FBT which was a nightmare as my family is a mess and I refused all help and meals etc. and found it too controlling and harsh. I started CBT very recently, but I feel like I don't even need to go, because I can't help eating lots in the evenings.
I call them "binges" though apparently the calorie content isn't quite enough for that- but it definitely feels that way.
I really struggle to eat throughout the day, then at a certain point during the day, suddenly feel like I have to eat.
Dinner as well isn't. challenge for me. I'm able to eat it just fine, and afterwards I even have a small bit of whatever dessert is on offer... but after dinner I find that I can't control myself. I'll end up picking at leftovers until I've eaten whole portions, or I'll eat foods that during the day are terrifying and I would never eat. It always ends in guilt and feeling miserable and trying to sleep it off (I have a fear of sick so have never purged), and the next day is the same.
I felt like I had Night Eating Syndrome, which I don't according to my therapist, or BED (again, i don't)
I feel like I don't deserve to be in recovery treatment because I don't engage with it and I feel like my behaviour isn't that of a real anorexic! Has anyone else gone through this????????

column5: Hi ( I'm new here) and am interested in talking with others about finding affordable treatment for an EDNOS diagnosis. I recovered from anorexia many years ago but still have problems with disordered eating and sometimes feel like there's nothing there for me unless I have $100 a week for a therapist co-payment ( plus more if I plan on going to a nutritionist etc). I'm wondering how others manage to deal with this e.g. asking family for support or finding other ways to pay the medical expenses. To be clear- I'm medically stable so seeking out coverage for a PHP or IOP through my insurance company wouldn't be necessary.I really want to work towards recovery but sometimes feel like I'm at a dead end. Thoughts?
column9: Hello sarahniamhy and welcome to the forums! It can be hard to find affordable treatment options, but NEDA is here to help. The following link can help you find treatment in your area: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/find-treatment/treatment-and-sup...If you need additional help or support, please reach out to the helpline at 1-800-931-2237: Monday-Thursday from 9:00am-9:00pm and Friday from 9:00am-5:00pm EST.

column4: Not Much to do with Emotions
column5:
Hello! This is my first time posting and I am doing it because I am really stuck. I have read a lot of stories and don’t really relate to any of them.
I am definitely a binge eater. I only discovered it recently but thinking back I have been doing it for almost eight years.
I am a bit over weight, but am comfortable in my skin. I do not try to eat less or restrict my calories (although I did in the passed, but never excessively). I eat tonnes. I live with my boyfriend - he doesn’t know about all this. So in the beginning it was difficult for me to binge. But know that I have realized that he is incredibly unobservant, I binge more than ever. I still eat normal sized meals a certain amount of times per day and then binge on top of that. I occasionally purge but only when I am feeling incredibly sick, otherwise I don’t do anything about it. I am quickly getting fatter. I live a fairly active lifestyle and people are always surprised that I don’t eat so much in public but am quite chubby. I am very embarrassed and never want my family knowing about my disorder.
But I can’t contain myself and I don’t even feel that guilty for doing it. I am wasting all my money on food to binge on. Last month I ran out of money and ate a certain amount of food because there was nothing else sweet in the house. I really need help as I have tried everything I can think of and it’s just getting worse. Thank you for reading.

column5:
Hi guys,
Has anyone recieved professional help for their BED? If so, what was the advice they gave you. The woman who I am working with told me to try to do Intuitive Eating. I am worried I will gain weight through this system but she said it will help you get ot your "set weight."  She told me to eat a certain amount of meals per day. I just want to confirm that this is the typical advice given. I found her online so I was just wondeirng. She also set me up to use an account log called Recovery Record. Does anyone else use this?
Lmk!
Thanks and love the support from you guys!

column4: 13yr old Daughter desperately needs help - NJ - Bulimia
column5:
I live in NJ with my husband & my twin 13yr old girls.
One of my girls has been struggling for bulimia for just over a year.  She was in an outpatient program for eating disorders that did not help at all, yet they discharged her.
Slowly she has gotten worse.
Now it is out of control.
A few timesa week she is binging & purging.  She is fine normally until later in the night, then will eat so much.  Ends up with her throwing up & crying.
She tells me she is a burden to us and she feels bad & cries more.Side note, she is in a 'therapeutic school' as she has emotional & psychiatric issues.
She has bipolar disorder, anxiety, dyslexia, possible auditory processing disorder.I want to try avoiding taking her out of school again.  So thinking a program that meets a few times a week and/or a therapist who works mainly or only with eating disorders.I put all the parameters into the search features on this site though & nothing was found.Anyone in NJ with suggestions?  My poor sweet daughter really needs some help.  :(
column9: We are glad that you are finding support here on the NEDA forums. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines. column5: I never really purged my food, but I tried X times last week, once I had a sure throat and stomach ache after. Since then I keep having some physical problems. I feel weak and sleepy all the time, my stomach hurts. Sometimes I find it difficult to breathe. I was wondering, could the attempts of throwing up be the cause, even though I didn't actually do it?

column5: Hi, I'm new to this. I have been suffering with occasional binging for the past year and it has got worse recently.i used to chew and spit when I was a competitive athlete and then started binging. On days where I binge I stay in my room and cannot do anything else. I feel really guilty and depressed after it. The next day I feel the need to restrict. On days where I feel the need to binge it's almost uncontrollable. It's usually days where I don't have much planned and when I feel empty and lonely. It's is very frustrating and tough. I haven't been to therapy and when I talk to people ( only have talked to two people) they don't understand fully.

column5:
Hi
I have never told anyone about my eating disorder. I only felt compelled to write about it because I cannot deal with it on my own any more. I have never been diagnosed, but I know I have binge eating disorder. I will often(usually when babysitting or by myself) consume huge amounts of food until I feel horrible. I then compensate by not eating much for a couple days- or going on a diet and setting aside one day to consume an unhealthy amount of food.I am 16 years old, and I have been struggling with this for about 6 years that I can remember. It only gets worse as my mom has known for years about my “unhealthy habits” as she has found piles of wrappers in my room but she doesn’t know the extent of my problem. My mom is a huge problem to me mentally as she criticizes the way I look, as I have slowly put on weight over the years.Sorry for the long jumbled rant- I just suddenly felt like I needed to tell someone about this.

column5:
I'm not sure if I even have an eating disorder. I mean, I guess I have the signs but part of me thinks I can stop anytime i want to. But I restrict my food, and when i can i fast. If i eat too much occasionally I'll throw up, but whenever i eat i feel guilty and fat. I secretly bought myself a scale i hide so my mom doesn't find out, and when i see i gain weight i feel so terrible. I lose a lot of hair now, too. Which i didn't use to. It's been like this since last summer. I even went vegetarian as an excuse to not eat with my family.
Like a few months ago i was constantly having dizzy spells and was always tired, and one morning i stood up and when i was walking to the bathroom i was dizzy and couldn't see and collapsed, my body was doing some weird uncontrollable
wild shaking.
I still get dizzy spells fairly often, but it's back to being really bad like that one day I collapsed and standing is so hard I feel like i'm going to just break, but i don't want to collapse again.
I'm not sure what to do. I'm really scared. the school nurse mentioned to my mom a few weeks ago i might have an eating disorder, my mom laughed it off but if I collapse she might think i do.

We encourage you to seek help from a doctor that can help you. In the event you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to call the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday 9:00am-5:00pm EST). Since you also mentioned having a number of physical symptoms,  we just wanted to post some signs and symptoms of a medical emergency just in case. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. column5:
Hello everyone! It's my first post here because I really need to talk to "somebody" about my ED and I don't feel comfortable to share it with my friends or my parents, because they don't really know what's going on.
I'm currently 20 years old and it all started when I was 16. Up until then, I didn't care at all about how I looked and what I was eating, and I wasn't underweight (I've always been thin). In 2014, I noticed that everyone was getting in the mood to be healthier and leaner, so I decided maybe I should start exercising and eating better. Long story short, I ended up working out more (but only for 3 weeks or so) and eating too little. I think it was the less I've ever been in that period. I was never diagnosed with an eating disorder because I wasn't really anorexic, but I lost my period and I really needed to put the weight back in. Also, I fell into depression and started taking antidepressants.
One year after reaching my lowest weight, I got my period back and regained weighed. My eating habits changed because I kept on eating healthier, though. So, I thought I had recovered and even tried to stop taking the antidepressants, but when I went to college my depression attacked once again and I started eating less again, but I didn't really lose a lot of weight and I had my period most of the time.
Now, this year is leaving my annoyed and frustrated as hell. Instead of living like a normal person, I can't stop thinking about what I eat and I started binge-eating, specially at night. I know that a solution would be to just eat more frequently throughout the day, but I only enjoy eating when I'm really hungry, not just a little bit hungry, even though I feel bad and disgusting after that. That is one of my problems.The bottom line is: I'm tired of thinking about what I eat and what others eat. I'm also tired of going on social media and seeing everyone losing weight and getting fit because I think I should do the same, yet I really shouldn't... I like how I look. I guess I'm just scared of gaining weight, but I'm also scared of starving myself and losing weight, so my eating habits are getting crazy.
Thank you so, so much for reading this... and PLEASE HELP ME if you can. I don't know what to do anymore. Thanks once more. Really, thank you all for existing.

column5: Hi there, After being in denial of my restricting and purging via exercise for a few months now, I have come to terms with the fact that I do have an ED and I am in the process of getting treatment. Everything began to spiral out of control for me back in September when I started a diet and started "healthily" incorporating exercise into my life several days a week. These exercises quickly became more and more intense and if I didn't run a certain amount a day, I failed and I was very upset with myself. From what I have heard in this beginning stage of recovery, it is not a good decision to continue forward with this exercise and honestly it is the most terrifying part of this whole process. I understand that the pressure I put on exercise was/is unhealthy, but it feels very uncomfortable to not even have the freedom to run/workout at all because I did enjoy my runs as a stress reliever. I guess I was just wondering if anyone else in recovery has experienced any similar struggles/disappointment. It really has been bringing me down and being deprived of it makes me want to run that much more. Thank you for reading and for going through this with me.

column4: Rainy weather, and working later at mall job today...
column5: Rainy weather makes me feel extra shut in and anxious. I need a hair trim and a coloring job but in this weather feel stuck indoors. I also feel guilty to go anywhere on a day when I haven't accepted a teaching job assignment, like today for instance...I am planning to go visit a local beauty college soon. Last I went there they did a very good job. I had 1 dresser who was working w/ me for months. Then 1 day I went for my usual  Saturday hair trim and she had graduated and moved on in the world. I liked her as a hairdresser and actually hoped to go to her new place of business after she had graduated. So that feeling of losing someone I befriend is difficult for me to handle...I just need to get used to driving over there to the beauty college once again. its all about routines in my life. I suppose I'm like a cat. Animals like routines, as do children, and even I do too.My weight is still flexing over my comfort zone. I need to find some alt foods to switch to from this 1 food I use daily. I find myself constipated way too often.I work a 5 hr shift tonight. Tomorrow I am still hoping to pick up a decent teaching job, and then am due at my mall job from 4-8-ish.Still feeling anxious as I am writing this entry here.I hate to be so GOAL DRIVEN but currently, I am totally feeling this need for my goal driven daily routines. I think my background history of being athletically competitive and involved in different sports from age 9-15, and 18-35-ish for routine lap swim classes was what kept me super disciplined for many mouthful years of my life.I can't ever allow myself to wander astray from my routines of exercise and self-discipline because when I do is when my anxiety increases and I feel extra yucked out and that's not how I like to feel usually.
column9: Hi, chunkymonkey68, part of your post was edited due to specific details that might be triggering for others. Please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Additionally, we did want to provide the medical emergency signs and symptoms. The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention:• accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury• become suicidal• confused thinking and is not making any sense• delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there)• disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are• vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea• experiencing dizziness or fainting spells• too weak to walk or collapses• painful muscle spasms• complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing• blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit• a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16• an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute)• cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees FahrenheitOr any other serious medical concernsIf you experience any of the above, we highly recommend seeking medical attention as soon as possible. Another option is 911.

column4: Figuring Out My Disorder; Need Help with Easy-to-eat Foods
column5: Hi everyone, This is my first time on this forum and I’m really excited as I’m looking forward to a lasting recovery with everyone’s help. I have lots of background for you all to consider, but mostly am looking for assistance in finding foods that are easy to prepare and eat. I have a problem when it comes to chewing food a lot, so I like to have softer foods. I’m still in the process of determining exactly what my disorder is, as I do eat, but I don’t like to. I’ve been raised with an “eat to live, don’t live to eat” mentality, plus a single dad (who is amazing) that doesn’t have the best cooking skills. I’m learning to cook and have helped him, just as much as he’s trying to help me. I’m 18, 5’5” and about X lbs, and am trying to get to X. The heaviest I’ve been is X. As more background, I do struggle with pretty severe anxiety and cyclical depression usually around the holidays and May, when my mom passed away years back. These times suck especially because they’re end of semester, and this is usually when I tend to get extra stressed as well, and end up losing weight. In years past, I usually lose about X pounds when the depression hits, and gain it back a couple of months after, and then it hits again. It’s exhausting. I know I’m underweight even at my highest weight, but I cannot manage to put on the weight nor maintain it for more than a couple of months. Because I know I do eat, and I will, and I just don’t enjoy it, the help I’m looking for are easy to prepare recipes or foods, that are also easy to eat. I am lazy and unmotivated when going through my depressive episodes, and need stuff that is easily accessible and high in calories or nutrition. Please feel free to ask any questions necessary to help me better and I will get back to you ASAP I greatly appreciate everyone’s forthcoming advice. Best to everyone!
column9: Hi, stephanieo2000, glad to see that you're looking forward to being on the forums! We're so sorry to hear about your mother. We just wanted to let you know that a portion of your post was edited and deleted due to the mention of specific numbers and behaviors. Our community guidelines are always available to review here:    https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We are not medical professionals here, so we can't offer you advice on what you're looking for. In the event you need further assistance such as listings of medical professionals in your area, please do not hesitate to call the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday 9:00am-5:00pm EST) or even chat with us! If you need anyone to talk to in a crisis please text "NEDA" to 741-741 or the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273 - 8255.

column4: Taking my first step towards recovering from Bulimia
column5: Hi Everyone, Today my boyfriend and I had a serious talk about the eating disorder that has been running and ruining my life. I have been struggling with binging/purging for a little over 2 years now. I was a victim of domestic violence and things seemed to spiral from there. Once me and my present boyfriend got together things seemed to get a lot better and then all of a sudden I started to notice myself having the constant urge to lose weight but not having time to go to the gym or eat healthy as I was in school at the time and working 2 jobs. As soon as I saw weight loss from binging/purging without having to do the work It seemed to overwhelm my life and now I cant eat a normal meal without the anxiety that follows it to find a bathroom and make sure no one notices. My boyfriend and I live together now which caused him to realize how serious this is. I am now only X pounds at 5'7 and havent been this skinny since middle/school or high school. I understand that this is a serious problem and I do really want to get help but my obsession with my appearance and weight are stopping me from completely giving in to recovery. Other than my Boyfriend who is urging me to get help and being extremely supportive my family and friends do not know. They constantly tell me that I look "good' or "in shape" and think that I am just exercising and eating right. I have been looking into finding a therapist that will work for me and am looking for suggestions as to what type of therapists or therapy will help? Or what my next steps should be to get a hold of these urges and work towards a more healthy lifestyle. Any advice and encouragement helps. Thank you in advance!
column9: Hi, selizabeth22, we're sorry to hear that you have been struggling. We're glad you came to the forums looking for a bit of support. We just wanted to provide you with this resource in case you wanted to talk to someone about what you have gone through --  RAINN: www.rainn.org or (800) 656-4673. Part of your post was edited because a mention of specific number, please take a look at our community guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. If you're interested in getting a listing of therapists in your area, you are welcome to contact the NEDA Helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday 9:00am-5:00pm EST) or chat with us!

column5:
My name is Amy and I am struggeling heavily with my eating disorder. I feel so isolated and the feeling of being a ghost. I am completely alone in this and people around me don't care and they don't see me. It's the feeling of being completely alone, feeling numb, apathetic, dead from the inside. People see my body, but they don't see my panic, my struggles when it comes to weight and food. So most people who would see me think I am fine because I don't lost a lot of weight yet.
I am stuck in a body and a life that I don't want to be in anymore. It makes me really depressed.There is nobody in real life and I struggled so much with my past that is really hard to function anymore. I struggle with it everyday. I never talk about it with anyone. So from the outside everything looks okay. But to be really honoust, I punish myself for everything that happend and I am destroying my body. Never do I ask for help, but I feel so alone in this and like being in a prison.
It made me realize that it's absurd to fight against an eating disorder alone.
It's way to heavy. It's just difficult to get help where I live, so that's why I come here. It's not easy to get the right person or treatment, to solve it without support from family or friends, that's something I care carry for a while, but it's becoming to much for me. I cannot do this alone anymore.Something in my mind wants to go on, wants to live, wants to have a family, a life, to have energy, to go everywhere that you want to go. I want to start living again but I feel that my enviroment suppress my sensitivity. I cannot live in cruelty, where people have their own lifes, look at you and laugh at you because you don't have the things they have.Never did I have a stable basis in my live or an example.
I always had to figure out alone how to deal with things.
That's really hard because people expect so much these days, and do to everything alone that is impossible. Everybody has a mother, a father, a brother, sister, friends, work, etc.
The things you need on this planet, I didn't have them when I was young, and I still don't have it, so I feel so lost. Like being alone on the dark, cold streets looking at a window with Christmas and you see other family's being together in their warm, cozy house, having a nice time, laughing, making jokes, giving each other love and presents. They have their children, loved ones, pets. Etc.It's so easy to say that you have to be happy on your own. And although I sound so negative now, this is not who I am. I really try to see things positive and to keep busy, to change things in my life. But it's almost impossible, because of the fact that I am ignored and rejected by people.
If I have so many dreams in my mind, but then there is no motivation, there is no love, no sensitivity. There is only the feeling of being ignored, being alone, not understood.
But my body doesn't have the energy anymore, it's really exhausted. It's really difficult to have a normal, stable, healty life and it feels like my body is giving up. My mind is positive most of the time, and I feel that their is some sort of hope.
That things will be better one day.
I just don't know what to do anymore?
The thoughts about my body, the food, it takes me over completeley. I don't expect anything but I wanted to tell what's on my mind. All those feelings and emotions about my past, being  supressed, being alone, ignored, the way you have to look these days by society. It triggerd this demon inside of me. Who is so angry at the situation and also on my self, that I feel that I am against a wall and the only control that I have is the eating disorder. My thoughts are so heavy, extreme and dark that it's feels like the only way to cope with my feelings. It exhausts my body and mind and but something in me still doesn't want to give up!Normally I don't talk about anything what is on my mind, I am extremely closed but on the moment I have the feeling that I will explode, I cannot keep this for myself any longer and I hope to receive some support, nice words, comfort, help.Thank you so much for reading my story and I hope we can support each other with our internal wars.
column9: Hello DeadSouls and welcome to the forums! We are sorry to hear you’re struggling with eating concerns and have experienced difficulty finding treatment . You are not alone in facing this obstacle. You can find some information about accessing benefits on our website at: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/learn/general-information/insurance. You can also find information about free and low cost support at:https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/free-low-cost-support. Additionally please feel free to give our toll-free helpline a call at 1-800-931-2237, the Helpline and click-to-chat hours are Monday- Thursday 9am-9pm EST and Friday 9am-5pm EST.  A trained volunteer should be available during those times to talk with you about your concerns. You are not alone in this and we hope that you find support to help you begin healing.
column13: Additionally, it seems like you're going through a lot and we just wanted to provide you with some resources in case you need to speak with someone. Crisis Text Line: Text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.org Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org

column4: Finally getting help with my bulimia
column5: Years ago I had an issue with binging and purging but it never got out of hand.  I had started to engage in unhealthy coping mechanisms and eating a lot.  I was in a relationship with someone who also did the same type of unhealthy coping mechanisms and all we did was the unhealthy coping mechanisms and eat, so I somehow found a way to stop the binging and purging.  Let's jump ahead ten years now.  I had a very hectic year in 2018.  My nana passed away, my cousin was diagnosed with a stage four terminal cancer, and I got kicked out of my place for a certain reason when I was told not to but did anyways.  In August of 2018, I had a close friend of mine tell me like it is.  She told me I needed to get my life together and stop engaging in the unhealthy coping mechanisms.  I started to slowly stop myself from engaging in the unhealthy coping mechanisms and that's when the bulimia came back.  It was something I had control over and something I was able to focus on.  It was not bad at first.  I finally stopped doing this certain type of unhealthy coping mechanism on October 19th after I was in a bad car accident that totaled my car.  I started eating better and going to the gym more and I lost some weight, which everyone noticed.  It made me feel good.  This is when my bulimia got to be at its worst.  All I think about is how many calories I'm consuming in a day and going to the gym.  When I do eat healthy, I barely eat.  It's the same foods every time I eat.  But if I eat something that isn't healthy, I can't help but purge.  Once I eat something bad, I just continue until I feel like absolute garbage. I can't stop, though. I recently told my doctor who then put me on an anti-anxiety medicine to help my obsessive thoughts.  It's been a week now.  I've also joined in on an online chat support group that happens Wednesday evenings and it was such an eye-opener.  I don't know how to think any other way.  It CONSUMES my mind.
column9: Hi deedee0705, We are glad to hear you are finding support here on the NEDA online community forums. A portion of your post was edited and deleted due to the specific mention of behaviors and illegal drug use that maybe triggering to other members of the forums. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines.  In the event you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to call the NEDA Helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (Monday-Thursday, 9:00am-9:00pm, Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm, EST).

column4: My New Sig Other is a Controlling Paramedic EMT
column5: So last we dated I felt anxious and after the purchase and consumption of this fav movie food of mine I felt guilty and had to go to the bathroom. So I excused myself and went. I don't know what his trip is. Perhaps he had a bad relationship w/ someone in the past. So he feels the need to control me whenever we are together. Unfortunately, he has been visiting me unannounced a few times a week, and usually around my dinner or meal times. I'm not sure if he is in love with me or in love w/ controlling me?
