column4: feeling like my silence invalidates my struggle
column5: whether it's a good or a bad thing, i pride myself on being a VERY strong willed individual. I've struggled with depression/anxiety, and and eating disorder for what most people would probably consider a long, long time, but i have never been diagnosed nor have i EVER opened up to my parents about it. my friends have been able to give me support with anxiety issues and depressive/suicidal ideations/self harm, however when it comes to my ed i haven't been able to open up about it. I've been struggling with disordered eating for probably about 2-3 years now that i think about it, but it used to be just skipping a few meals/ fasting for a while, however this summer it really came on full swing when i went to summer school alone for a month. I have been only eating a certain amount and lost weight. i thought the behaviours would stop once i came home but (obviously) no such thing happened. relatives noticed and commented about my weight loss but since my family has always been on the thin side so it was easy to write it off as "just losing my baby fat". My mother brought it up almost obsessively (i understand she comes from the best possible place but it was infuriating at times). now, i was never technically underweight, definitely on the lower side of the scale but still not underweight, however for the past 4 months i have felt like a shell of who i used to be. i was always angry, i felt like i was floating and couldnt focus on a single thing. somehow something inside me just cracked last week and (after some tears and a lot of thinking things through) i decided enough is enough and i would take things into my own hands. i've slowly started eating a certain amount of meals a day(sometimes i cant manage much but it's better than nothing), im very bloated a lot of the time and it's terrifying to look into the mirror but i keep trying to refocus my thoughts on how no amount of weight loss will give me back my happiness. it's hard, but what's even harder is this roadbump i've hit. i keep coming back to the feeling that i've just faked this whole "eating disorder". i mean after all no one's ever used the words anorexia or EDNOS or anything like that. i haven't shared any of my feelings and struggles with ANYONE i know. im aware that, again, it's the disorder trying to retake control, but i feel like i almost have to Prove to my parents and close friends that i've been suffering so much these past few YEARS, let alone these worst 4-5 months. i'm determined to get on the road to recovery, and yet the feeling that i dont Deserve to recover/i have nothing to recover from keeps creeping over me. and i really don't know what to do. do i gather up my courage and bring up these struggles with my parents even After i've decided to attempt to get better? it feels a bit redundant, like im just seeking attention. after all wanting recognition for your suffering seems stupid. an i just crazy?
column9: “Hi andwewilllive!  We are glad that you are finding support here on the NEDA forums. A portion of your post was edited due to the mention of numbers and details about disordered eating behavior that may be triggering to other forum members. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines. In the event you need further assistance please call the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (M-Th 9-9 F 9-5 EST). Again, thank you for posting, and we hope you will continue to do so!
column13: Hello andwewilllive, just because you mentioned suicide ideation and self harm we wanted to provide you with some resources that you can reach out to if you feel like you need to speak with someone if these thoughts come up again: Crisis Text Line: text "NEDA" to 741-741 or www.crisistextline.org/get-help-now. National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: (800) 273-8255 or www.suicidepreventionlifeline.orgIMAlive: (800) 784-2433 or www.imalive.orgDial Help Inc: Call (904) 482-4357 or text (906) 356- 3337 or www.dialhelp.org S.A.F.E: Call (800) 366 - 8288 or www.selfinjury.com

column5: I hope it's ok to post this here, if not sorry everyone and mods please remove and accept my apologies. I really don't know where else to turn, except maybe my dr but I am just not ready for that yet.Ive always struggled with my weight. Being on the chubby side a bit. My mom would make fun and call me out for it, despite not being the same way herself. In my 20's I began counting calories and keeping a food diary, giving myself only a certain amount of calories a day allowance. I lost weight. Mostly everyone gave me positive feedback. And this just fuelled me, to hear things like "you're so tiny" and "so skinny" felt rewarding. Then I got married and had two babies. My weight shot up. Three years ago I almost bled to death from a peptic ulcer on my bathroom floor, while my husband and kids were out. If they hadn't come home when they did, I was told I would not have made it. This began a battle with anemia and low iron. I had monthly blood transfusions and iron infusions. I lost a massive amount of weight. Partially because I was sick, and didn't want to eat because it hurt my stomach so much. But it turned into me wanting to remain thin and underweight, at any cost. I calorie counted and exercised too much. I finally got to a point where my health improved but my eating barely did. I remained thin but not underweight per say.  I have social anxiety, to the point I sometimes don't want to leave my house. It feels like due to the face that I’ve gone through certain situations, I have zero control over anything. My body. My life.Thus began what I wonder isn't an eating disorder...my "symptoms" are as follows...(yes I know that only a professional can diagnose me, I am just looking for answers before I go that route, if I go that route). Symptoms:1. I am eating a certain amount of calories a day on purpose.  Sometimes I eat more when others express concern but not often, I blame my lack of eating due to the fact my health is heading south again, because of new ulcers.2. I have a lot of inner dread that when I do eat, I will gain weight from even one meal or snack. 3. I hate eating in front of people, I feel like they are judging me. I'm not exactly why I feel like that. But when I do eat, I almost always wait till I am alone to do so. 4. When I look in the mirror, I can see that I am too thin. But yet my head is constantly telling me that I am fat. That I still have like a certain amount of weight to lose. 5. I am constantly tired, weak, dizzy and easily out of breath. When I stand up from sitting or standing, heck even kneeling..I am so dizzy I have to brace myself for fear of fainting and inability to move. My entire body shakes, and everything spins. I'm cold all the time, even when others are complaining it's too warm. My cognitive function is slightly impaired. I forget things so easily. I struggle to recall words at times when I am talking. 6. I think about my weight and food constantly. It is taking over my life. I can barely take care of my kids, because I lack the energy to do so.7. My emotions are a mess. I am typically a happy person, who is hard to anger. But lately it's not like that. I'm snappy and short in patience. 8. I mostly try to hide my weight loss, with baggy tops and layers.Sorry this was so long. Thank you for reading. Any opinions, good or bad are welcome. =>
column9: Hi NinjaSocks,We are so sorry to hear what you're going through right now but we are glad that you are finding support here on the NEDA forums. A portion of your post was edited and deleted due to the mention of calories, weight, sexual assault and abuse that may be triggering to other forum members. Our community guidelines are always available to review here: http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/community-guidelines.Also, here are a couple of phone numbers that you can contact. 1) The "Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network" phone number is: (800) 656-HOPE (4673)   2) S.A.F.E. Alternatives Self-Harm Information Helpline: 1-800-DONT-CUT (366-8288).  In the event you need further assistance, please do not hestitate to call the NEDA helpline at 1-800-931-2237 (M-Th 9-9 F 9-5 EST).
column13: Hi, Ninjasocks. It sounds like you have described some symptoms of a medical emergency. It is important that you seek medical attention immediately. Can you contact the doctor you are currently seeing? Another option is calling 911. In order to receive accurate treatment it is important to notify the medical staff that your symptoms could be related to your eating concerns.The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention: • accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury • become suicidal • confused thinking and is not making any sense • delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there) • disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are • vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea • experiencing dizziness or fainting spells • too weak to walk or collapses • painful muscle spasms • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing • blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit • a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16 • an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute) • cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit.

column5: Hi.  I usually post under maintaining recovery.  But tonight I am doing both.  I suffered many years, thirty-two or so, with various eating disorders in varying degrees.  I was hospitalized twenty seven times.  Some lasting a year, some six months, some two weeks.  I spent time in half way houses, day programs and am still in therapy.  I say all this to encourage you believe it or not!!!  I have been going through quite a trial with two of my sisters, one of whom I live with.  Since this summer I have been set free from my behaviors and addictions.  Self harm, overeating and binging.  I have been free from anorexia for about two years.  I never thought  this possible.   But during this time of great struggle, I have remained behavior free.  I have used what I have dubbed my recovery muscle.  I rely on my faith in Jesus, and the love of my friends and my parents.  I use skills I have learned.  I now know that full recovery is possible.  I do not know what tomorrow holds, but I trust that I will continue on as I am, facing the issues head on, talking about them with friends and my parents, and my therapist, and believe I will remain behavior free.  I now know that the misuse of food and exercise and self harm does bring a temporary relief, but the problems don't go away but are only compounded when using these maladaptive behaviors.  I share to give you hope that you too may one day be penning these very same words.  I never thought it possible, but...and you can fill in the blank.  You can share your story of recovery to others.  I leave you with this message of Hope.iwanttolive
column9: Dear iwanttolive,You mentioned self-harm and we want to make sure you have the appropriate resources to get help. If you ever feel unsafe this number is really important to have: (800)-273-8255 or text "NEDA" to 741741 Crisis Text Line by texting “NEDA” to 741-741 or call The S.A.F.E. Alternatives Self-Harm Information Helpline at 1-800-DONT-CUT (366-8288) immediately for support.

column5: I'm tried of this eating disorder. Why does it take is over????? I hate myself and my life. Nothing matters. I am trying not to Binge Eat!! Please just go away forever.

If you don't feel comfortable talking, please text "NEDA" to 741741 or visit one of these websites: http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ - or click to chat  http://www.dialhelp.org/?page_id=7759 or text 906-356-3337 http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ or text 741-741 http://unsuicide.wikispaces.com/Online+Suicide+Help+Wiki#.UcNaxKwfHt0 https://www.imalive.org/ or call 800-784-2433

column5:
Hey y’all, first timer here and I just wanted to share my particular struggle in hopes that someone can relate and or has any advice.
A little bit of background:
I have been a raging bulimic for way too long. It started my sophomore year of college and was so severe that my roommates contacted my parents out of fear and concern. They showed up at the front door of my apartment within hours of the phone call and I was off to inpatient treatment.
Fast forward 42 days to family week and I received news from my treatment team that I still needed much more recovery and they recommended I stay AT LEAST another 6 months. Knowing deep down I needed to stay for twice as long, I figured I could manage and was ready to get back to my normal life.
Within a month I was back hand-in-hand with Ed, and I say with a heavy, broken heart that since then I have only gone two weeks without binging & purging.
For five solid years I have been lying to myself and everyone who cares about me. Not just denial or keeping it a secret, I mean straight up compulsive lying. I will look at my parents and my boyfriend dead in the face and tell them how difficult it was to overcome my condition, how I’m so grateful to be recovered, and even make comments out of the complete blue about what it was like when I struggled with my eating disorder.
I have been more worried about making sure no one knew and in the process I convinced myself that what I was saying was true.
Has anyone else gone to this extreme?
Anyway, I am ready to put this demon to rest, for good. It’s taken such a toll on me in every aspect of my life and I’m over it. I have all the tools from treatment and years of therapy so I know what to do... BUT, I am afriad I will only abstain for a few days and then go back to it just like I always do every single time. It’s like I know myself to well and I have failed so many times that I’m to the point of hopelessness.
I spent awhile reading through the last few pages of posts on here and noticed a lot of people saying they just “weren’t ready” or “maybe it isn’t your time” in regards to recovery and quite frankly that scares me the most. I have already lost 5 years of my beautiful life to this horrific disease and IT gets to decide when it’s done with me? What if I drop dead in the meantime?
I’m prepared to come clean to my parents about it and let them know I’m devoting myself to recovery again, but then part of me feels like I shouldn’t even bother because I’ll fail them too and just repeat the fake recovery lying cycle to avoid doing so. I’m DEFINITELY not telling my boyfriend. Things are way too good with him and I’m not about to put that at risk. Is that bad? We aren’t married or anything and he wouldn’t be any help anyway. He doesn’t understand and I don’t have the energy to try and get him to. Any thoughts on that?
One more thing: can anyone who has some recovery time PLEASE tell me you get your physical appearance back? I know the face bloating goes away but my skin is all dried out and my hair is too thin and I just look like a different person overall. Any tips to help speed the physical recovery process up?
Sorry, I know my post is all over the place. Thank y’all for bearing with me and taking the time to read.
column9: Thank you for your post. We edited it slightly to remove any language about diet or nutritional advice that may be triggering to others. Here are the guidelines for the forums: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope you continue to post and find support.

column4: Hi, I'm Nylo, and I'm finally admitting I have a problem
column5: I didn't think someone overweight could have an eating disorder...  I guess that was a delusion I led myself to believe.  I feel horrible for letting my negative Nancy tell me that.  -.-  My fiance has even noticed, within the last 4 years I'd go through various crash diets in order to try to lose weight. But the issue I guess I have is...  When I'm stuck in that routine, counting calories, or doing x,y, or z to try to lose weight, seeing those numbers dropping, seeing them drop slowly was never fast enough, I wanted it gone right then and there.  I have this issue where I want something down NOW.  Though seeing the numbers dropping is horribly intoxicating.  The only thing that clued me into the possibility that I had an eating disorder was starting my 'latest diet'...  And spilling it all over the place, only for my head to tell me "Hey it's okay, it's not like you're eating food anyways, why would you need anything caloric of an intake.  We really should just not eat anything."That made me realize, because I knew that wasn't myself speaking...  I had gone into one of my obsessive compulsive get slim fast diets again, and I finally recognized... maybe I'm not doing something healthy for myself by doing this if the voice I had trusted for so long is telling me this.  I just... I don't know what to do now. x.x  I'm hungry but the appetite is not there.  I mean, I do plan to see my therapist obviously.  I don't want this to go unchecked like it has been for the last 4 years.

The community guidelines can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines             Thank you and please continue posting.

column4: I need some guidance in my daily life
column5: I have found myself in a bad place these last few months. I either throw up or i eat a restricted amount every day. I find myself unable to resist purging. It’s like the toilet is pulling me in and i can’t do anything to stop it. I’m not in a place where i can go to treatment right now because of school, work, and finances. I just need some help as to what to do because i obsess over it constantly and i don’t want to live like this for the rest of my life.

column4: I’m confused as to if I have an eating disorder.
column5:
Back in high school I struggled with Anorexia - never diagnosed - but I rarely ate more than X calories, worked out constantly, etc. one day I decided to just do better so I did, but ever since I’ve struggled to keep weight on.
I worry about it constantly. I’m constantly wanting to gain weight but I’m not able to.
I’ve thought over the past year that maybe this has something to do with my past? Maybe I’m not better even though I do feel as if I am.
I decided to seek out and write on this forum because my weight dropped and it's very concerning to me. I’ve been tested for everything under the moon and come out healthy. But any time my doctors bring up my eating habits, if I’m hungry, etc I feel as though I probably lie because I’m uncomfortable with the truth. My only thing is I stay nauseous.
I don’t know if this is an eating disorder? Or it’s even worth bringing up to anyone. And I just wanted another opinion.
column9: Hi abbeylane64, Welcome to the forums! Your post was edited slightly to remove heights/weights as these can be triggering to other members. Forum guidelines can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope that you continue to post and find support on these forums.

column5:
Hi y’all,
I started experiencing weight loss about 3 years ago after working almost constantly for a couple days and unintentionally not eating much. After that my appetite plummeted. I wasn’t hungry whatsoever, eating or attempting to do so made me want to gag, and I just in general had completely lost my appetite. I gained the weight back though, no big deal. This has happened about 3 other times in the past 3 years. Each time I’ve gained the weight back. Except for this go around- I’m currently underweight, as I was the other 3 times. It’s hard for me to get across to my doctors and parents that I’m not doing this on purpose. I haven’t restricted my food ever, I’m not secretive about my eating, I don’t even own a scale. I WANT to gain the weight back so, so bad. I just don’t know where to start this time. It’s definitely worse, I’m the thinnest I’ve ever been with it affecting my hair and eyelashes enough to where I cut 7 inches off so it would look fuller. I’ve been to my primary doctor, they ran blood work and it was normal. I’ve had them do blood work with each weight loss and it’s always been normal. I recently started seeing a therapist for the first time and she told me she wasn’t certain it was my mental health causing it either. So I’m sort of at a loss right now. Any advice y’all have would be greatly appreciated!
column9: Hi Laurie21, Welcome to the forums! Your post has been slightly edited to remove heights/weights, as these can be triggering to other forum members. Guidelines can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. We hope you continue to post and find support on these forums!

column5: I'm having an issue, after I had had my mind set on a 'new diet'.  Now that I've decided to forego it I can't help but to pass out after eating something that isn't within that diet.  It's annoying me because I know it would be healthy to be eating the stuff outside of said diet.  It's also frustrating me that it feels like my stomach is always empty even after eating it feels like it's empty.  I know it's likely because after I eat, I fill 'full', but then not too long after I feel hungry again and I'm just afraid with that constant hunger feeling, that I'm going to be binge eating and I don't want to do that either.  My binge eating isn't much either I guess?  I'm just scared that this passing out after eating is my brain tying to force me not to feed myself.
column9: Hi NyloR89.If you are passing out after eating, we suggest you seek medical attention. If you already have a medical team, we suggest you seek their guidance.  If not, please go to your local emergency room for evaluation.

column4: I never thought I would be asking for support... BED
column5: Hi everyone,Never in my life did I think I would be sitting up late at night, registering an account on NEDA, and desperately asking for support. I know, same as everyone else probably.I've recently accepted the fact that I most likely have Binge Eating Disorder. I have never been diagnosed (mainly because I am terrified to ask for help) but this is something that I have struggled with for years, only I never really knew it was an eating disorder. I always thought my lack of self control was much worse than others, until I started recognizing that this was WAY more than a lack of self control.Anyway, I know that many of you are either struggling with something similar or know someone who is (hence why we are all here on the website), and I am deciding to post this snippet of myself in hopes of finding some support. I do understand that going to my doctor would be 100% the right thing to do, but as this is something so foreign to me and something that I am so unfamiliar with, I wanted to come here first. I really don't know anyone in the reality of my life struggling with anything of similarity, and I think that what I need right now is just someone to talk to (minus the hundreds of dollars of an in person therapy session). Thanks anyone who is listening. And of course, all feedback is welcome. As you can probably tell I am completely new to this whole thing so I'm not even sure this post will make it into the forums or if I am doing this right. :)

column4: Anorexia to Binge Eating. Please help me.
column5:
Hi guys, this is my first post so I apologize if I don't phrase my issues correctly.
I'm about a year out of professional treatment for anorexia and I still talk with a nutritionist, therapist, and doctor to make sure I don't fall into a dangerous weight zone that threatens my health. I still have weeks where I struggle severely with undereating, enjoying the sensation of undereating, and losing progress in this recovery. A more pressing issue, however, is the bingeing that began a few months ago. No one seems to be concerned about this bingeing, especially since I've been maintaining a low-healthy BMI range even after it began (because of the restriction that follows...). I have good and bad months - some months I will only binge a few times a month, but other months I will binge, feel so guilty and fat that I will restrict, binge again, and the cycle repeats the whole month. I'm so aware that this is a disordered way of eating.It's so difficult to understand my feelings to anyone. I cry to my mom the whole night after a binge, and she can't understand why I can't stop eating and come for help. My therapist tells me strategies to distract myself when I feel like bingeing, but NOTHING is a substitute for food when I feel the great urge to binge. I'm still so afraid of gaining weight and the binge feels like a monster compelling me to eat everything in sight and I can't possibly stop when it calls to me. I don't know what to do, and sometimes I feel so bad after a binge that I'm close to committing suicide so I can die before I gain a ton of weight. The urges only happen at night, but when they happen either I sit clenching my teeth for hours upon end (trying so hard not to eat more) and then inevitably binge the next night, or simply binge out of resignation, eating many calories. Then I don't eat for a few days I seriously don't know what to do; I don't know why I have the self-control to starve during the day but completely lose any semblance of control when night strikes. I've tried to identify what triggers a binge, but so many things trigger a binge that I'd have to live in a bubble to avoid them. It makes no sense, and no one seems to care as long as I'm skinny but healthy. I hate myself even more than I did when I was struggling with anorexia. Please help me. I'd do anything. Thank you for reading.

column4: can anyone suggest anything for dizzy spells
column5: _admin_moderator
column8: Hi Karenc, dizzy spells can be a sign of a medical emergency that requires immedicate medical attention.The following are just some of the signs of a serious problem that demands immediate medical attention: • accidentally or deliberately caused themselves a physical injury • become suicidal • confused thinking and is not making any sense • delusions (false beliefs) or hallucinations (experiencing things that aren’t there) • disoriented; doesn’t know what day it is, where they are or who they are • vomiting several times a day or has uncontrollable vomiting or diarrhea • experiencing dizziness or fainting spells • too weak to walk or collapses • painful muscle spasms • complaining of chest pain or having trouble breathing • blood in their bowel movements, urine or vomit • a body mass index (BMI) of less than 16 • an irregular heartbeat, and fast heartbeat, or very low heart beat (less than 50 beats per minute) • cold or clammy skin indicating a low body temperature or has a body temperature of less than 35 degrees Celsius/95 degrees Fahrenheit If you or someone you know are experienceing any of these symptoms it is important that you seek medical attention immediately. If there a medical professional you are currently in touch with we suggest that you can contact them. Another option is calling 911.

column5: Still trying to fit exercise into my daily routines. But when my weight feel so UP I begin depending on disordered behaviors too feel more under control over my body bloating over something like PMS? or just a regular meal after a short time lapse of fasting in between food feedings if I feel hungry???Not so in touch w/ my body's hunger cues as much now that I have other issues am concentrating on and feel trapped over. New sig other is becoming so curious over my boundary issues and what he may get away with before we become more serious with each other.I already feel so grossed out that I don't feel worthy of a sig other, also have stupid boundary issues due to past hang-ups ...So eating becomes the last item of interest on my totem pole of daily To Do's. Then when I do sometimes it seems to turn into a Full Blown Feeding Frenzy. I can't stop and have actually not fully committed to these painful binges and just relieved myself from the guilty pleasure.Any food just stuffed into my orifice and eventually has made it into my stomach where the Alarm is Triggered to Evacuate Immediately or I will look like this Forever...Bloated, and cramping after overstuffing myself,  almost as if in a numbed out a state of mind, and it only knows how to open. The shutoff switch has been deleted,  and I feel like a powerless, hungry,  wild catapillar @@@@@@@@@@@@@@,  until The Purge takes back my sense of "CONTROL."

column5: I just want to say to everyone that recovery is possible. I've been eating a healthy meal plan for a few months and I am experiencing a decline in ED thoughts and learning to have self acceptance for the first time in 34 years. There's a lot of hard work in therapy but it is paying off quickly. I didn't think I would ever have a time in my life that was free of the obsessive thoughts of food and weight but now I am not considering those things at all. My fear of excessive weight gain is gone and I like my body when I look in the mirror, flaws and all! The key for me was learning the power of acceptance in every area of my life. I let go of my need to control my external environment and focus on the internal environment. The dysfunctional behaviors are a distant memory at this point and I am peeling away the layers of years of self doubt without being overwhelmed by the process. If I can obtain recovery so quickly just by accepting myself and trusting God to handle the details then anyone can experience this. It doesn't have to take years of hard work and really is as simple as just accepting yourself for what you are. I am working on accepting that I am a 48 year old woman and not a teenager anymore which has been the hardest part but it's nice to feel like a mature and competent grown up for once. I am working in the drug and alcohol treatment environment and finding I can work with people and make a difference without feeling like a phony because now I am living the tools I talk about with clients. Thanks for listening and letting me share my good news on this forum.
column9: Hi Zoelight, Welcome to the forums. We encourace you to contact our helpline: (M- Th 9-9 EST F 9-5) 800 -931 -2237 or text NEDA to 741741 . Please continue posting!

column4: I’m New Here and I Need Help
column5: Last night I saw something posted on Facebook that described some of the characteristics of night eating disorder. For the first time in my life I felt comfortable about what I now know is an eating disorder that I have. I feel relieved, don’t get me wrong, yet I am not sure what to do next. I cannot do inpatient, I have no insurance and struggle with my budget. If anyone has any recommendations or advice for support groups, methods  of self treatment, please, please, please let me know. I’ve taken the first step, I’m admitting I have a problem. And a big one. I binge eat at night, often purge and find that my sleep patterns parallel my eating patterns. So many of the things that I do now match with this disorder. The morning anorexia, the depression, the feelings of shame the next morning, so much of it now makes sense. Also, I’m a recovered heroine addict, 22 years. If I can beat that I can beat a box of cereal at 3am. Oddly enough the same neurotransmitter that is pleased by opiates is pleased by food. Also, I’m a chef and surrounded by food regularly. Let’s just say it’s beyond a struggle. Any help is greatly appreciated! Please. I’m looking for friends and peers that can help me get through this.

column4: I want to recover, But I don't know how
column5:
I am an 18 year old freshman in college, and it has taken me the past 4 years to come to terms with the fact that I do indeed have a problem. But now that I know that I don't know where to go from there. I obviously want to have a healthy relationship with food, But I don't. And I haven't had one in a very long time. How to do build a relationship that I haven't had nearly all of my teenage years?In high school I was a part of a professional Ballet company, and I think that is where my problems started. In high school I started to notice that I was 'fat' and shorter than the other girls, so I stopped eating and no one said anything to me. No one tried to stop me. For the majority of high school I tried to eat less than my recommended number of calories, and some days I wouldn't eat at all, or would only eat when I was forced to because of social pressures. I was under weight. I have tried so hard in the past year to build up the confidence to have a healthy relationship with my body and with food, but recently I feel out of control, and lost again. I just started college, so i'm trying to figure out this whole living on my own thing at the same time as this. I seem to have regained my terror of gaining weight, though I live without a scale because withone I would be a mess. But all the same I know I have gained weight, a signifigant amount and while I know that I shouldn't be as low as I was before, I'm also not building great habbits. I have become obsessive about going to the gym. I wake up at 5:30 every morning regardless of how I feel inorder to exercise and run a number of miles and do some sort of strechings. Then again in the evening. I'm spending anywhere from 3-5 hours at the gym a day. But then I come back to my room, and I binge eat. I don't know how much I should be eating, but I get started eating because I'm ravinous, and I can't stop. And all I can see when I look in the mirror is my weight looking back at me. It feels like all the work I put in to gain a positive self image over the past year is gone.Please offer some help, or words of advice. I Just want, for once, my life to not revolve around calories. I want to be able to go out to eat with my friends, and nto freak out if they list the calories, and be unable to eat. I have never been diagnosed because I never speak up, and no one else around me seems to notice a problem. Please help me to get back on track.
Thank you.

column4: Fixed contract and bulimia is back
column5:
Hi everybody :)I have so much questions and no answers.
Bulimia. My best friends for the past 9 years. Started overweight with X, was sent to overweight kids camp, dropped X, went to anorexia onwards to bulimia. But for the past 2 years I was bulimia free.Now it's all back.While being bulimia free, I was maintaining weight, while eating a lot of one food type and doing no excercise.3 -4 months ago I signed a fixed contract, I've cut on back on X, started running regularly for half-marathon preparation, because I wanted to loose weight and be more fit for the stressful job.
And bulimia returned in all it's glory. What messed me up even more, is that I gained weight now, just like that.And I am throwing up, the heavy binge phase isn't even in it's full swing. This bloody number. My reflection in the mirror. Pictures of me. It is eating me alive. In the morning when I dress up I gag on my own reflection in the mirror. In the gym I wear loose T-Shirts. I hate my belly, I hate my arms I run until I'm dizzy, vomit until I feel ok and weight is still going up. I don't get my body. I am afraid of eating X, what if my body will store even more fat? What should I eat? How to loose the gained weight? I also turned 24, perhaps my metabolism just hates me right now. Has 9y of bulimia left so much damage, that my body will now store all food in the second it feels calorie deficit? Looking forward for your advise :)Hugs,
Smrekca

column4: Binging "bad" or "unsafe" foods in ednos/anorexia recovery?
column5:
Hi! Hope everyone is doing well. i'm freaking out a little bit. i was recommended inpatient/PHP a week or two ago and since then i've been trying to up my intake so it wont be necessary. Friday, Saturday, Sunday and today I went all in: eating meals and snacks (so many snacks!!!)
the problem is, i've been basically binging "unsafe" or "junk" foods. I feel so insanely guilty for craving it and acting upon those cravings. Before, because my hunger cues were off, I wouldnt even feel hungry most of the time but for 4 days now, I've felt starving randomly throughout the day and just eat whatever I feel like having, however much it may be.a lot of it is my eating disorder talking back at me, but i'm also concerned that perhaps this isnt normal and i'm eating too much, or too unhealthily? either way i'm concerned it's more calories than I need. unsure if this is binging or extreme hunger as the difference is confusing!!

Users can find more information about the community guidlines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines  Thank you and please continue posting.

column5: Hi, everyone. This is my first time posting to an ED forum. I have struggled with my eating disorder since I was fourteen (I'm twenty-one now and a senior in college) and I am finally seeing a counselor about it. This whole time I thought I had bouts of recovery and bouts of relapse but I realized a month ago that I've just continuously had different amounts of restriction. That this eating disorder has been constant and just hovering over my shoulder. I have general anxiety disorder that I know for sure stems from the ED; I get anxious over little things, but mostly regarding food and what I eat and when I eat and how often I eat. There are times when I only eat an apple or granola bar during the day but other days when I eat at least two meals. As of lately, though, I tend to get nauseated whenever I eat-- has anyone else experienced this? I've had a few "good" days in the last two weeks where I made sure to eat three times a day and for the last two days or so my stomach hurts, I get acid reflux, or I feel incredibly sick when I eat... even if it's just something small or a cup of coffee. Is this normal? I'm assuming that my body is just readjusting to having food in my stomach. Sometimes (oh, who am I kidding, most times) when I eat, I'm very aware of how full my stomach feels, even if it's just a sandwich-- when, in the past, I would be able to eat a meal and still want something else. I went to a wedding last night and they didn't have any vegetarian-friendly foods so I only ate a little when I got home, and then hours later I felt like I wanted to be sick because I ate something. I have an intense fear of vomit and I wanted to keep the food in because it tasted good and I enjoyed eating it but my body was like.... almost attacking itself. I have my second appointment with my counselor this Wednesday and I'm going to mention this to him and ask what he thinks but, in the meantime, I'm very confused. I'm at this point where I want to eat and I want to enjoy eating because I'm so tired of my ED and my anxiety becoming almost unmanageable and uncontrollable. I want help. I want to be better and to not restrict anymore. I really do-- it's just when I feel like this when I eat it makes me want to never eat again and I feel so confused. Does anyone have any advice? Thanks in advance.
column9: Hey loafmom77Your post has been slightly edited to more adhere to the community guidelines.Thank you for your understanding.https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column5: Hi everyone. I just joined the forum today. I was diagnosed with anorexia last Thursday but I’ve been sick for just over a year now. Though I realized several months ago that I have a problem, it took months to even consider getting help, because I was convinced I had it under control and could do it on my own (which is obviously not the case). In late August I took the first active step towards recovery and spoke to some people from a local eating disorder foundation. After that I saw my doctor who did some tests and then referred me to a treatment center. During all this I haven’t changed my disordered behaviors, because I was waiting for a professional who could tell me what to do. I went to the treatment center and talked to a psychiatrist who presented me with to treatment offers (I am fortunate enough to have access to free public treatment where I live). The first involves group sessions and committing to maintaining your weight. The second is similar but you have to gain a certain amount of weight each week, which scares me so much. I have been mainting my current weight for months now, so I feel as if the first option will just leave me stuck where I am now. And I’m just way too scared to do the second one. To complicate things further, I’m currently taking some classes where no absence is tolerated and they are on the same day and time as the group sessions, so I can’t go into treatment before the classes finish in December. At the same time I really want to start taking this education that starts in January, which will mean I have to move across the country and can’t possibly receive treatment at the treatment center I’ve already visited. My mother says she will pay for my treatment if I prefer to find a psychiatrist elsewhere, but I just can’t bring myself to ask her to spend that kind of money, when I’m being offered treatment for free. But at the same time I don’t trust that treatment center to do what’s best for me. One of the reasons is that they gave me a pamphlet from 1996 to take home...  like there hasn’t been any progress in ed treatment since then! I left feeling very disappointed and discouraged. For the last two days I’ve been trying to gain weight on my own because I finally realized what I’m doing to my body and freaked out a bit. I just don’t know what to do. I feel pretty ungrateful because I know that free treatment is such a privilege and not an option for most of you, but at the same time I just can’t see how it could work. Sorry for the long post, I hope it makes sense.
column9: Your post has been edited                                                       https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column4: Should I be eating this much?
column5:
Hello everyone. I am actively trying to recover from anorexa/restrictive eating. Currently, I am experiencing extreme hunger. I have the urge to binge on things like cheese and bagels and am feeling extremely stressed by it. I know this is normal in recovery because we are coming from a period of starvation.
The problem is, I have a difficult time justifying giving in to this. While I experienced many of the signs of starvation (lack of period, thyroid imbalance, adrenal fatigue), I never got down to an “underweight” weight. Should I be eating close to XX calories everyday when I do not necessarily need to gain weight?
Thank you all so much for taking the time to read this and supporting myself and everyone else on here with our recovery!

column4: Feeling like I can't see myself as I truly am (physically!)
column5: I've been attempting recovery from Anorexia for a couple of months now through therapy and the help of a nutritionist. Although I'm technically not underweight, and my BMI doesn't fall under the "proper diagnosis number" that constitutes an Anorexia diagnosis, my therapist still checks off "Anorexia Nervosa (Restricting type)" on my receipts. This brings me to my main topic/question. I have never been underweight in my life, and for most of my adult life, ages 18 to present day 22. When I stepped on the scale at the doctor, I was shocked to see my weight had dropped significantly. I get blind weighed, so I don't know how much I weigh now (not that it matters!!! besides for health reasons, of course.) but my parents and close relatives are constantly commenting on how I'm "just skin and bones" and "too thin."(My ED tends to tell me they are just saying that because they want to sabotage me, make me fat, or are simply just lying so I will stop being sick and hurting my body). For obvious health reasons such as hypothyroidism and loss of menstruation, I recognize what I've done to my body, I just can't recognize it when it comes to looking in the mirror. Big goals in my recovery have been to regain my menses and heal my body from the inside out, but my ED tells me that if my BMI is "normal" there is nothing wrong with me and gaining weight would be pointless. How can I get the proper motivation to eat more and have a healthy relationship with food if I feel like I technically don't *need* to be restoring weight when science tells me there's nothing to restore. How can I know how much to eat to heal my body, and how can I quiet the ED voice when I simply can't see what the people around me see (or claim to see) when I look in the mirror.

column4: Struggling with the two sides of me
column5: I’ve been struggling with ednos for almost two years and last week I made the resolution to give up on my two most unhealthy habits, purging and chewing on my food and spitting it right back. However, I still feel the urge to binge and I’m eating way more than I should (maybe around XX cals but that’s still way more than I can eat without feeling anxious, I plan my daily meals to be around XX cals but I always screw up and eat more). These months I’ve been losing and maintaining my weight thanks to purging and spitting, but now I feel helpless, like if I was condemned to gain weight again and keep eating uncontrollably until my brain “clicks” again and my anxiety makes me go back to restriction... and live like that forever, alternating between those two... persons? That’s how it feels like for me, like there’s the normal me, the me with binge-bulimic tendencies and the anorexic me, and the normal me just watchs how the other two fight each other two death without being able to do anything. I do feel like I’m three different people and sometimes I can feel that I’m “transitioning” from one to another, and it makes me even more anxious than realizing it once it’s already over. Right now I can feel how the binging me is coming back and I can’t stop her, I regain “consciousness” once I’ve already eaten and I feel like if she kind of kidnapps me in punctual moments to then leave alone again with an amount of guilty and anxiousness I’m unable to deal with. I do want to get better and eat a more balanced diet but whenever I stop restricting I go back to binging and I’m so scared because it’s not like if I had a weak will but rather I’m just a prisoner of someone else who takes my body and does things I don’t want to do. I don’t know if other people with ednos feel this way because I had never met anyone like me but when talking about this with my friends I feel actually crazy... I just want to know if it’s “normal” to have this feeling of being multiple people and how to deal with it. Like, is there any way to control it? Because I feel like there isn’t and I’m so so scared and lost.

column4: 1 Day w/o taking a supplement and extra nervous
column5: So I took my full dose of my supplement but went a day w/o my other one. My stomach feels way too bloated already. Haven't exercised enough and have gained --- pounds over the weekend. That means I did a lot of damage to the scale binging after work at night over my weekend after retail madness ended...All weekend. Now feeling bloated and have been forcing myself to exercise after my day job as having had a few days off from my night job to exercise and not binge eat at night. After exercising feel extra relieved and not that hungry, thank God.My 3rd week at my semi-long term sub assignment. Actually enjoying my temporary sub job assignment. Wish I received all the attention all these students get from being placed in Special Ed classes. Perhaps I would have become something more than a substitute teacher @ best.Found out my real bra size is not what I thought it was. Well, I was up to that size in 2007 before lost a bunch of weight. They couldn't figure out my rightful darn bra size. So I read the size chart last night and the chart makes me feel small compared to another bra chart.God am i confused or what.Debating whether to get junk food this morning or Not. God, no self-control days suck...Think I may go to store after work and p/u Healthy Food?Bye, all.....

column5: Hello, there.I've been working towards recovery for a little over a week or two, but I'm unable to see doctors or receive outside help for a few reasons that I'm not going to get into right now. Anyways, I finally hit a point where things had to change and I've done a lot of research to try to make sure that I recover in the best way that I can. It's been challenging, but my mental health feels far better than the first few days of working towards recovery. My mind is clearer and my overall mood has improved (aside from the occasional anxiety attacks). Researching everything along the way that I experience helps me feel in control in a situation that would often make feel that I was spiraling out of control. But there are a few things I'm experiencing and they worry me some. I want to see if they are normal/anyone else has experienced this.Of course, I experienced some nausea, headaches, extreme hunger, rapid weight gain, night sweats, and constant hot flashes after having felt only cold for months. All of this I've read about, so they don't worry me as much. But another thing that I'm experiencing is pain. My body is tender to the touch and feels like it's been hit with a blunt object. This is mostly around my ribs, chest, and abdomen area but I feel some around most of my body. I don't know if this would be edema? I'm starting to worry, because I haven't read about people having pain like this and I'm scared I could be messing something up.
column9: Hi PhoenixGirl, thank you for posting on the forums! As a reminder, our forums are a place for support and resources. We cannot offer any medical advice, and encourage you to see a physician about your pain.If you need support for finding resources, please feel free to give us a call at 1-800-931-2237 Monday - Thursday, 9 AM - 9 PM EST or Friday 9 AM - 5 PM.

column4: Feeling Guilty about lack of time to Physically Work Out
column5: I am used to daily evening walks in my neighborhood. Now am working 2 jobs, almost back to back. So am very busy these days. The days I'm not at work are the days I find myself binging on junk foods. I am disciplined Usually. Somehow a switch is turned on when I have free time or downtime. I feel exhausted lately and can't even focus on reading a short book. I am on an extended sub assignment currently and my retail job is only now realizing that my time is limited by job #1. So I am now working retail from about 5-9 and weekends 11-close...I need to sleep in a tad on weekends as this is my Only Down Time for me for the entire week...Saw the dentist and the cusp of a back molar is missing. Think they could do a cosmetic coating of an overlay cusp.W/ all the new light cured putty dental materials and re-create the missing cusp. 1 Office says i need the 1st root canal then a crown. I want to avoid a crown if possible. I wish I knew an older experienced dentist who could just put me under and do the darn RC as well as anything else necessary. They won't clean my teeth now until they do a deep clean and then would remain on a hygiene schedule every 3 months or so to keep my gums and deep pockets from collecting plaque and possibly avoid gumline cavities. So am feeling extra anxious and can't chew well on my dominant chewing side currently either. Well, gotta go to my job #2. I work tonight...Had a small lunch but my eating schedule is way off so can't eat now until around 6PM-ish. Not sure what will even stuff into my orifice at work. I feel anxious just thinking of eating a meal and re-gaining more weight. I'm doing ok, so far? Oh, P.S., I have temporarily lost my med insurance until i sign up again after Oct 15th for medicare-cal...Good thing I'm usually as healthy as a darn horse. I just try and be extra careful until covered then perhaps I'll have an emergency just to see if my ER still cares for me. I'll let them figure out what my problem is. Anxiety is up, and feeling terrified over my gaining weight w/o exercising. I've been using more anti-anxiety rx lately to keep me from stressing too much over this issue too.....Bye, ...
column9: Hi chunkymonkey68,This is just a friendly reminder to keep weight loss strategies/diet tips out of your posts, as these can be triggering to other members. Guidelines are here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines. Thank you for your post and we hope you continue to post.

column5: I've never struggled very much with eating disorders, but recently due to a life of problem after problem, being a victim of many different forms of abuse, and breakup after breakup I have developed anorexia. It started about a month ago, after some disturbing occurrences, I just stopped eating. My stomach hurts, I am constantly fatigued, I am losing weight and muscle mass quickly, thought processing is now a struggle. I work two physical labor jobs trying to pay my bills and work is getting harder by the day. I dont know what to do, and I fear quitting my job as I have no financial support or place to go. I feel so dead inside. I struggle with suicidal thoughts, and the person I once was is gone. I dont recognize myself anymore and I'm too tired to fight this problem. I try to tell myself to eat but its like my brain blocks it off. Any advice would be greatly appreciated and greatly beneficial. Thanks.
column9: Hello and welcome to teh forums Pretty.panda8. We recognize your struggle and want to suggest visiting http://www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ or calling 1-800-273-8255 if you're feeling at all unsafe. It can be reasuring just to talk to someone.

column5: Coming to terms with the fact that I have binge eating disorder. Started working out and changed my diet about 5 years ago. Lost X pounds. I spent my entire life eating endless amounts of junk food and fast food and then did a complete 180. I would always pick X day(s) out of the week though to have a binge day and the day after I would just feel completely ashamed. I would avoid people, wear extremely baggy clothes, and eat pretty much no X the next day. Lately these episodes have been more frequent. Just had my X binge this week alone and feel so embarrassed and physically sick. I'm defintely an emotional eater but haven't really been feeling down lately. Can't really pin point what's been causing me to binge eat. Maybe out of loneliness. Any tips or just some uplifting conversation from someone who can relate would be great.

column5: Hi there!! Buckle up, because this is going to be a long one. I really need some help on what to do here- I feel so lost. I’m 19, in my second year at a new college, and I’ve been struggling with eating disorders since I was 12. I’ve never been formally diagnosed, and I don’t even think my family knows, because I have always been “the small girl”. I’ve been underweight my entire life, and have been weighing in at the same weight. I’ve managed to maintain my underweight status all these years so everyone, including my family, just thinks that’s the way I’m supposed to be, naturally (which maybe it is? I wouldn’t know. I haven’t allowed myself to gain in years). I’ve been restricting my calories every single day for years and I can’t eat without feeling guilt so bad it’s physically nauseating. I’ve cut almost every major food group out of my diet. I’m dizzy all of the time and while I go on-and-off between physically counting my calories with an app, it’s rare for me to ever go over or even near a certain amount of calories a day. I eat enough to maintain my weight. I don’t go on huge binges, but when I feel full I do occasionally turn to purging. I’m so, so tired all of the time and my mental health is at an all-time low- I feel like at this point, I’m never going to recover. I’ve never been “sick enough” to send up red flags, because being this small has always been my norm. The thought of gaining even just a few pounds gives me an immense paralyzing fear. But I can’t go on like this anymore, I don’t want to have had all of my teenage years stolen by this disease. I don’t want to live like this for the rest of my life.The problem is, I’m terrified of telling my parents. A big thing that feeds into my anorexia is guilt, and I can’t stand the thought of putting this disaster onto my parents. My only other sibling, my older sister by a few years, has been going through issues with her sexuality for at least almost 10 years, has gone through therapy in order to come to terms with it, etc, and I know my parents blame themselves for any problems she’s gone through. My mom is a little mentally unstable as well, and I know she the most would feel the most burn if she ever found out about my eating disorder, because we’re close and it’s been going on for so long without her even noticing. But I can’t stand to have my parents blame themselves for my problems too, even though they are so loving and supportive and would absolutely help me get the help I need.While I think we could afford treatment for me, I’ve always felt really terrible guilt whenever it comes to my parents spending money on me- I’m not sure why, though. I don’t want to put my parents through the emotional turmoil of knowing what I’ve been going through and somehow think that they’re bad parents because now BOTH of their kids are not mentally well. I’m somewhat of the golden childen, and I don’t think I’d be able to handle letting them in on my hardships and the stress it would cause them. It would crush me and it terrifies me even just thinking about telling them.It’s worth mentioning that I switched schools after sixth grade due to some minor bullying, which probably led to my eating disorder and self-harm habits (that I haven’t used in over three years) just a year later. I also transferred colleges this past year, after my freshman year, due to some extreme mental problems that resulted from the school I was attending, stress, etc. My anorexia got so much worse while I was at that school, and it was there I finally cracked and begged my parents to get me to counseling (I said it was for my concentration issues and insomnia/exhaustion, which is true, but definitely not the biggest issue here). I attended exactly one counseling session at my school before I became too busy to, and both my parents and I dropped it eventually. This was the first time I’ve ever let my parents in on my struggles, and it was terrifying.I feel so lonely and I don’t know what to do. I crave recovery so bad but I’m terrified of changing my ways, the ways I’ve had for over six years. Every time I’ve tried to recover myself, I just fall back even harder. I know I can’t do this alone, but I don’t want to put my baggage on to anyone else in absolutely any way. Please, please, please give me some advice.

column5: Hello,I'm 18 and I've been struggling with my weight for as long as I can remember, always trying to starve but never managing to. Earlier this year I went on a diet and managed to lose like some weight. I was so proud. But even at that moment I binge ate often. It's gotten worse now. I binge eat more often than I'd like to admit, to the point my tummy hurts constantly. I don't know who I am anymore. I'm not as cheerful as I used to be. I don't wanna leave my bed. I just eat and then look in the mirror and feel like I'm disgusting. However, I've never been able to actually starve or throw up and that makes me feel like a failure. I feel like I'm a gross fat girl who can't do anything right. I really wanna stop having these thoughts, but I just don't know how. I wish I could just cope better with everything that's going on. Maybe nothing I said makes sense, I just needed to get it out of my chest

column5:
Hey there,
  How are you doing since your last post?  What's been going on with you?  I've been thinking about you.

column5: It is hot here and im feeling too sensitive to it too. My period is back AGAIN...All day its been making me feel all amuck. I have not a clue why it returned again. I had spotting about 1.5 weeks ago too. I like feeling in Total control over my body so if my own female organs are surprising me with intermittant spotting i just feel out of control.I am also feeling way too damn bloated in the belly. Ive been drinking tons of ice water in this hot weather so its partly from the water im taking in at this time. My weight is still  on my side and scale seems to be obeying me currently., My size is down and it feels so encouraging for me to continue eating healthy most the week and forgive myself on weekdays when my binge mama kicks in. I know its self-sabotage because i was meant to be a lean swimming machine not this huge untoned person I currently feel like I am at least x sizes from perfect for my body to be accepted by me. Gotta go work tonight 4 hrs...Feels like a volunteer job w/ a thrift ctr only its an upscale name store that caters to our small community and most people are conservative and wise shoppers too.

column5: It's not right, I have given you so much of my time and I have tried to help you out so much. And this is how you are treating me. It's not right!!! I feel so hurt right now and I can't take it anymore. I want to binge eat now. Why did you have to do this to me? I told you something very personal and you used it against me!!! I can't keep doing this. Back and forth. It upsets me and I want to binge eat!!! I'm trying not to give in. I hate everything right now!! Please feeling go away.

column4: I'm finding it very hard to eat
column5: I'm finding it very difficult to eat. Nothing is digesting. I feel like I need something easier to eat, but I'm not allowed. I feel like I'm dying.
column9: Dear donna2, we are concerned about you and recommend that you seek medical attention as soon as possible. If you feel like you are in a crisis, you can text "NEDA" to 741-741 to contact the Crisis Text Line.

column5:
So I don't really know how to start this because I've kept all of this fear in for years at this point. I guess a good point to start would be when it kinda started?
When I was eleven years old, I began to notice that I was always bigger than other girls. Not fat in the slightest, but just bigger arms, bigger thighs, etc. I hated it, because people would always point it out in my school, but then my extended family would always say I needed to eat more and that I was too skinny. This ended up making me extremely self conscious about my weight, and I started to distrust how I looked to myself. I look back and see photos and wish I looked that way again, but right now even the thought of food terrifies me.
People always say you can't out work a bad diet, but I have no idea what a good diet even looks like. I've been half starving, half eating for years at this point and so I feel like all the food I do have access to is awful and I don't want to touch it. It stresses me out, and as someone who just graduated college, I don't really have much control over the foods we get since money is tight.
I just feel helpless. I don't want to sleep anymore because I can never get more than a few hours of crappy sleep. I don't want to eat anymore because the kitchen has become a hell for me. I don't want to be awake anymore because when I am awake, I worry about how awful my health probably is and get worried that my heart is going to give out on me.
I'm just exhausted of fearing everything in my life and want to know how to step forward in the right direction without taking it to extremes.
column9: Hi MusicxArt and welcome. Please refer to the guidelines for your future posts to avoid sharing information that could possibly trigger other participants: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelinesAlso, please feel free to contact our helpline: (M- Th 9-9 EST F 9-5) 800 -931 -2237 or text NEDA to 741741 Thank you and we hope to see you post more!

column5: Does anyone else feel stuck. I feel stuck. I don't want to feel so awful all the time, but I'm afraid of gaining weight. I even feel like I need to lose more weight. Every night and every morning I try to avoid eating. I'm constantly worried about how many calories I'm taking in. I feel faint because I'm constantly restricting. But I'm too scared to recover, I'm too scared of gaining weight. Like how much weight will I be asked to gain. Will it ever end. Will I feel comfortable in my own skin or will I always feel uneasy in myself. It's overwhelming and I just want to cry.
column9: Hi donna2, We encourage you to reach out to NEDA:  (M- Th 9-9 EST F 9-5) 800 -931 -2237 or text NEDA to 741741.Keep posting!

column5:
Hi,I am new to this forum, well any forum actually. I however am not new to eating disorders. I have googled, searched, and ended up here. I am looking for community and comfort. I can get this from my friends yes, but they do not experience what I am facing so they do not understand.
A little about me, I am a third year BSW (social work) student and have struggled, off and on varying in severeness since I was in grade six. I am 21 now. So for most of my life I have always had this on my mind and controlling my life.Recently, my feelings, emotions, and behaviors towards food have resurfaced. And resurfaced with intensity. All summer I lived alone and was very happy, ate local, clean or organic, really cared for myself. But once my roommate moved in and school began, I have noticed changes in myself. My binge eating and purging has resurfaced, and my restricting of food as also came back full force.See, when I was in grade 6 my teacher called my mom saying I was not eating my school lunches, her rational for this was because "I wanted attention from boys, I would offer them my food, and thus give me attention" Things could have been addressed then and there for what it really was. Rather my mom got upset and did do some research and took me to see some specialist but nothing followed up after that. Throw in some toxic friendships and teenage years... I was a mess.So needless to say, I am still here and still struggling. I did make a doctors apt. about not being able to loss weight at this apt. I did bring up my past about eating issues HOPING THIS WAS MY SAVING GRACE MY CALL FOR HELP. They did not address it.Here I am 21, social work student, leaning how to help others when I cant and unwilling to help myself. Here I am, working towards recovery 10 years in the making.Thank you to any one who took the time to read this. I have just not been able to find a community on Instagram or Twitter so good ol' google brought me here. Lonely.

column4: Healthy weight and binge eating, can you enter a hypermetabolic state at a healthy weight? How do I go about eating?
column5: Hi!I struggled with a restrictive eating disorder, but never dropped significantly below an unhealthy BMI. I was inpatient at a residential facility where I was eating at a pretty significant surplus, but only gained a small amount in the first 3 weeks. I've been struggling again with binge eating since July (I was in residential in August), which is where my eating disorder started, but I've noticed that I'm not really gaining at the rate that I would expect. Basically, I immediately feel exhausted once I begin eating around maintenance, and get hot flashes, night sweats, and feel almost back to normal the day after binges. Is it still possible to enter a hypermetabolic state at a healthy weight? As stressful as binges are, I can't help but notice how much more energy and how, well, not miserable I feel after eating significantly more than what I thought was maintenance, and I wonder if eating at what I think is maintenance is leading to more binges because it's significantly below my RMR. This is quite long...Thanks for any insight :)

column4: I suppose I have an ED
column5: It has been about two months I guess I've had some struggles. I am not really sure why they started besides that I have always had issues with my weight. My twin sister has been struggling with an ED for years now, going to inpatient residential at Renfrew (it is her fourth time, she is currently there) My poor mother is stressed out of her mind and I cannot tell her I am battling this. My sister has driven her up the wall as is. I live with my fiance and he is supportive but more along the lines of harsh realism, "Fix your issues," "You control your actions..." etc. I recently lost a lot of weight after having gastric sleeve. I've been going on and off with my weight, trying to remain in a certain calorie limit, temporarily succeeding with keto, but I just cannot keep on with any of these. I find myself binging, getting guilty and purging. I am throwing up every day now, lying about where I am going just to get out and find a way to satisfy these bad habits. I am doing it in my car even in the middle of the night. I truly have a problem but the sick part of me that is FINALLY seeing weight loss again is thrilled. I know I am making myself sick and hurting myself but I also feed off of the loss results. I don't really know where I should find help or if I am ready to.
column9: Hello olivebean! . A portion of your comment was edited due to specific numbers. For further reading, the community guidelines can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Thank you and please continue posting.

column5: I have been going in and out of hospitals for the past year, I just recently started school and I started restricting again. No one that can help/ do anything about it knows and I’m trying to hide it the best I can but now people are starting to ask questions. With going to school I have no friends and no one to make school even slightly more comforting. I’ve also begun to self harm again and have some suicidal thoughts. I go to AA and the people there are very worried about me and think I need to be in a hospital again:( any advice??
column9: Tryingtoridethewave, welcome to the forums! We are concerned about your recent post and would like to provide some resources you can contact. This number is really important to have: (800)-273-8255 or text "NEDA" to 741741 immediately for support. We hope that you get the help and support that you need.

column4: How can I fight to recover when it hurts so much
column5:
I want to be better, but I've tried to be better and it just made me feel worse.
Eating makes me suicidal so how am I meant to consolidate that with recovery?
How am I meant to try to recover again when my mood completely dropped, I started getting suicidal again, hating myself more then ever when I reached a healthy weight.
And when youre eating and looking healthy as much as everyone reassures you they know its a mental illness and that they know youre struggling, suddenly they dont care as much, suddenly its okay for you to be miserable because you arent physically at risk anymore. People say its a mental illness but still treat it as a physical illness so I'm left with the anxiety and depression which caused my eating disorder because no one cares anymore. No one cares to leave you in pain if you look okay on the outside.
So yes, I know recovery leaves hard feelings to deal with but it also makes me more unsafe and NO ONE CARES because my weight looks normal.
I feel so alone and everyones left me alone because I look okay. Every fear I had about becoming healthy came true. I am struggling again but its not as extreme as last time so I'm being left alone. I'm in pain and I can't recover because it ruins my life and makes everything worse and its not like i didnt try, i went all the way for complete remission and i achieved it until all the promises of helping me mentally just went away. They promised not to just make me gain weight, they promised to help with the reasons why I got an eating disorder but then they just didnt.
I don't want to suffer, I don't want to restrict and binge and over exercise. I don't want to be scared of calories, of certain foods, of eating out. I want to be free of this. I don't want to feel guilt or to hate myself and my body. I want to be strong and healthy and happy, but I just dont know how. I don't know how to do that when eating makes me so depressed and suicidal and no one cares because I don't look ill anymore.
column9: Hello Eva123, welcome to the forums and we are glad you found a place to share your story and get help. We are concerned about your recent post and would like to provide some resources you can contact. This number is really important to have: (800)-273-8255 or text "NEDA" to 741741 immediately for support. We hope that you get the help and support that you need. Please continue to post and reach out to the number listed above.

column5:
hey.. I´m shivering. I´ve been eating like crazy since I decided to get up from bed. The first half of my day consisted of crying hysterically, having panick attacks, and finding it hard to not hurt myself. Guess who got back to her old habits of letting food controll her emotions? Today was one of those days when u start your day wanting to fast, but later in the day in the life of your sad sad reality, you find urself making food in the kitchen while eating dinner from 2 days ago that for some reason is still in the fridge.. I myself have every intention of not overdoing it and actually stopping, but it´s almost like something takes over and tbh, I knew this was gonna happen to me already yesterday evening. I just get a different kind of hunger in the pit of my stomach after not eating for a while... I KNOW whats gonna happen.
now.
let´s talk about the title. Yeah, I´m legitemately devastated and it´s a secondhand hurt kind of devastated. He was my whole life for the last year of my life, my entire future had his footprints all over it. I was so blindly in love with him, that now I´m sitting here alone and ignored. I pushed away everyone that told me he wasn´t good for me, bacause he made me happy. How come I never realized he also hurt me just as frequently as he made my heart flutter? I think about the way I sat in the shower this morning, and cried for two hours straight listening to our song. A song I will never hear sung from him again, I will never be able to hold his face between my hands and kiss him, I will never again be able to look over at him when he says something stupid and just roll my eyes while smiling like crazy.
It really took everything in me to let him go, and I asked him straight forward to not contact me and he hasn´t. The feelings of desperate need for validation, love and attention are hitting me, resolving in food.Food is an issue for me and has always been, I was really overweight as a child and have been bullied about my weight for as long as I can remember. In 2017 I lost weight. I am so cold and now I feel worthless.
I. Feel. Alone.
