column5:
Hi,
New to forum. I was anorexic fouryears ago, regained a healthy weight by the end of 2015. Predominantly binge eating and throwing up. Steadily maintaining weight, manual labour, but am still acting on behaviors up about once a day, and the longest period so far that I've stayed clean since 2014 is four days. 30 year old female Family are not aware of problem.Two big concerns: I run a café in my home district, and whilst my habit DOESN'T go anywhere near my business physically ( although it does trigger) the confidential services here are not very confidential and cannot risk having it becoming known that the cafe is run by a bulimic.Second concern is that I've just had a minor operation and been prescribed medication, and whilst this is an excellent opportunity to try and defeat my problem I'm worried at the possible side effects of those ED behaviors whilst on the meds.Sorry if this is an inappropriate post, I'm just worried. Thanks ms in advance for any help
column9: Hi mazo_burvi, welcome to the NEDA forums! We are happy to have you join our supportive community.We wanted to let you know your initial post was edited to remove numbers (weight) and the name of a medication to ensure we have a safe space for our other forum-goers. As a reminder, we are a support group and cannot provide medical or health advice.You can review our Community Guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column5: I'm feeling hopeless and worthless and like I don't deserve anything.  I'm just not worth it.  Thank you all for your encouragement over time.
column9: Hi Savedbygrace, you ARE worth it! Recovery can be a very difficult process. If you ever feel the need, please call the National Suicide Prevention Hotline at 1-800-273-8255, they are available 24 hours a day. Or, if you need more support through NEDA, please continue to post on the forums for support or call our hotline at 1-800-931-2237 to speak with a NEDA team member directly. Please keep posting!

column5: Hey y'all, I'm looking for advice on just resources and things to read when you're recovering from under eating/starving. I've never been diagnosed with an ED but I lived with undiagnosed milk allergy for 5 years that destroyed my want to eat. I'ts been 3 years since my diagnosis and I'm finally in a place where I make all my own food and I realized I have a problem. My partner has to convince me to eat, and I dread it and avoid it. I have done a lot of work with my therapist to lower my anxiety about food and eating but I still find myself taking fast days or weeks. I have another friend with a food allergy, and he's a great support but he barely eats enough as well and I need to find things to help me get better. A lot of my friends  dismiss me when  i worry I've  developed  ED or at  least disorder eating on the basis that people ED have real problems and I'm over thinking it. I've lost a lot of weight in the past year, I feel ill a lot, and I feel like I'm constantly battling myself to eat. Even when I can convince myself to eat til I'm full, I feel sick for an entire day. Whether or not I have and ED, I need to find things that can help me.I've read a bunch of posts on this forum, and it makes me feel less alone at least. I'm looking for things on how does it feel to increase your food intact and how to healthily fo that. How do you get through the discomfort and fullness? What do you tell yourself to think? How do you recover from disordered eating with out really the support of those around you? Or resources to give friends to better understand how it feels? Thanks for reading and hope you all luck on your journey.
column9: Hi Leadread, welcome to the NEDA forums! If you want to speak to a NEDA team member about recovery resources online and/or in your area, please call the NEDA hotline at 1-800-931-2237 from Monday - Thursday, 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM and Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM EST. Please continue to post!

column5: Is bulimia without the binging just as dangerous as bulimia with binging?  I'm HOPING insurance will come in the mail ASAP.
column9: Hi Savedbygrace. As a reminder per our Community Guidelines, the forums are not a replacement for healthcare or medical advice. We encourage you to seek resources that can help you. Please feel free to call the NEDA Hotline at 1-800-931-2237 for resources in your local area as you wait for the insurance to come in the mail or as a supplemental resource.

column4: Looking for tips from overcoming my weight obsession
column5: Not sure If I can be classified as anorexic but I know I have an obsession with wanting to stay thin/skinny.I’m a 64-year-old male. Just looking for some tips on getting away from my way of thinking of being very thin; It started when I quit smoking 11 years ago and didn't want to gain weight. I wasn't truly overweight. Just a small gut. My fear of putting on weight escalated to where I lost a significant amount of weight and it isn't so much of the weight, its more of my way of thinking. For 10 years I burned an exceptionally large amount of calories a day, every day doing cardio at the gym. My thought was; "the more calories I burn, the more I can eat." I finally had to stop the cardio since I had tried to simply cut back but couldn't do since I had become addicted to it. I have since returned and just doing some light lifting and focusing on ab work.I also recently weaned off from a certain prescription medication which had suppressed my appetite, although that was not the reason I was taken it. Now my appetite has come back and I’m fighting my thought patterns and I’m depressed about eating. For most of the last 10 years, I have been preoccupied with being as thin as I could be. Since I stopped the that medication and my appetite returning, I have put on some weight (my wife and daughter thinks I look better since she felt and had others asked her if I was alright, due to my weight. She said some thought I had cancer, of course I didn’t think I was that bad but I know my way of thinking may have been since it cause depression if I gained a few lbs. ) and I’m still depressed and preoccupied over not wanting to gain weight.Also, I use to weigh myself 5 times a day and would document my weight. This was doing my excessive cardio days. Now I do weigh my self once a day. Even one or two lbs one way or another can have an extreme effect on my mood.
column9: Hello and welcome wanz44. Your post has been edited to adhere to the community guideliness. Users are not allowed to post specific weights or calories. The guidelienss can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Thank you and please continue posting.

column4: I am not sure where to go from here
column5: Hello,I am hoping that I can get some positive feedback or advice and perhaps get a bonus in maybe helping someone else who struggles like me along the way :). I grew up with overbearing parents, we only spike German in the house growing up, but English everywhere else to "fit in."  I speak 4 other languages but those two were those everyone fixated on.  I started with my eating disorder because I was very isolated growing up. I rode horses since I was 3 years old and those were my friends.  My family was very critical, my weight, appearance.  I was healthy weight for my height.  But as my dissatisfaction with my family grew so did my disinterest in eating. I got down to a dangerously low weight and was hospitalized.  8 years later I still struggle with lack of interest in eating, sometimes I go 3-4 days and then I'll eat a cracker.  It's not that I am trying to starve, i don't even feel hungry, it's just I don't have an interest in eating. Am I just a weirdo? :(Please help xoxo :)
column9: Hello Horsegal18 and welcome to the forums. Your post was edited in order to adhere to the community guidelines. Users are discouraged from sharing specific weight numbers. Please check out the community guidelines when you have the time. They can be found here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Thanks

column4: Scared of upping clories after months of restriction as not underweight
column5:
Hi, my family nickname is Ninny so I'll go by that!
To cut to the chase, I have been restricting for about 5 months I think? It started as a 'lifestyle change', (calorie counting, meal planning, clean eating) to lose my excess weight. I used to be around, so I thought I was just dedicated to becoming healthier, that I was in control and would just stop once I was in the middle of a healthy range. I knew my behaviour wasn't normal but thought it was okay because I couldnt be anorexia, I was overweight and actually needed to lose weight. I thought that, in the end, I would be able to up my calories a load and eat banned foods again without any anxiety. But it'll never be the 'end', as I can see now that I really wanted control over something when I could no longer cope.
My behaviour and attitude towards food quickly became what one may call orthorexic. I became scared of eating out or drinking, cut out foods and groups, would scan food labels and plan ahead, only eat 'my' food on my tableware that I cooked myself. I developed fear foods, routines and obsessions then I joined the gym in the last 2 months and combined restriction with overexercising. I lost my period, cold, exhausted, in pain, sleep less, lost interest in hobbies or friends, messed up hunger signals, after-meal tummy aches at times. What you would expect from malnourishing your body.
This is mainly because I still have a lot of fat stores around my tummy and legs.
I would honestly like to lose more weight but I know I can't keep doing this to my body and living in fear of food. I have signed up for therapy to challenge these behaviours and thoughts BUT I always had in mind that I would just incorporate 'banned' foods back into my diet.
As I looked up recovery, I didn't understand how it would apply to me - not being underweight or anorexic. I don't need to gain weight. But it hit me that I do need to repair body damage, and that requires energy and calories.
So a big fear of mine, is that since I have damaged my body and metabolism is that if I raise it to fix my body - that I will gain fat and weight.
My therapy won't be for a while so I don't know what to do, I still want to restrict and exercise but I don't want to make all my effort be for nothing if I'm just sabotaging my weight loss.
I would like to be normal - to eat normally and overcome this and feel good again - but also not have such a disproportion amount of belly fat for my size. Will upping calories make my weight overshoot even if I don't need to gain?
column9: Hello and welcome Ninny. Your post has been edited for content as you violated the community guidelines by posting numbers and detailing behaviours. Please consult the community guideliness located here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Thank you and please continue posting.

column5:
Hi community!
I am writing this post with very mixed feelings. I don’t know what I expect from it so I am just going to leave my words here as they come out. I am 30 years old and I have had an eating disorder for half the time I have lived. It started out with bulimia accompanied with a bunch of other self distructive behavior like cutting as well as depression when I was 14. I was in psychotherapy for about 5 years but never talked about my eating disorder. I have lived a pretty normal life so far if you want to call it that way and it never seemed that I have a really big issue really. I met the love of my life 2 years ago. He’s the first one I have ever talked about my eating disorder. Now I see how big my problem is. He sees it every day and deals with it and supports me in every way he can IF I am willing to get better. And I am. But I am afraid as well. I don’t know how or where to start and how it is going to affect my body. Also I do live on a remote island with no doctors or clinics or whatsoever at the moment so I neet support that is available from a distance. Please help, I need it.
column9: Hi hyacynthe,Your post was edited to comply with NEDA community guidelines which can be reviewed here:https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column5: Hi everyone,I'm a 28 year old woman from Australia, and new to this community. I have been suffering from binge eating and compensatory exercising for some time now, and although I am in treatment, I still have a long way to go. I'm wondering if anyone would be interested in being mutual supports - nothing major, just someone to message to say, "I feel like bingeing but I'm going to do X instead because ..." or to send each other messages of support, tips, etc. Please let me know if you'd be interested. :) Much love to you all.k
column9: Hello struggleisreal.Unfortunately, these forums are meant primarily for persons 18 years or older. We suggest that you reach out to an adult that you trust for help concerning your symptoms/struggles. Thank you for your understanding.

column4: Old enough to be your mom...
column5: I am introducing myself, but also asking for advice.I am 44 years old, and have had some manifestation of an eating disorder since about age 9. At age 9, I was more than xx overweight, and when a doctor told me I was obese, it triggered a Lenten giving up of certain foods that then turned into anorexia. In high school, I was severely bulimic, relying on laxatives to keep my weight in check. This lasted through college, when I began exercising to maintain my weight. I tried OA for many years, and had some semblance of recovery--at least I would eat regular meals and exercise just once a day--but then I got pregnant. During that time, the OA members in my town gave me a hard time. I know they were trying to intervene for good, but they pushed me away (or I pushed myself away). Post pregnancy, I had about a year or two of utter freedom. I was (an am) absolutely in love with my son and my husband has always been very supportive of me. I had a year or two of bliss. But I never went back to OA. I do go to therapy and I am regularly seen by a psych nurse for medication (anxiety and depression). On the surface, there is nothing wrong with me. I have a job that pays very well. I have job security (for the most part). I generally love what I do, but sometimes I feel trapped. I fantasize about having other jobs (again, despite having an enviable position). I live in a great town with great schools. Last year, I had a bout of severe, severe depression. I'm not sure, but I think this in part triggered more anxiety around food for me. I have not lost a lot of weight, but over the last few months I have begun restricting again, avoiding social/food gatherings even more than usual, and I've started exercising in addition to the hour of cardio a day I do. This morning, I considered calling an RD. I have never been honest with my doctor about having any eating disorder. I haven't been completely honest with my therapist and psych nurse about food. I'm terrified of eating more because my weight is normal, but according to my calculations, I should be eating at least xxx more calories. I'm ashamed, too, because, let's face it, I'm 44. I don't feel like there is a lot of support for middle-aged women. And someone who looks like me with my life is a tough sell. I look fine. I don't look like I restrict at all. Yet here I am.Thanks for reading.Mercedes
column9: Hi dsprte4hope,   We wanted to let you know we edited your post to remove certain numbers and words. Please review our Community Guidelines to ensure we can continue to keep this forum a safe space for all of our users: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelinesThanks for sharing your experience and please keep posting!

column5: Hi, I have recently gotten out of treatment and expected everything to be blue skies from their on out. I didn't struggle much during the first couple of weeks, my dads house was the easiest to eat at. But my moms has always been a war zone. Her and i don't get along well, and with her choosing my food, it has made a road bump in my recovery. I have relapsed 3 times while being in her house and I just cant seem to get back on track with eating without needing to purge. I just need to get out of this cycle. Can anyone relate? Share how you got out of the binge>purge cycle?
column9: It sounds like what you have gone through must have been extremely traumatizing and scary. There is help out there for what you have experienced. I would like to refer you to this site to chat with someone about your incident if you would like. They have an online chat system similar to ours, it is free, secure and confidential. Just click on this link if you want support for that: https://ohl.rainn.org/online/

column5: After 13 years, I'm finally trying to actually recover. Currently I am seeing a therapist and dietitian once a week at a location that is 40 minutes away (it's the closest option I've got). I've been going for almost two months now and from day one we have all agreed that I need a higher level of care. Things aren't progressing and they have really pushed me again to move up in care. Unfortunately, I just don't know how to do that at this stage in my life. I just started a new full-time job in March and I'm a single mother to a three year old. My family lives 3 hours away. There is an eating disorder treatment center that is also 40 mins away from where I live that my current therapist and dietitian are affiliated with. Obviously that would be my best choice. I've done the intake and they are recommending PHP. I can't take that much time off of work right now. They have an IOP program that I could probably manage my schedule around but I have no idea what I would do with my daughter. Has anyone had to deal with figuring out childcare on top of treatment? She goes to daycare but they close at 6 and IOP ends at 6:30 (plus the drive back home). I can't imagine what it would cost to hire somebody to pick her up and care for her until I got home. I'm on my own in this... I feel so lost and helpless.
column9: Hello, Welcome to NEDA forums! We would like to let you know that we edited your post to take out the name of the treatment center. As per our guidelines mention of specific treatment centers is now allowed on the forums. Please keep posting!

column5:
each day i wake up feeling worse
just want all of this to be overand i don’t want to die, i have a lot of dreams and goals but getting better seems so unrealistic at this point
column9: Hi mazzystar08, welcome to the NEDA forums. We're sorry to hear you are having a hard time. If you want to speak to someone, please call our hotline at 1-800-931-2237 Monday - Thursday, 9 am - 9 pm and Friday, 9 am - 5 pm. Our trained hotline associates can talk about treatment options, support groups in your area, or give additional resources for recovery. Please remember you are not alone, and continue to post here for continued support!

column5: I think my life's over I am desperate to 'make' myself better for my husbands sake and my own health but I just am struggling to 'do' what I need to do. My husband thinks I just want to stay unwell forever and this has already taken over 7 years of our lives and I've wasted all that time and his. He says he is heading for a nervous breakdown and I feel so bad. I think he would be better and happier off without me but I  don't want to lose him. I am just not doing enough to convince I want to get better and I don't really know if it's me doing this or the ED. what else can I do? I am going to lose everything all I do is cry cry and cry and feel sorry for myself. I know I'm running away from being responsible, I need to take charge of destiny put I'm afraid, very afraid. I wish I could just switch on the magic light bulb that will make everything alright I want to go back to what we once were but I think I'm too far gone to get my old life back. Please help any body out there with any thing I can do to change my mindset to be more positive and take responsibility love Suzexx

column4: I think my ED might've led to a food intolerance, and it's making me sick. Help?
column5: I've been sick to my stomach most days and I'm starting to think it's a food intolerance, or something of that nature, but I'm having all these ideas, and I seriously doubt I'm eating too much, though I could be having trouble tolerating foods due to restrictive behaviors (I've cut my calories quite a lot the past few months). But when my stomach bloats, it feels like weight gain, and then I treat my body even worse. I feel like I've pulled a muscle in my stomach or like it's full of water. I know we're not doctors here, but any thoughts? Has anyone here developed food intolerances as a result of ED (I've been told it's common)? I just don't want to get more sick from the stomach stuff and loss of water. I don't need an excuse to track foods more either, though I could benefit from some variety....help?

column4: Not sure what my next step is...
column5:
Hi all,First I wanted to say I am very glad to have found this website. Reading others stories and experiences has made me realize I am not alone. I wish that nobody had to go through this stuff, but it helps to know I am not alone in what I feel.Anyways,
I have always struggled with self image just because I have always been slightly overweight. A little while ago I started a diet, and I lost a lot of weight. I am still considered slightly overweight, but am close to being average weight. But, I became obsessed with losing weight. I started restricting and binge eating. After those binges, I participated in compensatory behaviors. I also feel very guilty after these binges and cry and sometimes have even punched myself in the leg out of anger. I have missed my period the past few months, have had low grade fevers off and on, stomach pains/cramps, and I always feel tired and sometimes dizzy. Is it possible to have multiple eating disorders at the same time? Also, I do want to seek professional help because I am scared for my health, but I also do not think it will help because I feel have ZERO control of my habits. Does this even seem like an eating disorder? I just feel lost. And hopeless.
Thanks for reading and I look forward to hearing from you.

column4: Not sure what to do about my symptoms
column5: I'm an 18 year old male and have struggled with body image + restrictive eating + binging as long as I can remember. I have never even been overweight. I restrict. I also overexercise. I'm well within a healthy weight range . Over the past few months, I have been extensively tracking and restricting my caloric intake. I recently I recently started indulging in tracking behaviors.  However, even the stress of tracking all these things and restricting myself continually is killing me. I feel like I'm going crazy. Today I deleted the app and told myself I would eat whenever I was hungry, since logically, I know I shouldn't need to worry about my weight. Started sweating and almost had a breakdown. Still freaking out. I don't know how to handle letting go of my rules like this. Anyone with similar experiences who could help with some advice?

column4: I don't understand what's going on.
column5: For the past few years, I have been very conscious about everything I consume. I counted calories everyday and made sure I consumed a specific amount of calories, and if I ever went over that, I would head to the treadmill. Lately, after my high school graduation, I've felt a bit lonely. I have been eating so much (more than ever before, specifically at night) and I don't understand why. I eat when I am not even hungry. I am eating till I feel so badly about myself. I eat by myself when no one is watching. I feel so badly after, and I don't eat all day and then binge again at night. I don't know why. I don't understand why. I don't know if there's something wrong with me. I have gained weight because of this. I think about my weight 24/7. Everytime I consume something, I immediately think about the calories that it will bring to my body. I think about my weight all the time, and how I look.I don't understand. Can someone please help me understand if I'm just going crazy.

column4: So tired of people saying " you don't look like you have anorexia "
column5: My Ed is a newer development and ive been struggling with it a lot . Yesterday i ate junk food and cried all afternoon because i was going to gain weight. Ive been going to a therapist but its not really helping.  I try to be open about it with other people but they always say that i don't look like i have anorexia. I know I'm not bigger but i still see myself that way. I weigh myself everyday. Deep down i want my weight to be less than it is. I feel hopeless and stuck. My parents try to force me to eat which makes me not want to eat more. I hate i have to live like this. I really want kids one day and it sucks knowing that if i dont fix this i can't. It just feels like my life is revolving around food.

Part of me felt happy for doing this but the other part of me didn't. I hate this problem and want it gone forever.

According to our Community Guidelines, we do not permit advertisements and outside links. You can find our guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column4: i don't know what to do
column5: i'm currently in a struggle about reaching out for help. i don't know if i'm overthinking and overreacting or if i should be concerned. i go through stages where i will eat and not think about it and then where i will eat and calorie count and restrict. but i also binge on the weekends and feel guilty and then restrict during the week. i'm in a job where i'm constantly busy and moving around so i typically don't eat lunch and im ok with that. even if i'm hungry since i don't eat breakfast either. for dinner i will usually eat but i try and watch what it is especially depending on what stage i'm in. typically i eat within a specific range of calories per day. people have pointed out how little i eat sometimes but i don't think they meant anything by it and have no idea that i feel like i struggle with food sometimes. i've also been asked lately if i've lost weight but i have because i went from a very sedentary job to an active job and at my sedentary job i did eat lunch most days. i'm tempted to reach out to a coworker but don't want to cause alarm or make a big deal out of nothing or feel like i'm being watched either. has anyone gone through this before? am i just overreacting? i don't starve myself per say but i do have the fear of gaining weight and sometimes eat less than i could or refuse to eat certain foods because of calories/carbs.
column9: Hi ashley_recovery, we removed a portion of your post because it included treatment advice and a personal endorsement for an outside website. Please keep our community safe by reading our Community Guidelines next time you post: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column5: So I have been in treatment for 4 years now but I really still don't have much control when I was 12 years old I taught myself how to purge since then I continue to purge for years and years and years and still remained overweight at 28 years old I went through an extremely stressful time in my life and began to restrict food I lost a significant amount of weight in about 6 months shortly after that someone said something to me that really hurt my feelings I went to my best friend I told her I needed help and we went to the hospital that is where my treatment started I don't think that anyone at the hospital felt that my problem was as severe as it was because for years later I would say 5 days out of 7 I still Purge I don't eat massive amounts of food I'm actually extremely restrictive but unfortunately when I eat a normal meal or maybe two and a day I feel guilty about it and I struggle so much worrying that I'm going to get heavy again that I get rid of normal amounts of food I'm may be in taking a certain amount of calories a day and have been doing so for at least five years if not more I definitely do have bad days and I do have good days but I feel like recovery should be able to maintain for a week at least and I do not have the control to stop myself from eating what I consider bad foods to where I don't Purge I can literally eat one piece of a food item that’s somewhat unhealthy and I'm okay if I eat a normal serving which would be two small pieces I feel guilty even if it's with just healthy foods which unfortunately I have received is very lacking I don't have any maintenance or coping skills and I'm still being very detrimental to myself and my body and I just don't know how to fix it I do not know how to feel okay with what I am consuming even if it is healthy food and even if my body doesn't need it please tell me please please please tell me there's someone else out there with this problem
column9: Hi haywiz5584, welcome to the forums! We wanted to let you know that your post had been edited to take out any weight-related numbers and specific food names as these might be triggering to other forum members. You can find our guidelines here: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines Please keep sharing!

column5: Over the last year I became obsessed with fitness and eating healthily. I was a healthy weight until a 6 week holiday on the other side of the world. I really did not want to go and hated being away from home and my whole fitness and eating routine. As a result of the stress I was barely eating,   and  I lost a significant amount of weight. I couldn’t sleep at night, I felt faint all the time and my heart rate slowed to around 40 bpm. Since getting back from the holiday in January I returned to school and got called in to talk with teachers as my friends were worried about how much weight I had lost. I decided to try and recover, stopped exercising for a while and allowing myself to eat normally. After gaining half of the weight back, I started hating the way I looked and decided to start exercising. I also started cutting back on certain foods. Then I started feeling hungry all the time, binging and restricting them for the rest. Over the last month or so the binges have become more frequent, happening a few days in a row and then me not eating certain foods for around 3days before binging again. I am at a healthy weight now, although my period has been gone for a year and hasn’t come back. I don’t think I look fit anymore and I want to lose the weight again but it’s so hard to break this cycle. I promise myself that I will start eating healthy and working out, that lasts for a few days and then I just binge again. I just want to have a healthy relationship with food, without worrying about everything I eat and then binging and then feeling so guilty afterwards. I have no idea how much I should be eating, how often, or what I should be eating along with exercise to look fit and healthy again. I am sixteen.. What should I do to maintain or lose weight without spiraling into obsession and restriction?
column8: Truce38! We are glad that you
column9: Truce38! We are glad that you are sharing your story here on the NEDA forums. A portion of your post was edited due to the mention of specific numbers and behaviors that may be triggering to other forum members. column4: My parent telling me to grow up
column5: I was in the car and she had looked through my fitness pal app where I had been tracking calories. She tells me I'm a child and at 17 years old... she shouldn't have to babysit me to make sure I eat. She yelled at me in the car to grow up and stop being a child. I'm not trying to be a child. This is scary to me! I can add calories like crazy but fail in my math classes. I feel guilty after eating. I walk miles everyday when I rather sleep. I have to do this or I don't feel good about myself. I'm afraid of what is happening to me... am I really a child because of this? she won't listen when i try to tell her, she just goes through a drive through thinking she has solved everything with one trip. If she won't listen... am I going to be like this forever?

column5: I am new to this site and I am just reaching out until I can get into therapy. I'm not even sure where to begin. I'm not even sure I belong here.I've been unhappy with my body all my life. Everyone thinks I am so small and petite but I don't see or feel it. I go thru periods of restricting and bingeing. In the last month or so, I have been really relaxed and free with my eating. Not counting calories or weighing food. Not being so rigorous with intermittent fasting hours. And eating more of what I want, when I want. Trying to be OK with my body the way it is. The problem is that as soon as I stop with one behavior, I begin another. I feel like I've been doing this for a month, but can't really tell if it's that or just eating normally, since when I was usually hungry and not eating a ton. I've gradually put weight back on too, and I feel disgusted with myself and like I need to start engaging in these behaviors again, but I know that will just lead me back to where I am now. I can't look in a mirror and feel comfortable, even when I am at a weight that is considered to be "underweight". I feel guilty today for eating like crap this weekend. I feel really fat and like my clothes don't fit. I cried while getting dressed this morning after changing my outfit and nothing fits the way I want. I'm bloated and just feel gross. And it makes me feel defeated and like all I want to do is go back. I'm obsessed and constantly take photos of myself too see how I look in different outfits and what not and scroll thru them and compare day to day, week to week, and I can't stop. I spend hours doing this. I just want to wake up one day and not have the first thought be about food or how I look. I want to be a normal person who doesn't have to think about what they eat and what effect it might have on them. I feel like I don't how to live normally and don't know where to turn. That is what has led me here. Thanks for listening.
column9: Hi and welcome to the NEDA forums! We wanted to let you know we edited your post to remove numbers and eating disorder behaviors that could be triggering to our other forum-goers. Please review our Community Guidelines to ensure we can continue to keep this forum a safe space for all of our users: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelines

column5:
hello everyone! ~my name's Mary, I'm currently 15yo.
when i was about 11 yo, i started losing weight, since I've always been a plump child and wanted to finally change something. i discovered healthy food, sports, started losing weight and was extremely happy with my life.
my goal has always been to reach a certain weight and even though i was already thin enough, i wanted to reach my goal weight anyway.
i was sure i'd become happier as soon as i lose enough weight, but for some reason i didn't feel anything when i stepped on a scale and saw a number i was dreaming about. thats where it all went downhill.
i decided i needed to loose more to look better and become happier.
i started eating much less and working out more. i was suddenly extremely scared of so-called unhealthy food and almost had panic attacks if i ate something wrong. my weight was dropping extremely fast, my clothes became baggy, but i wasn't feeling right.
even though my skin was dry, my hands and legs were constantly cold, all my hair was falling out and i was always sad, i still saw a fat girl in the reflection.
thats when i started binging. of course i didn't want to do it, and was always screaming and crying if i overate, but i couldn't cope with it. although i wasn't happy with my weight gain at all, i was looking much less like a skeleton and feeling more energetic.
however, i couldn't stop binging even after i gained needed amount of weight.
its been a year and a half, and now i weight more. i binge almost every day and can't control myself anymore.
I'm scared of going out since I'm sure people are looking at how fat i am and talking about me. my friends and classmates started joking about my weight. i tried puking to loose weight, but i have bad vomiting reflexes and just simply can't do it.
I'm now working with a therapist and have diagnosed depression, eating disorder and social anxiety. neither my family nor my friends understand me and i feel extremely lonely. people are accusing me of faking my depression and just seeking for attention.
i feel like I'm broken and i don't know anyone with same problems in my real life.
I'm feeling suicidal, even though I'm not planning to do anything with myself (I'm actually really scared of pain and thats the only reason), i just don't wanna live anymore. nothing brings me joy, so i just sit in my room watching videos, eating and occasionally going out to the gym (but I'm scared of people there criticizing my body, so sometimes i don't go there even if i want to)i don't know why I'm writing this, honestly. I'm not sure if anything can help me, but I'm trying to take every single opportunity if there is a smallest chance of making me feel better.
thank you for reading this.
column9: Hi Mary,Thanks for reaching out in the forums.  We wanted to let you know we edited your post to remove numbers and eating disorder behaviors that could be triggering to our other forum-goers. Please review our Community Guidelines to ensure we can continue to keep this forum a safe space for all of our users: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/forums/community-guidelinesWe are concerned for your well-being and wanted to share the number of the Suicide Hotline if you need to speak with someone – 800-273-TALK. Please know you are not alone!
